column1: [SAK-7807] Chat tool should allow for emoticons
column6:
Goal:
All users can use emoticons while in the chat tool.
column10: Chat tool should allow for emoticons
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Ready for voting
column48:
An additional request from a user:

Some of the emoticons should be useful as visual cues to students in a chat where an instructor is running the group. e.g. a signal that they should now stop and read the next page, or a signal that they should pause for a minute to think before answering, or that a question is directed at a particular user. When ideas are flowing thick and fast, students don't always distinguish between their instructors attempts to move on to the next part of the session, and their fellow students' latest ideas!
column52: Harriett, It's not clear why you closed this issue. I've re-opened it.
column56: Emoticons are now available in the Forums tool. I have changed this to only include the Chat tool.

column1: [SAK-8059] Resources tool should allow access control at the document level and the user level
column6:
The Resources tool lets you make a particular resource publicly accessible or accessible only by site members. Its "Permissions" panel lets you set permissions across all resources for all site members in a given role.

Some users need finer-grained control of authorization.

Use cases:

  • An instructor makes a folder accessible to students only if they're in a certain section.
  • An instructor makes a particular document editable by two TAs but no one else.

===
Original description:

Resources tool should allow for different access to documents for different users

Allow users to identify who is allowed to access information within Resources based on a drop-down class list. (particularly useful for sharing/collaboration on papers/projects).
column10: Resources tool should allow access control at the document level and the user level
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: This is a little unclear, and could be helped with some use cases. Are the users seeing a drop-down list for each item, or just for the tool as a whole? Could the imagined use cases be satisfied by the permissions widget with the checkboxes?

column1: [SAK-7986] generate usage reports from within Sakai
column6:
Sakai administrators and support staff should be able to easily generate reports from within the system. Reports might include things like:

a) the number of sites created, broken down by project and course (this is currently displayed in the admin view, but requires an extra step of sorting or copying/pasting in another program)
b) the number of sites per instructor
c) the number of instructors with active accounts
d) the number of students with active accounts
e) the frequency of use for any of the tools (e.g., how many sites use a gradeboo or Assignments or Section Info, etc.)

column1: [SAK-7820] Use same WYSIWYG editor throughout both Sakai and Melete Course Builder.
column6:
Use same WYSIWYG editor throughout both Sakai and Melete Course Builder.

The specifics of the requirement are:

Currently, Melete and Sakai use two different editors or at least two different versions of one editor. Also, Vivie Sinou at Foothill DeAnza uses yet another editor, a commercial product. The other important area for the editor is in Samigo, because some testing requires students to use the editor.

Our specific need is for an editor that does two things.

1. Allows for an easy interface for both non-technical people (i.e., faculty and students) who want a WYSIWG interface, and for coders. The current editor does this, but is not very robust.

2. An editor that can easily incorporate math symbols (i.e., Math ML or similar). The largest classes (and thus a big user of online learning) and the largest amount of testing on campus is done by science departments--math, chemistry, engineering, physics. They all need the capability for easy input of equations both in content creation and in testing.
column10: Use same WYSIWYG editor throughout both Sakai and Melete Course Builder.

column44:
Juliette, I need to clarify the requirement. Which of the following comes closest to your intent?

1) Course site creators need the ability to specify a human-friendly site ID.

2) "Sites" and other administrative tools need to show the human-friendly site title instead of just the human-hostile site ID.

3) Course site IDs should be based automatically on metadata about the course and section whose roster feeds the course site. (Note that this requires Sakai to actually know about things like "term", "department", and "course number", which is one aspect of SAK-8037 Closed .)
column48:
Hi Ray,

For Stanford's requirements, #2 and #3 are what we're looking for. We're not sure if we're allowing users to create course sites so #1 wouldn't be high on our list but would probably be useful to other schools. Thanks.

Juliette
column52:

column1: [SAK-7836] Tests & Quizzes - support audio recording
column6:
The Tests & Quizzes tool needs to support Audio Recording as a method for "answering" a question. This is the current method used by all the language classes at Stanford University.

The current method with our CourseWork tool is that an instructor creates a question that can be text-based (that the student reads on screen), or where a video or audio clip is played. When taking the test, the student will read / listen to / watch the "question" and then click a button to begin recording their audio response. For example, a student might read a text prompt, "Say the days of the week" and then click the Record button, speak into a microphone, and speak the days of the week in the given language. The student then clicks Stop, and has the option to listen to the recorded audio, and can re-record it, before submitting it.
column10: Tests & Quizzes - support audio recording

column1: [SAK-8088] Tests & Quizzes - support cross-listed classes by allowing instructor to view grades by class
column6:
In the Tests & Quizzes tool, instructors can currently view scores on a specific assessment by section. We also need to be able to support cross-listed classes, and allowing instructors to view scores by a specific cross-listed class. Two examples of cross-listing:

1. A class is offered under two codes, one for undergraduates, one for graduates. Example: ECON 101 / 201.

2. A class is offered by different departments, e.g. ECON 101 / PoliSci 101

The instructors will need to be able to view the scores of all students who enrolled in Econ 101, then of all students in Econ 201 or PoliSci 101. Similar to View by "All Sections / Section xxx / Group"
column10: Tests & Quizzes - support cross-listed classes by allowing instructor to view grades by class
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Reviewed by Assessments & Tools. This issue is ready for voting from our perspective.
column48:
This needs more fleshing out, I'm afraid.

If the idea is that the current two-level membership hierarchy of "Course Site" / "Sections" needs to be turned into the three-level hierarchy "Course Site" / "Course Offerings" / "Sections", then this effects a lot more places than Samigo and Section Info. It changes Site Info, it potentially changes all of the UI in all the section aware tools, it changes enterprise integration....

If the idea is that external feeds from multiple courses should automatically create site sections which identify the course, then this is incorporated by SAK-7837 Closed and SAK-8037 Closed . But the section aware tools (including Samigo) wouldn't have to change at all. In 2.1, they show a drop down list of named user groups; in this later version, they still show a drop down list of named user groups. Behind the scenes, those user groups are being named and populated differently than in 2.1, but Samigo doesn't know that.

Abby, can you clarify which (if either) of these cases you had in mind?
column52: This is no longer an issue. As long as provider IDs are added to the site for all course offerings cross-listings are available in the Scores page in the View (Sections) drop-down menu.

column1: [SAK-7848] Creation of Local Administrator role
column6:
Provide administrative staff in individual departments (e.g., chemistry, engineering) and professional schools (e.g., law, medical, business) the ability to locally administer Sakai; where locally means administer just the sites in their department or school.

Tasks might involve the following:

-Change course title
-Activate/Inactivate tools
-Change course to instructor-only access
-Inactivate courses
-Copy course content

This would relieve the burden of the central IT team from providing support to the entire campus.
column10: Creation of Local Administrator role
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: I am unsure as to whether this is a new tool. It appears that the capability to do this already exists in Sakai through the realms/role capability. Could you expand on what is different to make this a tool? Or are you asking that the role become a standard role shipped with the core?
column48: I think the difference here is probably the fact that once you give the local Law School staff admin rights they can modify not only Law School sites but any site in the system. That sounds like another requirement, but I can't find it now.
column52:
The idea behind the Local Admin role is that we wanted to distribute user support to individual schools/departments rather than having our central team take on the enormous task of supporting the entire campus. I don't envision this as a new role that's shipped with the core. Yes, I am asking for a sub-administrator role of sort (a super user role but with a restricted set of permissions to administer courses only within one's specific dept. or school).

In response to your comments, Diana, "... once you give the local Law School staff admin rights they can modify not only Law School sites but any site in the system..." local admins only have rights to administer courses within their specific dept. or school, NOT other course sites in the system. This means that Law School can only see and administer Law School courses, Med School can only see and administer Med School courses, Chemistry can only see and administer Chemistry courses, etc.
column56: John, could you describe here (or provide a pointer to a document) how University of Michigan already does this in Sakai by realms/roles, the "Affiliates"? Thanks.
column60:
There is a mechanism using values in sakai.properties to add certain users to class sites for certain units. It depends on the provider id that can be used to connect a class site to the registrar's roster information about a class, and that id having some descriptor in it that maps to a class in a particular unit. See the sakai_properties.doc in subversion or at the DG Development site Resources/Architecture docs folder for more detail. Look for 'affiliates' in the doc.

If a provider id for a class is for example 2006,3,A,Psych,100,001,
the user account of 'jleasia' could be added automatically to that class with a particular role that gives jleasia permission to do most of the things you mentioned.

This isn't the same as giving jleasia admin rights - jleasia just gets to edit the site, and because jleasia is added to any class site that has Psych in its provider id, jleasia then has rights to edit any psych class. At UM, each of our 'departments' (LSA, Engineering, Med School, etc.) has many different possible subject code identifiers. Via the sakai.property values, you can cause jleasia to be added to all or some of the classes for a particular department.
column64: The functionality described in this issue is achievable via sakai.properties, as described above in John's comment.

column1: [SAK-7824] Tests & Quizzes should allow instructor to email student comments about test
column6:
In the Tests & Quizzes tool, instructors need to be able to email individual students comments about the submitted test. Currently, there is a "Comment" field, but that is only viewable by instructors.

It would be ideal if there was a button called "Email" next to each student listed on the Scores page for a specific assessment. The instructor could click the button and have a window open with parts of the email message pre-populated:

To: <Student email address>
From: <Instructor email address>
CC: ... allow instructor to add TA or other email addresses
Subject: Feedback on <Test Title>
Message:
Dear <student name>,

column1: [SAK-8149] Ability for adminstrators to email all or groups of Sakai users
column6:
Administrators should be able to send an email to all users in a Sakai instance, or some subset thereof based on Roles or Site Types, such as to all Instructors or to all users in Project sites. Users should also only get one copy of the email, even if they are members of multiple subsets.

Use Cases:

  • Send an email to all users informing them of an upcoming system-upgrade, the new features that will be available, and associated down-time.
  • Send an email to all Instructors highlighting resources available to them for help with creating their course sites for their next semester classes.
  • Send an email to all project site members announcing an increase in their Resource quotas.
  • Send a message to all users with the "maintain" role in at least 1 site.
column10: Ability for adminstrators to email all or groups of Sakai users

Use case: instructors may upload files/folders for their own use, but not for view by students or other site participants.

This requirement relates to SAK-39464 Resolved , which concerns the ability to make a folder invisible, while making items within it visible.

Jackie

column1: [SAK-7946] Control over which Synoptic Tools appear on Site's Home
column6:
Instructors should be able to decide which synoptic tools appear on the home page and in what order or layout. Synoptic views of tools should not necessarily be forced on a site either just because a tool is being used; in other words, for example, just because a site is using Chat, one should still be able to to turn off the Chat synoptic view on Home if they don't want it.

Places one might consider surfacing a control to enable/disable a tool's synoptic view would be in Edit Tools under Site Info, during the original site set-up process, the Page Order tool, under the tool's options, etc.

column1: [SAK-3876] change instructions/descriptions on Access page in Site Info/ Worksite Setup
column6:
Instructors, TAs, and staff are often confused by the options in the Access options page in Site Info and Worksite Setup. This is particularly true for project sites.

(1) If a site is not published, can it still be listed in the directory? Yes
(2) If a site is private, can it still be made joinable? No, the system won't let you select both options; it defaults to "Display my site in the directory..." when you mark the joinable option.

The descriptions and restrictions could be made more clear. For example, to deal with issue #2 above, the joinable option could be grayed out if the "private" option is selected.
column10: change instructions/descriptions on Access page in Site Info/ Worksite Setup
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Karen, which version of Sakai are you currently using? In sakai 2.1.1 (maybe ealier ?) an unpublished site will not show up in the directory; the Publishe checkbox in Manage Access must be checked and the radio button for "Display my site..." must be selected for a site to show up in the directory (Sites on Gateway page). Also, selecting Private versus Display is independent of joinability in Sakai 2.1.1. You can have a Private site (doesn't show up in the directory), but it is joinable (does show up in the Membership list of joinable sites when logged in). Do you have any suggestions for better instructions, based on how 2.1.1 behaves? Thanks.
column48:
UC Berkeley is currently using Sakai 2.1.

I confirmed that our version behaves as you describe the behavior for 2.1.1.

At this point, my suggestion for updating the instructions is to move the sentence about global access settings down from the Site Status portion of the page to the Global Access portion of the page.

Currently, Site Status (which has the checkbox for publishing/unpublishing a site) has text that reads
"Publishing your site makes it available to the site participants. Global access settings allow you to decide who has access to your site once it is published. You can change these settings later by going to Site Info. "

I would take the second sentence from the Site Status text and move it to the Global Access area so the description is closer to where the action is being taken.

Global Access text would change to
"Global access settings allow you to decide who has access to your site once it is published. Your site can be accessed by those you add as participants. Would you like others to have access to your site? You can change these settings later by going to Site Info. "
column52: Karen, I'm turning this into a Feature Request as there are no new capabilities required here. Its just a case of deciding how to improve the on-page instructions, and probably the context help as well. Let me know if I mis-reading that.
column56: Setting a priority (didn't inherit one as this issue was converted from a REQ)

column1: [SAK-7909] The User Management Tool (In Admin Workspace) needs additional functionality
column6:
The User Tool ( In the Admin Workspace ) needs additional functionality:

1) There needs to be summary at the top of the page that tells the Sys Admin how many users there are (like in the Sites tool)
2) There needs to be additional attributes displayed about the user:
a) A date that the user last logged into Sakai
b) The date that the user first logged into Sakai
c) Roles held by the users
3) There needs to be a way to search based on the attributes above
4) There should be a way to "PURGE" users who have not logged in in XX amount of days
5) There needs to be a mechanism to get a a "broadcasted or emergency message" out to all users or sets of users ( like just the Instructors) currently on the system (when for example you need to reboot the server) or when you install new course management tools.
6) Additionally, needs to be a way to schedule "SYSTEM DOWN TIME" and have it show up on all user's schedules
column10: The User Management Tool (In Admin Workspace) needs additional functionality

column1: [SAK-7829] in year view, remove the dates from a previous month
column6:
In the Schedule tool, in the year view, the days from a previous month appear in gray. This is nice. The issue is that the numbers for the days in the previous month also appear. This makes it seem like there is an event on that day.

We recommend that the numbers that indicate days in the previous month are removed from the year view in the calendar.

For example, a calendar grid showing the month of Feb. 2006 starts with

Jan 29
Jan 30
Jan 31
Feb 1
Feb 2
Feb 3
Feb 4

It would be nice to remove the dates for January. I've attached a screen shot to illustrate the point.
column10: in year view, remove the dates from a previous month
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Sounds like the root problem here is probably confusion in the interface over which days have events; days that are not in a month are more noticably "highlighted" perhaps than days in the month with events in the default skin. Perhaps another solution here is to make sure that days with events stand-out the most visually and the days outside of a month are treated more akin to typlical greying-out; though with some carry-over visual clue for days with events that can be used in a more subdued way on days outside of a month that have events. column1: [SAK-7823] Student site tab names should be based on their section names rather than the course site name
column6:
When Sakai supports external feeds for course site sections, Sakai should identify the site to students by the name of their section rather than by the name of the site.

Use Cases:

  • An instructor has created a course site "Cognitive Science Frontiers". Two externally managed rosters are feeding site membership, one for "Psych 212 LAB 01" and the other for "Phil 312 LEC 02". Both have site sections associated with them. When a student from Psych 212 logs onto Sakai, he sees a tab labeled "Psych 212 LAB 01" rather than a tab labeled "Cognitive Science Frontiers".

(I'm not sure this captures the requirement. See comments.)

===

Original description:

Sakai should allow instructors to combine rosters of two or more sites

Goals:
Instructors can combine the rosters for two or more sites
Sakai will display combined rosters as separate sections in a site
Students tab will indicate the course and section number of the site for which he or she signed up, not the site from which the instructor is delivering the combined content.
column10: Student site tab names should be based on their section names rather than the course site name
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
If I understand it, the only thing this description adds to SAK-7837 Closed is the requirement for students to see a site ID based on a section name rather than on the site name. I've changed the description to narrow it down.

I'm not sure I understand it, though!

1) "Rosters" is ambiguous here. Do you mean that the instructor is combining two external roster feeds into one course site? Or do you mean that the instructor is combining two membership lists from two existing Sakai sites (which may be projects) into one site – that is, treating an internal Sakai site as if it was an external feed?

2) What would happen when a student is in more than one section? They still have to see just one course site tab, right?

3) What would happen if the roster is feeding more than one site? Would the student see two tabs with the same name?
column48: Reviewed by Worksite & Admin Tools.
column52: Also a consideration for support - understanding which site the student is talking about. So if different participants in a site see the site by a different name, there also needs to be the (elsewhere described) capability to get a list of all sites a participant is in, where the listing shows the name they see and perhaps the aliases. This has been a long standing problem at UM too, where the student in a cross listed section (say 002) sees the site name (which defaults to the first section in the site, like Psych 100 001), and is confused about whether they are in the correct site or not.

column1: [SAK-8048] Users should have more information and control over site import
column6:
The import functionality in Sakai site management tools is too opaque. The site administrator can pick a site and some tools, but there's no indication of what the effect will actually be. The import service and interface should support finer granularity. Tool-specific code should give some indication of what sort or amount of data would be imported. In some cases, such as Resources, it may make sense to give the user control over which portions of data will be copied.

Use Cases:

  • An instructor creates a new course site for Chem 101 and wants to reuse material from the previous term's site. She selects "Import from Site", selects the old site, and sees that a Resources import will bring in 3 folders with 120 items, an Announcements import will bring in 0 announcements, and a Tests & Quizzes import will bring in 50 assessments.

===

Original description:

From Site Info there is an option for "Import from site." The system gives no indication that there are resources to import. Even if there is a resource to import it doesn't tell you its been added nor does it give you a choice of resources you want. It just comes back to Site Info. Need a way to tell if there is something in there to add and then notification that something was added. Confirmation similar to the add/ remove tools. 'You have added 6 items.'
column10: Users should have more information and control over site import
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Carleton, the import feature of Site Info is not limited to just Resources, you can import content from other tools as well. You can also select which tools you want to import from, however, you cannot choose individual items to import . It might help if you could provide some specific, detailed use cases to better illustrate the capabilities you're asking for.

It sounds like you may be after mulitple things here, which your use cases should help clarify:

(1) A listing of the actual items in the various tools that are available for import

(2) Selection of which items in a tool are imported, so you can skip some, if necessary

(3) A confirmation of what excatly has been imported in terms of x Resources, y Announcments, z Schedule events, etc.
column48: Since Carleton hasn't yet responded, I guessed at clarification and a use case based on Peter's comment.
column52: Reviewed by Worksite & Admin Tools.
column56:
Additional use case: instructor would like to rebuild a worksite that includes OSP tools and assignments. The OSP Matrix tool provides a way to export/import the matrix, along with assignment references, but the assignment content itself is not included. The instructor would have to archive/import the site, modify and also export/import the matrix. (see SAK-11337 Closed ).

As Sakai grows, there are likely to be more tools providing export/import capabilities separate from the core Sakai tools. The Site Archive tool might provide a way to integrate these as well.

column1: [SAK-7985] Expand options for Schedule/calendar event frequency
column6:
Currently, the Schedule tool does not allow users to add events that occur every Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday. Additionally, you cannot set an event to happen every third Thursday of the month.

The system should allow the user to choose the frequency of an event with some flexibility.

From SAK-1465: A user has requested (UMich Footprints ticket 23284) the ability to schedule recurring meetings on a given day (not date) within a month- for instance, her group has a meeting on the second Thursday of every month. Currently, we cannot accommodate this type of scheduling and users are forced to schedule each meeting separately.

From SAK-6825: Currently, if an instructor would like to schedule a repeating event in the Schedule tool, there is an option to have the frequency every

{ Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Yearly}

.There is no way to set the frequency for a schedule item for every ____ specific day. Within the Daily option, there should be additional options such as checkboxes for the day(s) of the week.

Use cases:
For example, many classes meet M-W-Fri, or Tu-Th, or M-Tu-W-Th, and the instructor currently cannot set up one recurring event for the class meeting.
For example, a user wants to schedule a meeting for every 2nd Tuesday of the month.

The current frequency options do not allow for this (weekly does not work b/c some months have 4 or 5 weeks, and monthly doesn't work b/c that frequency looks at date - e.g. every 5th of the month).

Workaround is to create one weekly meeting for each day of the week – example for M-W-Fri class: create 3 events, one for Mondays weekly for 10 weeks, one for Wednesdays weekly for 10 weeks, one for Fridays weekly for 10 weeks.

column1: [SAK-8079] K-12 Tools
column6:
So far, I have not heard too much discussion about using Sakai at the K-12 level but we, at Marist College, believe there is great potential in this area. We have had some discussions with K-12 groups in our state and are hoping to collaborate with them on some pilot activities next school year.

In talking with these initial contacts, it has become clear that there are additional functionality needs at the K-12 level that would be important to have before Sakai could penetrate too far into this "market". One that has surfaced in our discussions is a "test and quiz" tool that was adapted for K-12 needs (e.g. allowed school wide reporting, supported connections to state standards and school district curriculum benchmarks, etc.).

column1: [SAK-7765] Need for "Melete-like" Rich Content Authoring Tool for Fully Online Courses
column6:
Please excuse any ignorance as I'm still a bit of a "newbie" at this point in time...

Marist College is currently in a production pilot with Sakai (called iLearn at Marist) with one of our many fully online programs. From this experience, it is clear to us that having a "Melete-like" tool that allows our faculty to create "rich media" content for online delivery is critical.

My understanding is that most of the "core institutions" have historically not been heavily involved in offering fully online courses and have primarily used their CMS capabilities to supplement/enhance face-to-face courses. I feel that this has driven the requirement process towards tools and functionality that is needed in this context of use. Although there is a good deal of overlap between tools sets needed for fully online and "web-facilitated" courses, I feel that there are some difference as well. This area is one of them.

Although the capabilities of the Resource Tool is great, we need more than just a place to upload and download files. Instead, we need a tool that allows faculty to place an "instructional wrapper" around those files and digital content that is upload so that the students have a full and rich learning experience in their online courses.
column10: Need for "Melete-like" Rich Content Authoring Tool for Fully Online Courses
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: related to SAK-7892 Closed on structuring content for presentation
column48: Joshua, could you provide some use cases to help illustrate what you're describing here? Perhaps you could expand on, "...we need a tool that allows faculty to place an "instructional wrapper" around those files and digital content that is upload so that the students have a full and rich learning experience in their online courses?" Am I right in interpreting what you're proposing here as being similar to the requirement for a new tool described in SAK-8112 Closed ? If not, how does your version differ? Thanks.
column52: Isn't this requirement well served by Melete?
column56:
Email from Josh Baron:
Our concern at the time (and to some extent today as well) was primarily with the "back end" of Melete and its integration with Sakai. We had some concerns that since it was not a "core tool" that adopting it represented some risk to us as if Foothills did not keep up with releases that we could be in a situation where was needed to upgrade but could not because we had to "wait" for Melete to be ready. At this point, we are no longer as concerned about this issue and thus the comments are not as revelant today as they were last year. Also, the enhancements to the Resources tool has provided us with much of the functionality that we have in our past CMS and thus the critical capabilities we needed are there...

column1: [SAK-8104] allow calendar entries by clicking the interface
column6:
Currently the schedule tool requires users to navigate to a separate window to enter a new calendar event. The norm in many calendars is to click and drag to select the duration of a meeting, or double-clcik a timeframe in the calendar interface to begin adding or editing an entry.

The schedule tool should allow users to click the time the wish to schedule an event to bring up an editing window.

This is similar to functionality available in other calendar tools like iCal, Outlook, and Oracle.

column48:
I think changing the default copyright status is already configurable via sakai.properties:

copyrighttype.count=6
copyrighttype.1=Material is in public domain.
Copyrighttype.2=I hold copyright.
Copyrighttype.3=Material is subject to fair use exception.
Copyrighttype.4=I have obtained permission to use this material.
Copyrighttype.5=Copyright status is not yet determined.
Copyrighttype.6=Use copyright below.
default.copyright=Material is subject to fair use exception.

See page 22 of the sakai.properties document for reference:

http://collab.sakaiproject.org/access/content/group/1097928811887-22636/Configuration%20docs/sakai_properties.pdf

column1: [SAK-7948] appointment sign-up capability for Schedule tool
column6:
Several faculty have wanted to use the Schedule tool to:

  • allow students to sign up for slots during office hours
  • allow students to sign up as discussion leaders for certain weeks during a seminar.

In both cases, it would be nice to have permission granularity within the Schedule tool to allow the site owner to designate certain blocks of time for which students would have "revise" capability. This way, students could modify only certain events in the schedule, rather than having global write or revise permissions in the tool.

Also it would be nice if this revise permission was in effect only for blank fields: once a student has signed up for a slot, others would not have the ability to revise that selection. Only blank fields in the designated time blocks could be "owned" by students with revise or write permission.

Finally, for the office hour option, it would be nice if students' displays of the Schedule list only their selected time slot, not every other student's slot. A lot to ask, I realize; perhaps this type of scheduling tool should be a new tool, which could then export information into the main class Schedule.
column10: appointment sign-up capability for Schedule tool

column1: [SAK-3774] Can't change a part type
column6:
This bug exists in both 2.1.1.004 and also on the nightly qa instances, although it manifests a little differently in each place.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create or edit an assessment.

2. Click on the "Add Part" link in the authoring screen.

3. Add a random draw part (doesn't matter which pool or how many questions you draw from). Save the part.

4. Now edit the part by clicking on the Modify link. Change it from random draw to "Questions authored one by one" and click save.

5. If you are on an instance running 2.1.1.0004, nothing will happen - the screen will refresh and you'll still be on the edit part screen.

If you're on an instance running the most recent build, you'll see error text saying "Validation error: Value is required."

6. Click cancel to get out of this screen (it's the only way.)

7. Now create a regular part, or edit the default part, and try to change it to random draw. The same thing happens.
column10: Can't change a part type
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: (No exception or error messages in catalina.out from this bug.)
column48: Huong, can you also move the hard coded err message to the resource bundle?
column52:
While the validation error no longer appears, there is still a problem with Modifying a part so I am reopening this issue. I have tested this on all 4 servers. Here's the behavior:

1. Create/edit an assessment.
2. Add Part and add Random draw.
3. Edit part by clicking on Modify and change to "Questions authored one by one"
4. View assessment and all questions from Pool selected eariler will be availalbe
5. Edit part by clicking on Modify. Random draw option will now be greyed out/locked and cannot be selected.
column56: This behavior is by design. Once a 'questions authored one by one' type part is created with at least one question inside, (step 3 ) you can not change it to 'random drawn type'.

column1: [SAK-3773] Random draw shouldn't allow you to draw 0 questions from pool
column6:
Random draw in authoring currently allows you to draw 0 questions from a question pool, and to draw from a pool with 0 questions.

When you take an assessment with a part like this, you get an empty part screen,and can't navigate out of it using the next and continue buttons. (You can get out using the TOC link or the "save and exit" button.) No exception or error message appears in the log or on the screen.

Suggested fixes:

  • Question pools with 0 questions should not show up as available to draw from.
  • The same validation that prevents you from drawing more questions than a pool has should also check to make sure you're not drawing 0 questions.

column1: [SAK-7819] Schedule or Appointment Sign-up
column6:
A way for instructors to designate time periods for which students can sign-up for appointments or to participate in activities. For course sites and certain "private" activities (e.g., office visitis), if this information is presented in Schedule, then it will probably be necessary to hide the names of Students that have already arranged appointments (or to not even display those "closed" slots any longer) to other Students.

Use Cases:

  • The instructor would set 'office hours' on the calendar and students could sign up for blocks of time.
  • Instructor would set "seminar" on the calendar and students could sign up as discussion leaders for certain weeks.
  • Students are often required to fufill requirements outside of class over the course of a semester that require scheduling and coordination, such as participating as subjects in pyschology experiments, community service blocks, and so on.
column10: Schedule or Appointment Sign-up
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Added to 'Schedule' component.
column48:
Some implementation suggestions from REQ-255:

In both cases, it would be nice to have permission granularity within the Schedule tool to allow the site owner to designate certain blocks of time for which students would have "revise" capability. This way, students could modify only certain events in the schedule, rather than having global write or revise permissions in the tool.

Also it would be nice if this revise permission was in effect only for blank fields: once a student has signed up for a slot, others would not have the ability to revise that selection. Only blank fields in the designated time blocks could be "owned" by students with revise or write permission.

Finally, for the office hour option, it would be nice if students' displays of the Schedule list only their selected time slot, not every other student's slot. A lot to ask, I realize; perhaps this type of scheduling tool should be a new tool, which could then export information into the main class Schedule.

column1: [SAK-7964] Ability to delete dropboxes, and to delete multiple dropboxes at a time.
column6:
If a participant drops a course after the initial Drop Box folder creation their Drop Box remains in the Drop Box tool. Our students often 'shop' many courses at the beginning of the semester, leaving behind their DropBoxes when they do not sign up for a course. The mess left for the instructor to clean up is problematic.

The instructor has to print a list of 'registered' students for the course, then go to DropBoxes and delete any non-registered students.

Is there a way to flag a certain 'role' of site member that can then purge the dropboxes and leave the other dropboxes intact?

From: SAK-7808: Ability to select multiple DropBoxes and delete.
From SAK-6240:
Desired behavior: If folder is empty and If user is not on access list then folder is hidden/deleted both here at the site, and also on the Other Sites interface for the user.

Users shouldn't be allowed to post to a site that they don't have access to, even in this "private" space at the site. It's confusing for students (I see classes I'm not in nor never have attended in my Other Sites list). And it's confusing for instructors (Who are these people?! and why can they post to my site?!). We don't expect them to manage official access to the roster, and the roster should affect the dropbox.

If a drop box isn't empty and the person no longer has access to the site, then that's between the instructor and the student.
column10: Ability to delete dropboxes, and to delete multiple dropboxes at a time.
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column44: Done for voting.
column48: Combined with SAK-7808 Closed
column52: Combined with SAK-7808 Closed , SAK-6240 Closed
column56:
Patch to fix the issue.

If a user is no longer a member of the site and the dropbox is empty then it is removed. Otherwise it's left as it is.

column1: [SAK-8148] Documentation: Need web services architecture document
column6:
This document needs to provide an overview of how web services work - their general model and patterns and how to creat new web services and modify existing web services.
This should also have a section on web services security.

A Web service is a software system designed to support interoperable machine-to-machine interaction over a network. It has an interface described in a machine-processable format (specifically WSDL). Other systems interact with the Web service in a manner prescribed by its description using SOAP-messages, typically conveyed using HTTP with an XML serialization in conjunction with other Web-related standards.

Web services are a specific type of application built on an architecture that offers the promise of allowing any client to work with any server, anywhere in the world. Getting computers to speak with one another has been a goal of programmers ever since the second computer was built. RPCs. or Remote Procedures Calls, have been used for many years, but RPCs are mostly are "tightly-coupled," built specifically for applications on specific platforms and in specific languages. Any changes made on either end may create havoc on the other end. "Loose coupling" refers to a relaxed dependency between two applications. Web services provide a loosely-coupled way of communicating between two programs.

These documents should be located in docs/architecture to allow easy access for developers.

column1: [SAK-7785] Documentation: WSRP Architecture Document
column6:
We need an architecture document that describes how WSRP is architected and how it works in Sakai.

WSRP (Web Services for Remote Portlets) is dynamic plug-ins for portal pages. WSRP defines how to plug remote web services into the pages of online portals and other user-facing applications. This allows portal or application owners to easily embed a web service from a third party into a section of a portal page (a 'portlet'). The portlet then displays interactive content and services that are dynamically updated from the provider's own servers.

The docs should be located in docs/architecture and included in the Sakai distribution. Developers would be able to reference these when working with WSRP in Sakai.

column1: [SAK-3771] Add page control to list view of schedule
column6:
From CT-471 where this was first reported:
A long list of schedule events "breaks" the browser (e.g. browser gets stuck or times out trying to load the page) when viewing the schedule as a list.

A possible fix would be to make the default "show" "Activities for this week" which matches the default view for the calendar view. Showing only one week's worth of activities in a list is also far less likely to break the browser.

Since the default of the initial view is week, better to default to the week. Better still would be to make the list view show whatever segment of time was shown when they switched from day, week, month, year view to list view. So that if they were looking at the month view and went to the list, they'd see the month in the list view. Or if looking at a year view, they'd see the year's events when switching to list view.
column10: Add page control to list view of schedule
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

When the users've switched from day week month or year view to list view, the list view shows the same segment of time.
E.g, if users were viewing Month view for March 2006, when they switch to the list view, they see:
the filter displays: custome date range
The date range is from March 1 2006 to March 31 2006
Events list contains those from the above range.

Since the default page of Schedule tool is week view. So when first time the users go to the list view, they will see the events in weekly range, supposed they come from week view to list view directly.

The other features of list view are not affected. Users can still go see All acitivies, Today, This week, This month.. and etc by changing the filter. The wording of "default" is removed from the choice of "All activities(by default)", since it is not working as default filter any more.

column1: [SAK-7951] Administration of site roles and permissions needs UI and performance improvements
column6:
Currently, Sakai administration is divided between Users (for managing user accounts), Realms (for managing role-permission-user mappings in a site or template), and a set of overlapping site management tools including Site Info, Sites, and Worksite Setup (for browsing sites, creating a site, attaching roster feeds to a course site, setting up tools for a site, adding members to a site, managing ad hoc user groups, and importing content). (Course sites also have Section Info.)

Legacy user and site tools are addressed elsewhere. The administrative functions of Realms also need improvement.

1) Performance is slow when there are a large number of sites.

2) There's no direct relationship between a site's realm and the site. Instead, the site ID is buried in the realm name. There needs to be easier ways to locate the desired realm. For example, site metadata such as term, title, and created-by might be included as sortable or searchable columns in the listing.

3) There should be some direct UI link between the sort of administrative functions in the site management tools and the sort in Realms.

===

Original Description:

Improve admin tools:

  • improve performance; response time is often slow when the system contains a large numbers of sites
  • improve search capabilities
  • improve sorting/filtering capabilities

The admin tools are often slow when the system contains large numbers of sites. It is hard to find a realm when only some part of the site name is known - site and realm tool each contain search functions that would be useful in the other or are missing useful search capabilities (search for a realm by knowing part of a site title for example, or search for sites a user has created). We need to be able to sort/filter by term in the admin in the admin tools as well.
column10: Administration of site roles and permissions needs UI and performance improvements

column1: [SAK-8089] Need easliy configurable grade scales and mechanism to present a given scale to instructor in a particular site
column6: The gradebook supports a letter grade scale currently that is hardcoded. An institution will want to use scales appropriate to their institntuion which may be different. There may be many scales, each used for a different type of course site (e.g., each school may have a different scale, or there m ight be a scale used for freshman classes different from sophmore, or different scales between Lecture and discussion sections, etc.). There needs to be an easy way to add scales to gradebook, perhaps via sakai.property settings.
column10: Need easliy configurable grade scales and mechanism to present a given scale to instructor in a particular site
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Since grading scales vary from instructor to instructor wouldn't it make sense to include them on a gradebook by gradebook basis rather than in sakai.properties?
column48: Assigning to Kyong-Jee for review.
column52: I was thinking that the sakai.properties would include all the 'legal' gradescales in use at an institution, but that for a given gradebook, the instructor would pick one.
column56: Ready for voting
column60:
Just a quick clarification: the current Gradebook scale can (and has been) modified to meet local institutional requirements. Instructions for doing so in either a intra-tool or inter-tool way can be found in the source distribution:

sakai-src/gradebook/xdocs/add_custom_grade_mappings.txt

In the longer term, however, we're hoping for a much better way to accomplish these modification and many others.
column64: A new mechanism to make it easier for institutions to define grading scales was delivered in the Sakai 2.2 Gradebook.

column1: [SAK-37240] Calculated questions
column6:
At the moment the calculated question type is missing in Samigo, i.e. the ability to have questions which contains variables, a method of setting the range of those variables and the number of questions to be generated of that type.
eg. what is

{x}

+

{y}

where 0 < x < 100 and 0 < y < 50

i.e., integration with equation editors.

column1: [SAK-35049] Integration with Respondus
column6:
Respondus (http://www.respondus.com/) is a program one uses in creating and managing exams that can be printed to paper or published directly to Blackboard, WebCT, eCollege, ANGEL and other eLearning systems.

i.e. you can create quizzes in Respondus, connect to your CMS from within Respondus and upload the questions to a particular course. You can also download questions and quizzes from the CMS.

It also has the ability to export quizzes in IMS QTI format.

Our stats department are heavy users of Respondus and if it possible to have the same ability to upload questions/quizzes directly to Sakai it would make the migration easier.

Going the IMS QTI route is possible, but only if the questions do not contain images. This is filed under another requirement. ( SAK-36411 Resolved )

Also see http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1891
column10: Integration with Respondus
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column44: A good Respondus-like tool not only allows the instructor to upload questions using a simple syntax directly from a Web page, it also allows the instructor to append questions to an existing question set or overwrite that set. At our school instructors prefer to use the Respondus-like tool over the GUI question builder for editing questions because question creation/modication proceeds much faster. We use Respondus with WebCT's assessment tool but what is even more popular with our instructors is having a Respondus-like tool built directly into one's assessment tool rather than having to install a local client.

column201:
So, some questions I have about the fix implemented in 2.8:
1). Will the Respondus-created QTI 1.2 import multiple choice questions correctly (currently they import as short answer)?
2). Which Respondus question types are supported, specifically?
3). I would assume one could export from any of the Respondus supported personalities, save as Respondus QTI 1.2 type, and then import to Sakai. Was this tested? Respondus 4?
column205:
Hi Laura,

Please see my comments below:

1). Will the Respondus-created QTI 1.2 import multiple choice questions correctly (currently they import as short answer)?
Yes.

2). Which Respondus question types are supported, specifically?
All the types that exist in Samigo. They are Mulitple Choice, True and False, Paragraph, Matching, Short Answer, Multiple Response.

3). I would assume one could export from any of the Respondus supported personalities, save as Respondus QTI 1.2 type, and then import to Sakai. Was this tested? Respondus 4?
I am not sure what do you mean by personalities. Samigo takes the zip output from Respondus and process it. We didn't test in Respondus 4. I believe it's Respondus 3.5. But if you would like to help with testing against Respondus 4, that'll be good.

column1: [SAK-8050] Glossary tool
column6:
In some disciplines and courses, getting to grips with new terminology is difficult for students.

Online glossaries can assist this process. A Glossary tool would enable instructors and/or students to add or comment on glossary entries, search the glossary, and retrieve glossary definitions in various ways (e.g. through the web UI, email or SMS).

Usage data could be used to inform presentation (e.g. display by most frequently accessed words), and for instructor feedback.

More complex uses could involve using the glossary to overlap course content, highlighting words which are defined in the glossary so that users can access popup definitions, and/or integration with tools such as the wiki (e.g. a macro such as

{glossary:someword}
column10: Glossary tool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: I added this to the Melete component since we have functionality in WebCT where a glossary entry can be hyperlinked to content, or used standalone.
column48: Basic Glossary functionality is now available through the osp.glossary tool, as of Sakai 2.2.0.
column52: As this type of functionality is now available I will close this issue. Bugs or Feature Requests can be posted in the regular Sakai project against the "OSP: Glossary" component.

column1: [SAK-7884] Search for users widget
column6:
Sakai should provide support for a consistent "user search" widget. This widget would allow users to search for other users and user-related information, where such information needs to be input in a tool; for example, finding users in order to add them to a site. The searchable content and results should be able to include any basic user information that is stored in Sakai or to which Sakai has access through an external provider; however, it may only be necessary to present a sub-set of that information in any given search context. The sub-set may also need to be limited based on the searcher's role and/or site type in order to satisfy privacy concerns. The results of the search should also enable the seacher to easily choose a user or group of users(or the context-appropriate piece of user information, such as email address) and use it as input for the tool.

Use cases:

  • When adding users to a site, you may know the user's name or only part of their name, but not their username, and you need to search a directory of users to find the username. Once you have it, you want it entered into "add user" field.
  • Similarly in Section Info you may need to search for users for which you only have partial information to add them to a section.
column10: Search for users widget
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Individual privacy comes to my mind. When we did our LDAP enterprise directory (not related to Sakai), we had to allow individuals to hide certain bits of information (home address for instance) from internet and intranet view. There's potentially a lot of information that can come through an SIS feed. I suppose if you already have a University intranet policy of what can be displayed (core data like campus id,first name, middle name,last name), that would be applicable to what could be returned to through the search widget. If you could return MORE information that what's available from an intranet directory search that could lead Sakai to be abused for searching.

column1: [SAK-8121] Sakai should support authoring of public web pages
column6:
Currently, the public face of a Sakai installation is the special "Gateway" site, and the public face of a Sakai site consists of a few pieces of data shown inside the "Sites" browser. Existing out-of-the-box Sakai tools aren't well set up to provide the kind of flexibility needed for easy production of "normal" web pages.

Sakai needs some web content management capability that is nicely integrated into Sakai's structure and organization.

Sakai should be able to produce an organization's public pages in addition to private site-oriented and personal pages.

Use Cases:

  • The installation administrator creates a set of publicly accessible HTML pages describing their organization, including uploaded graphics. Visitors to that Sakai deployment see those pages before logging in.
  • An instructor creates a course site and then adds a publicly accessible page, giving an overview of the course and providing links to interesting publicly accessible resources on the site. Non-site-members browsing the list of active sites see a link to that course site's public page.

===

Original description:

The Gateway page is pretty lame in general. This is one of the reasons that Sakai cannot be used to support www.sakaiproject.org. Sakai needs a content management capability that is nicely integrated into Sakai's structure and organization.

The basic use case is to use Sakai to produce an organization's public pages in addition to the private site oriented and personal pages.

Some technologies to consider include http://incubator.apache.org/graffito/ and http://hypercontent.sourceforge.net/.

column1: [SAK-7879] Add Support for JSR-170 (Java Content Repository)
column6:
Sakai should support JSR-170. This would allow Sakai to import content from repositories which are JSR-170 compliant and possibly allow content systems to display Sakai content as well.

JSR-170 or Content Repository API for Java (JCR) is a specification for a Java platform API for accessing content repositories in a uniform manner. The specification was developed under the Java Community Process. The objective of JSR-170 is to provide a standard content repository API facilitating vendor neutrality and interoperability. JSR-170 specifies a standard API to access content repositories in Java independently of implementation.

This is a long term effort and will need to be fit in within a sequence of significant framework changes. The rough approach should be to first evaluate possible solutions/implementations looking at Jakarta JackRabbit or other open source alternatives.
column10: Add Support for JSR-170 (Java Content Repository)

column1: [SAK-8147] Consistently use global action action links as tool navigation between pages.  Currently, these buttons have different models in legacy tools and newer tools.
column6:
Conistently use global action links as tool navigation between pages. This will allow users to build a consistent mental model about getting around in Sakai.

Allow users to use the global action links to move around to different pages within a tool in a consistent manner. Legacy and newer tools act differently. In new tools, the global action links (at the top of the page) are persistently available and take users to each page within the tool. In legacy tools there are a variety of results, sometimes they are used for navigation and others times they are used for actions. The global action links change depending on what on page you are in within the tool.

Analysis will need to be done to understand the models and behaviors in each of the legacy tools and a new design

column1: [SAK-3765] UTF-8 Chinese doesn't store correctly under T&Q (Samigo) (SAKAI 2.1+ORACLE 9 or 10)
column6:
Under Sakai 2.1+Oracle 9 installed with out-of-box settings, Samino seems not
storing UTF-8 Chinese char/text correctly.

When entering/pasting UTF-8 Chinese text in a text field (under the Rich Text Editer)
during the process of creating a MC type question, the Chinese displayed correctly
before pressing the Save button; but after saving the question, the Chinese no longer
display corrently.

Here's a simple test, (with a single Chinese char in 3-byte UTF-8 – E9AB94 (Hex), or with
any multi-byte UTF-8 text):

  • Run T&Q tool in a course site
  • Create a new question pool
  • Add a MC type question
    • In the field of Question Text, enter/paste the 3-byte UTF-8 encoded Chinese char
      (At this point, Yyou should be able to see the correct Chinese char display.)
    • Save the new question item and then check on the Chinese again
      (At this point, it doesn't show the Chinese correctly.)

This has been tested under the nightly2 Sakai server of "SVN trunk on Oracle 10g (trunk/sakai)", and it has the same problem!

BTW, Sakai 2.1+HSQLDB setups don't have this problem. (Tested under the nightly2 server of "Maintenance Branch (branches/sakai_2-1-1) on HSQLDB" and other local Sakai+HSQLDB servers, no such problem!)

column1: [SAK-3764] sakai.properties file contains language dependent strings that should be moved into individual tools' resource bundles (I18N)
column6:
The sakai.properties file should not contain language dependent strings. These should be moved into individual tool properties files, where they can be translated and loaded based on locale.

Currently, the following tools use the following sakai.properties values:

1. coursemanagement: termterm.*
2. worksite setup: iconNames.*
3. sitesetup: noEmailInIdAccount*, emailInIdAccount*
4. legacy news: news.title
column10: sakai.properties file contains language dependent strings that should be moved into individual tools' resource bundles (I18N)
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column44:
Fixed as of r6424.

Couple of values have been moved from sakai.properties into different bundle files:

1. termterm.* for CourseManagementService, into coursemanagement.properties in legacy bundles;

2. iconNames.* used by Worksite Setup tool, into sitesetupgeneric.properties in legacy bundles;

3. noEmailInIdAccount* and emailInIdAccount.* used by Worksite Setup tool, into sitesetupgeneric.properties in legacy bundles;

4. news.title used by Worksite Setup tool to set default News tool title, into sitesetupgeneric.properties in legacy bundles;

5. bottom.copyrighttext used by portal, into sitenav.properties in legacy bundles;

6. copyrighttype.* and default.copyright, used by Resources tool, into content.properties in legacy bundles.

If you have done localization work on those values in sakai.properties already, you might need to consider update the related bundle files accordingly.

  • Zhen
column48:
Reopening the issue. Need to re-think about the approach.

Comments from Glenn:

"Moving strings from sakai.properties to a resource bundle causes problems. When someone installs Sakai, the goal is to be able to just modify the sakai.properties to customize the installation, and not have to touch ANY other files, such as web.xml files, components.xml files, or property bundles. These files are buried in the Sakai source code, and it's best if we don't have to mess with the source code to use Sakai.

The goal of being able to customize and use Sakai without modifying source has to be balanced with the goal of supporting localizations, where it makes sense.

But I have to wonder if localization makes sense for these items. Terms, for instance - a non-english Sakai installation can set the terms to a localized set of strings in sakai.properties - is the full resource bundle approach needed here? And are we supporting per-user presentation of terms, or should it be installation wide? In fact, does the software even work if the term value is set from a per-user string? Are there cases where per-user localizations just do not make sense, such as the News tool title - in a multi-lingual installation, would the site creator's preference really have precedence over the other end users? That would be the case if the News tool title was picked from a resource bundle based on the site creator's language preferences.

The bottom line is that sakai.properties is easy to modify; resource bundles are part of the source code and are not. Very careful consideration needs to be made for each of these changes; do they really need (per user) localization, or is a site-wide setting appropriate. And for values that are created by one user and then seen by other users, does the creating user's language preference really make sense to inflict on all other users.

It may even be possible that we need a new mechanism here - one where resource ids are used in certain places in the system that are respolved with a sakai.properties like bundle; one in the sakai.home, outside the code base; a bundle that Sakai installers know about and are expected to make changes to, and then to localize the changes to the language choices they want to support."

Comment from Chuck:
"Here is a possible solution - just a thought starter.

First - there is no instant, trivial, perfect solution here - properties set a lot of things.

I suggest that there are two basic categories of properties we have:

(1) Properties that patch things like Spring injected values deep in some XML place

(2) Properties that we get through the ServerConfigurationService

For (1) we do not have much choice to solve. But for (2), we have a lot of control Since these properties are loaded by Sakai code and retrieved by Sakai from Sakai code, we can teach "Sakkai" code about localization.

We could have a set of sakai_en.properties, sakai_de.properties in addition to the sakai.properties all in the same location (sakai.home)

For those properties going into ServerConfigurationService, we read all of these alternate property files and keep all the variants for all of the languages.

When ServerConfigurationService is called - it consults locale information and returns the right property.

VERY IMPORTANT CAVEAT.

We will have to go through and decide what properties can safely be set in this manner. For example, some low level configuration thing like where to store resource bodies would function REALLY bad if it stored resource bodies in a different spot on disk for spanish speakers than for danish speakers. Especially when a german speaker tried to download some PDF.

You get the idea. For those elements that are truly display elements - this works swell. We may find code that pulls in a propert at init time - that we will have to fix. But this gets us a way to move forward."
column52:
r6424. changes noted above were backed out later. I think at this point,
noEmailInIdAccount* and emailInIdAccount.
and the bottomcopyright text are coming from bundles, but the rest are still controlled by sakai.properties values as those changes were made earlier.
column56:
David Roldan Martinez wrote:
In sakai.properties there are four references to static web pages that are used into the following classes:

legacy\tools\src\java\org\sakaiproject\tool\content\ResourcesAction.java(1988): String webdav_instructions = ServerConfigurationService.getString("webdav.instructions.url");
legacy\ools\src\java\org\sakaiproject\tool\web\IFrameAction.java(228): rv = StringUtil.trimToNull(ServerConfigurationService.getString("webcontent.instructions.url"));
legacy\tools\src\java\org\sakaiproject\tool\web\IFrameAction.java(193): rv = StringUtil.trimToNull(ServerConfigurationService.getString("server.info.url"));
legacy\tools\src\java\org\sakaiproject\tool\web\IFrameAction.java(200): rv = StringUtil.trimToNull(ServerConfigurationService.getString("myworkspace.info.url"));

These pages, as the rest of the Sakai contents, should be i18ned depending on the user preferences. Instead of including one property string per language, my proposal is to add to the url of the HTML document the language suffix. For example:

rv = StringUtil.trimToNull(ServerConfigurationService.getString("myworkspace.info.url")) + ResourceLoader.getLocale().getLanguage();

and store in the same directory the following pages:

myworkspace_info.html
myworkspace_info_es.html
myworkspace_info_cat.html
myworkspace_info_de.html
.....
In this way, the translating the html page will be enough as you take the language suffix from language user preferences stored at ResourceLoader.

And I should probably add copyrighttype.x. So I do agree with D. Martinez issue about the static web pages.

column1: [SAK-8085] Specify a grade scale based on points
column6:
Currently it's only possible to specify a grade scale based on a percentage. Users need the specify the number of points rather than the percentage as this allows for different usage and grading styles

Instructors would enter in the total number of points possible in a course, then enter in the lowest possible points needed to get an A+, A, A-, ect . . .The pecentage would automatically calculate.

To illustrate how you should set up the Grade Scale, let's assume that a total of 1000 points is available for your class and that you are assigning grades in the following manner: students who earn 980 points or more (98% and higher) receive an A+, students who earn 930-979 points (93% < = percent < 98%) receive an A, students who earn 900-929 points (90% < = percent < 93%) receive an A-, etc. Below is an example of how the Grade Scale would look:

A+ 980 98%
A 930 93%
A- 900 90%

The ability to assign only whole letter grades should also be possible:
The following illustrates how the grade scale would look if you assigned only whole-letter grades. Here is an example: A for 900-1000 points, B for 800-899, C for 700-799, etc.

A+
A 900 90%
A-
B+
B 800 80%
B-
column10: Specify a grade scale based on points

column1: [SAK-3763] Ability to change names of Course Sites
column6:
There should be some way for Instructors to be able to edit/rename the title of their Course Site, similar to how this can be done with Project sites.

Having this tool at the point of course creation and also withing the site setup tool as well.
column10: Ability to change names of Course Sites
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Jimmy,
you can control which types of sites allow users to change the title using a sakai.property. By default, only project sites allow this (though admins can change any site title using the Admin Sites tool).

From the sakai_properties.doc:

  1. for worksite setup

titleEditableSiteType.count=1
titleEditableSiteType.1=project

Controls end user editing of site titles. Titles of sites with types specified by the titleEditableSiteType.n property can be changed by roles with site.upd permission. If a site type is not specified by a titleEditableSiteType.n property, the title field on the Edit Site Information page is a display only field

Just put this in your sakai.properties
titleEditableSiteType.count=2
titleEditableSiteType.1=project
titleEditableSiteType.2=course

column1: [SAK-3762] editable and removable assessments after being published
column6:
A nice feature would be to allow greater flexibility when creating quizzes. Once a quiz is created in Core Assessments, there is no way to change the settings or assessment (was "template") once it has been published (was "applied to a test.")

Once an assessment is published but the instructor wants to make a change, (was "
If the original template used does not allow editing (which is the case with the default template)"), then the instructor is required to key in all questions and answers for a second time to create a new test with the same questions. This wastes the instructors time by having to recreate original exam with new settings.

A setting that would allow changing of assessments (was "Templates) after the Assessment is published (was: "created") would be nice.

A setting that would allow a published test's setting to be "tweaked" in case of mistakes or at least allow changing a setting after exam is "retracted".

An option to completely delete an exam even after it has been published would be a good option as well.

usability issue
column10: editable and removable assessments after being published
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: usability issue
column48:
I updated the wording of the description to be more precise because it's not Assessment Types (formerly known as templates) themselves that allow/disallow editing, but what is allowed once an assessment is published.

The ability to edit assessments after being published probably needs to be a tool property that can be set by institution, not in an Assessment Type.

Please correct me if I'm wrong.

column1: [SAK-7954] Resources tool should provide field for description, allow for user ordering, and allow for availability dates.
column6:
The resources tool should provide a field for an instructor to fill in a description of the document, or to enter instructions on what site participants should do before, during or after reading/viewing the file. The field should accommodate about three paragraphs worth of text.

Instructors should be able to set uploaded documents/files in resources in whatever order they choose, rather than having documents appear in alphabetical order.

Instructors should be able to set availability/visibility dates for documents/files in resources. They should be able to upload a set of documents to the resources tool and then be able to set dates at which the document becomes "visible" to students, and a date at which the document becomes "invisible"--ie., at which point the student can no longer access the document even though it is still in the resouces tool.

column1: [SAK-8086] Gradebook Statistical Display
column6:
Provide statistics

Provide meaningful statistics on data entered in the gradebook for instructor and student review. Instructors should be able to specify whether or not students have this ability. This would be something that isn't displayed initially, but could be displayed.

At a glance, Instructors can see how the class is performing. If students have access, they can compare their performance to that of the class.

For students, the instructor should be able to see - at a glance -
1) Running grade as a letter (grade calculated based solely on assignments that have a grade entered - 0 vs null)
2) Running grade as a percent
3) Total points
4) points possible (which could vary from student to student depending on what assignments have entered grades)

In addition, on an assignment basis the following should be calculated and displayed
1) Average
2) Median
3) Highest grade
4) Lowest grade
5) Standard deviation

All viewable on the same screen - right now the average can be viewed, but none of the student specific data is there for easy comparison.

column60: Our instructors would very much like to see running grade calculation. Most of them tell students "you have an A until you lose it" and seeing their cumulative grade start at an F and climb is inconsistent - most instructors don't show the calculation for that reason.

column1: [SAK-8127] Instructors should be able to re-use section/group definitions
column6:
Many different sites, with different memberships, may share an organizational hierarchy of sections and groups. There should be a way to re-use a set of section or site group names across sites without having to recreate the groups each time. This might be done by importing section/group definitions from an existing site, for example.

Use Cases:

  • An Instructor is teaching 5 sections of the same class (Speech R110) and he consistently uses the same names for groups in his classes (e.g., Informational Speech, Demonstration Speech, Impromptu Speaking, Persuasive Speech and Commemorative Speech). Each time he creates a site, he imports these group names. The instructor then assigns the new site's students to the groups.
column10: Instructors should be able to re-use section/group definitions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Kristol, could you provide some use cases to illustrate the goal here? Thanks.
column48: For example, if an Instructor is teaching 5 sections of the same class (Speech R110) and he consistently uses the same names for groups in his classes (e.g., Informational Speech, Demonstration Speech, Impromptu Speaking, Persuasive Speech and Commemorative Speech), then it would be beneficial for him to be able to easily import these groups into each site rather than taking the time to create the same groups in a multitude of sites. Only the shell of the group would import (i.e., the name) and the instructor could then enter each group and assign the necessary students to the group.
column52: Interesting, so basically its re-using the organizational hierarchy or groups in a new site. Sort of like re-using the categories and topics from Discussion in a subsequent semester, but not the actual discussion messages from the students.
column56: Reviewed by Worksite & Admin Tools.
column60: I wanted to add to this requirement the ability to import the group membership, along with the group definition, if desired. We have a number of situations where groups persist beyond course boundaries, and conduct their work in each class as a member of the same group.

column1: [SAK-7774] Import should allow instructors to replace existing items with imported items
column6:
Goals:
Instructors can choose to replace existing items with imported items rather than always adding imported items to the data that's already there.

(Effectively, this combines cleaning out existing tool data with importing. It implies that tools which support "import" and "export" should also develop support for "replace".)

Use cases:

  • An instructor wants to refresh parts of their course site rather than creating a new site. She chooses to import from another site's Announcements, Assignments, Discussion items, Resource items and Schedule. However, instead of having the relevant data be added to existing items, she selects the tool-by-tool option of overwriting the current data with the imported data.
column10: Import should allow instructors to replace existing items with imported items
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Kristol, what sort of items did you have in mind here? Could you provide some examples by way of use cases? Thanks.
column48: So, without adding an additional requirement of items that a user needs to be able to import, I'll try to explain this requirement in more detail. Currently, instructors can import Announcements, Assignments, Discussion items, Resource items and Schedule items. However, when an instructor imports these items, the items are added in addition to the items that have already been created in the site. Our instructors would like the ability to say that the items they are importing should replace the items that currently exist in the site rather than being added in addition to those items. Basically, they want to be able to choose whether the items should be added to or replace the existing items.
column52: Thanks, that makes it easier to understand.
column56: I added components to indicate the extent of the requirement.
