column1: [SAK-3635] Resources / permissions on sub-folders
column6:
Test this on production as well as Nightly2.

If a user wants to set a permission on a subfolder in Resources to be viewed by another role besides student, they have to set the main folders permissions, which will give students permissions to see that folder/files in Resources. There is no way to set the 'read' different on a sub-folder then there is a main folder.
column10: Resources / permissions on sub-folders
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Jim, can you take a look at this? We received a report recently from an instructor who is frustrated by the behavior of the 'read' permission in Resources. Here's the situation:

An instructor would like to grant 'read' access for a sub-folder to 'Assistants', not 'Students', while still allowing 'Students' to access top-level Resource items and/or other sub-folders.

With the current permissions structure in Resources, this scenario isn't possible. If an instructor has granted 'Students' the 'read' permission for the top-level folder, the instructor may not deny the 'read' permission to a sub-folder. However, if an instructor had the ability to change the permissions for a sub-folder, the instructor could grant 'Students' 'read' access for the top-level folder and then deny them 'read' access to a sub-folder. Is this a workable solution? Please let me know if you need any additional information. Thanks!
column48:
Josh Baron from Marist College here...

We are preparing for our first production pilot in a few weeks and are working with faculty to get their courses ready and have encountered the same frustation but within a different context.

We are running fully online courses and it is important that the instructors beable to "release" content in Resources at specific times and not have it all open and available at the start of the course. If they could control the "read" permission on subfolders this would give them the capability of removing read access until the appropriate time when they wanted to allow students into the subfolder.

Let me know if we can assist.

Thanks, Josh
column52:
Kristol,

The functionality you described will be possible when we make resources group-aware. That is scheduled for 2.2, I believe. But I know of no way to accomplish what you suggest until then.

Jim
column56:
Josh,

That is not currently possible, but a number of people have requested that. There is a requirements ticket about that. Please see http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/REQ-214 and add your comments if this doesn't cover your need. You may want to add yourself as a watcher to that ticket so you will know when it's being discussed.

Jim
column60: This ticket describes the current desired behavior in the resources tool. This will likely be changed more in line with the desired behavior described in this ticket when we implement groups/sections in the resources tool. A site maintainer will then be able to define a group within a site and give that group of users access to certain resources without giving access to other users of the site. But until those changes are specified and implemented, there's no way to accomplish what is requested here.

column44:
Andrew Thornton recommended upgrading to mysql connector version mysql-connector-java-3.1.12-bin.jar, which resolved the problem. Was previously using 3.1.10, which apparently miscalculates the length of strings with multi-byte chars.

The release notes for future Sakai releases should be updated to recommend using the 3.1.12 mysql connector.
column48: Lance, who can help with updating the mysql-connector version in the docs, etc.? I think its probably too late to try to squeeze this into 2.1.1 and test it sufficiently, but we can get it into trunk for future releases.
column52:
The mysql connector version is a deployment decision for mysql sites, i.e. it's not in SVN.

The release notes since 2.0.1 have recommended a specific connector version (3.1.10), so what needs to be done is update release notes (I've mailed Clay Fenlason about that).

I don't know what connector version is being run on the QA servers. Ideally the connector version run on the QA servers should be the version recommended in the release notes.

I cannot reproduce this problem on the mysql QA instance (2.1.1_003), but that server seems to have another related problem with utf-8: some chars are being converted to ?. For example, pasting in the contents of the attached wikichar.txt file into a rwiki edit window and saving leads to:

?quoted word?

instead of the original rounded single opening & closing quotes.

Maybe this should be a separate issue or assigned to the QA server maintainers to check.

column1: [SAK-7000] Standard Calendar Widget(s) for Date-Time Selection
column6:
A specification needs to be developed for a uniform calendar widget for picking date-time in Sakai tools. A completely uniform solution may not be feasible, however, as different presentation technologies (e.g., JSF, Velocity, RSF) impose different limitations on the implementation of the UI. This effort should, therefore, include guidelines for adapting any uniform spec to the limitations of the different presentation technologies.

Currenlty Sakai tools such as Schedule, Assignments, OSP, Tests & Quizzes (Samigo), and Section Info all use a different approach. The attached document points out some of the differences in how the calendar widget works in these tools.

It might be worthwhile requiring the use of a "uniform" Sakai calendar widget for Provisional Tool status, once one exists.

The spec should also provide support of basing the date format on the user's locale, as selected in Preferences (which can impact both format and what the first day of the week is, e.g., SAK-8128 Closed ), only valid dates should be presented (e.g., no leap-days in non-leap-years, no September 31st), and when selecting a date range it should be possible to enforce the hiding or graying out of inappropriate options for the end time based on the start time settings (e.g., SAK-12373 Closed )
column10: Standard Calendar Widget(s) for Date-Time Selection
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Attached document Vivie describing and displaying the 4 different behaviors.
column48: The attached document points out some of the differences in how the calendar widget works in several Sakai tools. This requirement would change the style guide suggestion for the calendar widget and create a Sakai JSF widget which can be shared by all tools that use calendaring.
column52: There is some good discussion on this topic in the sakai-dev list around mid-October 2006. An important point to take into consideration here is that a single uniform calendar spec may not be implmentable in all the different presenation technologies used in Sakai (e.g., Velocity, JSF, RSF). A nice goal for this requirement would be to develop a good, single uniform spec, plus additional specs for each presentation technology that take into account that technology's limitations.

column132: Stephen do you happen to know where one might find documentation on the localization, accessbility, etc. requirements or specificiations used in building the RSF data widget?
column143:
Further details from Antranig in the email below:

—

Date: Thu, 3 Jan 2008 05:21:08 +0000
From: antranig@caret.cam.ac.uk
To: Daphne Ogle <daphne@media.berkeley.edu>
Cc: "Hancock, Kristol J" <khancock@iu.edu>, Harriet Truscott <harriet@caret.cam.ac.uk>, 'Sakai UI UI' <sakai-dg-ui@collab.sakaiproject.org>, "fluid-work@fluidproject.org" <fluid-work@fluidproject.org>
Subject: Re: Date widget

Hi - really glad to see Fluid is preparing to devote some design cycles
to this widget!
Directing all towards the original requirements page for the date
widget started by Kathy:

http://confluence.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/RES/Date+widget+improvements

You can see all the discussion there, and also try out the templates
for my implementation which is still up at

http://ponder.org.uk/RSFComponents-test/faces/test-components-index

You can grab the markup for the templates at

http://ponder.org.uk/RSFComponents-templates/content/templates/yahoo-date.html

to be used in any design work that you would like to do from here.

Probably the biggest work that would need to be done to make this
widget usable in the other display technologies would be to rewrite
the logic used for handling user timezones onto the client side
rather than the server so that we can save on AJAX trips. Although
we could do without this by just deploying a single "standard widget"
webapp into Sakai this would be a bit awkward.

Another issue seems to be that many locales (Denmark, South Africa, etc.)
are complaining that the standard JDK locale information is not correct
for them. We need to think about some architecture for overriding/patching
this, hopefully in a scheme that is not too Sakai-specific.

Cheers,
Antranig.
column150:
The requirements were synthesised from the "Date widget improvements" page in Confluence at http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/RES/Date+widget+improvements. The design mockups and alternatives were the starting point, continuing with requirements collected from the comment thread, in particular these points of Jim Eng's:

2) Could this be on one line with fewer internal labels? It would be nice if it was more compact.

3) One of the issues with many of the current text-entry widgets is the ambiguity of dates in the first part of the month (say the 1st through the 12th). What if we validated dates and displayed them in this format (appropriate to the locale): 16-Jun-2006 ? If a user enters 1/2/2006 in South Africa, we'd accept it and display it as 1-Feb-2006. In the states, we'd accept it and display it as 2-Jan-2006. Hmmm. Go ahead, shoot that one down quickly if you like. But think about some alternatives.

4) Seems like the biggest challenge here is dealing with that ambiguity. We have at least three things to think about: what are the localization settings on the host sakai server, what sakai preferences have been set on the server for the current user, and how is the user's browser and/or OS configured. The latter point has to do with the fact that many date/time widgets use a client-side Javascript Date object to validate and reformat user inputs. The user may be on a different continent from the sakai server (take collab, for example).

The RSF widget has now been through a couple of rounds of accessibility and usability evaluation and the irritating timezone bugs have been gradually ground out. There are various routes for making it available in other view technologies, which we are now starting to discuss on fluid-work.

column1: [SAK-3630] Incorrect resize=yes in portal code (should be resizable=yes)

Help and popup web content are not resizable. This is because the portal code uses resize=yes, where it should be using resizable=yes.

column1: [SAK-3629] Macros for spaceid and worksite title
column6:
It would be helpful to have macros to display the spaceid and worksite details, for use in index and navigation pages.

For example, at the moment

{index} starts with "Index of <spaceid>" where <spaceid> is often an arbitrary siteid like "/site/0123490198401131/" of no intrinsic value to wiki users.

It would be preferable to remove the spaceid display from {index}

and create macros such as:

{spaceid} {worksiteinfo:title} {worksiteinfo:description} {worksiteinfo:shortdescription}

It would then be possible to combine these with

{index} in an Index page or view_right or something, such as:

Index of {worksiteinfo:title}{index}

to give a more meaningful header.
column10: Macros for spaceid and worksite title
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

The worksite title

{worksiteinfo:description}

{worksiteinfo:wikispace}

The space of the current wiki space

Also

{index:|nohead}

will cause the index to be emmited without the
Index of xxxxxx
paragraph

column1: [SAK-3626] 5-minute warning popup can break timed delivery
column6:
Observed on both PC and Mac, IE and Firefox, oracle and mysql stable instances. (haven't tested hsql yet).

When you're taking a timed assessment and the timer reaches 5 minutes left, a javascript popup appears to tell you so. If you click to close the popup immediately, most of the time there is no interruption to the timer. It may skip back or forward a few seconds.

If you wait longer than 10 seconds or so to close the 5-minute warning poupup, the timer immediately expires, no matter how much time was left on it. You also get an extra "Javascript must be enabled!" popup.

column48: Margaret - I tested this out in an experiment to fully understand the issue. I saw the javascript error if I waited a bit before closing the pop p. The timer appears expired (red) but keeps counting down. Once I navigated to teh next question, the timer was green and counting down correctly. Is this in line with what you are seeing?

column60:
Tested by leaving the 5-minute popup up on a timed assessment up for several minutes and seeing what happened when I finally clicked it. The timer bar turns red, as it should, and moves to where it should be. Delivery isn't interrupted or ended early.

Tested on qa1-uk and qa1-us, with IE and FF on the PC and with Mozilla on the Mac.
column64:
I've been able to re-create the problem using IE running on WinXP with version 2.1.1 of Sakai.

I start a 10 minute exam. Anywhere between 4:45 and 4:35 time REMAINING I get the 5 minute warning message. If I wait more than 5-7 seconds before clicking the OK button one of two things happen:

1) The test immediately expires and kicks me out.
2) The clock jumps ahead or back by as much as a minute but then continues to work as designed.

This is a rather serious problem for us as students are getting kicked out of exams before the end of their allotted time and are getting very frustrated.

FYI, Josh

column1: [SAK-3625] remove confirm page for file upload questions can break timed delivery
column6:
WINXP IE, FF and Mac IE so far, testing others

When you click the remove link next to an uploaded file in delivery, you go to a confirmation screen with "remove" and "cancel" options. If you stay on this screen for more than a few seconds, one of two things happens:

1) If the assessment is timed, sometimes the timer pauses for as long as you're on this screen. The student can use this to halt the timer during delivery.

2) More commonly, when you exit the screen you get a blank delivery page (see screenshot) and Sakai believes you have exited delivery. You can retake the assessment and the timer will have continued counting down in the interim. That's good, but the blank delivery page is confusing and looks like a much more serious error than it is.

column48: Today, I'm seeing the timer-pause behavior instead of the blank-page behavior on all 3 nightly instances. The timer stays paused for as long as you are on the remove-confirm page.

column1: [SAK-3623] when you use the  'select all' check box, and later when you unselect one or more of the files/folders the select all check box still remains checked.
column6: If you select all the files/folders in the resources by using the 'select all' check box. Later on when you try unselect one or more of the files/folders , the 'select all' checkbox should automattically be unchecked. That doesnt seem to happen in this case.

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: The checkbox referred to here checks and unchecks all of the individual item checkboxes, but its status has no effect on which items are considered checked or unchecked. There is no logical reason for that box to be unchcecked after an individual item is unchecked.
column48:
One more thing: In earlier designs the select-all/unselect-all function was to be implemented as links labeled "select all" and "unselect all" or something similar. These links were to toggle between the two settings when clicked. Select-all was to be the default value. A user could select every checkbox, but the select-all link would still show. Clicking select-all was supposed to cause all the checkboxes to be checked and toggle the link to unselect-all. Unclicking individual checkboxes was not to change the status of the unselect-all link, even if all the individual checkboxes were unchecked individually.

We changed the design to use a checkbox to toggle between select-all and unselect-all based in part on other interfaces that use a checkbox for such a purpose. One such interface is the horde webmail interface (http://www.horde.org/). It uses a checkbox to check/uncheck individual checkboxes associated with individual mail messages. The only user action that changes the status of that top-level checkbox is checking or unchecking that box itself. We believe that is the correct behavior for this checkbox.
column52: Jira behaves similarly as well with its checkboxes for bulk operations. Chcekcing or unchecking the top-level checkbox toggles resets the state of all the checkboxes below, however, checking individual checkboxes below has not affect on the top-level checkbox.

column1: [SAK-3619] Assignments / ability to grade assignments with no submissions
column6: When an instructor goes to grade an assignment, and a student has not submitted that assignment, there is no way to give that user a 0 as they do not show up. Can we make it possible to give scores to students in the assignment tool which have not submitted the assignment?
column10: Assignments / ability to grade assignments with no submissions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: At one point in time, I thought Sakai created a blank submisstion once the "Accept Until" point had passed. That gave the opportunity to mark a 0 for the student. That doesn't seem to be the case currently.
column48:
Peter, I too thought that this was the case.

On a related note, we are finding that instructors have a rather critical need at times to enter in grades for students who have not submitted anything via the assignment tool. For example, after the assignment is retracted students can sometimes still get permission to complete it (we had a student with a death in the family who got permission to submit it very late). They will e-mail the assignment work to the instructor who will grade it but then have no way of entering the grade since the student has not hit the "submit" button. The workaround requires that we change the retract date and then go in as the student to hit the submit button. This is not ideal and requires a chunk of time to address.

I think that it would be best to give the instructor more control over this function and allow them to submit grades even if there is no student submission.

Just to note it, I think this is a general issue in terms of user experience. All too often the system restricts what instructors can do and makes assumption about what they will need/want to do...I would prefer to approach this more through setting defaults up but then give instructors control over changing them if needed.

Josh
column52: Zhen, do the changes you've been making in 2.4 for non-electornic submissions perhaps also resolve the problem for the use cases outlined in this issue?

column64:
Just want to let you know that I found a work around to the problem. I also want to warn you that there is always going to be a lag in the timer bar.

0. studnet click at Next / Previous (e.g.)
1. answer persist to DB - we sync the time with teh server
2. prepare next question for display - we sync teh time again
3. next question shows up on the browser
Margaret: I put some println there and you should be able to see there is time difference bwteen 1 & 2. There is always going to be a lag between 2 & 3 and so teh timer will always be behind the actual time. This lag (2 & 3) will show up unmistakably after uploading a file AND when you proceed to the next question. Maybe it is because this is a JSF datatable there to display the upload files and taht takes more time to compile - I don't know.

Daisy
column132:
Tested on qa1-uk (mysql) and qa2-us (oracle). The timer still pauses while a file is being uploaded or removed in delivery, but it corrects itself immediately afterwards. I don't have to visit another page for the timer to reset itself.

Looks good!

(It's still not the greatest idea to create a timed assessment with file upload questions, since it takes about 2 minutes to upload a 3MB file on the qa servers. If we think instructors are likely to actually do this, we may want to put in some warning text in authoring. But it doesn't seem likely.)

column1: [SAK-3612] Ability to make attachments to assessments, parts, and questions
column6:
A critical feature for us is the ability to attach binary content to assessments, whether that means the entire assessment as a whole, a part of the assessment, or an individual question.

While it's possible to link to content uploaded elsewhere (or include an image) using the WSIWYG editors, there's no easy way in Sakai (that we've found) for those attachments to only be available to the assessment taker and only once they've started the assessment. Even if Samigo managed attachments like the other tools (using the /attachment - security through obscurity "feature") it would still be a step in the right direction.

What are other schools doing for workarounds?

column1: [SAK-3608] User without "section.role.student" flag can take assessment.
column6: As discussed on the sakai-assessment list today, a role which has the assessment.takeAssessment permission but does not have the section.role.student flag is still allowed to take published assessments. This can be confusing for the instructor because the scores won't show up until the user who took the assessment has the section.role.student flag.
column10: User without "section.role.student" flag can take assessment.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
In terms of the user experience, I would say:
A student who is in a course should be able to take published assessments for which they have access.
An instructor should be able to see the scores from any submitted assessments.

I'm not totally clear on what the necessary Realm configurations must be, but this is the expected interaction and how things should be configured OOTB.

Of course, a sys admin might set incorrect authorizations (especially if they add new roles), but that is the risk you run when you have granular permission sets in a flexible system. Proper technical documentation should be provided for administrators who may be migrating rather than doing a new installation and OOTB default configurations won't help them.
column48:
Samig's grading(scores) pages use SectionAwareness API, thus authrozation in sakai needs to also follow the SectionAwareness rules. Detailed documentation is provided in the Section Info tool.

There was a suggestion to block students from taking the assessment. After some discussion, we've decided it might not be a good idea to block students simply because the administrator has configured the application incorrectly. (note that this should not happen with default OOTB configuration) Therefore, no coding changes are needed at this time. I will close this bug for now. If there are any objections, please feel free to reopen this bug.

column1: [SAK-3607] Calendar widget can't set dates between noon-1pm
column6:
The date settings in authoring each come with a calendar widget that allows you to click on a date and type in a time. Times are 24-hour; 1:00 is interpreted as 1am, and 13:00 becomes 1pm.

However, if you type a time between noon and 1pm (like 12:30) into the calendar widget, it is still interpreted as AM.

Workaround: You can edit the settings fields directly after using the calendar widget and change "AM" to "PM".

Fix: The calendar widget should consistently interpret times in 24-hour time. 00:30 should be 12:30 AM, and 12:30 should be 12:30 PM.
column10: Calendar widget can't set dates between noon-1pm
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: See SAK-3586 Closed for progress going forward on this issue.

column1: [SAK-3599] Allow configurable option to control whether sites of a particular type can be made joinable
column6:
A major problem with class sites is that instructors mistakenly make them joinable. We can improve the wording around the join checkbox, but the larger issue with privacy for students in the site and with content are still there. A sakai.property that controlled whether the make site joinable checkbox showed in worksite setup, for a particular site, would allow institutions to make decisions about how they want to allow or not allow sites of given types to be made joinable.

Since this would be a new control that could impact existing installations, the default should be to behave as it does now out of the box, so the config properties would be used to prevent joinable for a given site.
Something like
disable.joinable.types=2
disable.joinable.1="project"
disable.joinable.2="course"

if you didn't want to make either project or course sites joinable. Then, if nothing was added to sakai.properties, Sakai would behave as it does now and all sites could be made joinable. If you put disable.joinable.1="course" in, then joinable would be disabled for course sites only.

Note that for special cases support could still make a site joinable using the Admin Sites tool, even if joinable was disabled for course sites as per above.

The setting would control the UI in Site Info when revising a site as well.

column6:

2: The default display of scores should be 2 decimal places. For
example, 1 out of 3 is displayed as ".33"
column10: Make storage and display of assessment scores consistent
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column44: Assigning to Luke for review.
column48: Not a new tool, removed from "New Tool" component
column52:
Assignments, Tests & Quizzes (Samigo), and Gradebook currently store
and display point-based assessment values in different maners. A
recent discussion in the email thread in sakai-
assessment@collab.sakaiproject.org called "Consistant grading
( SAK-2848 Closed )" illustrated why this is a problem and had the above
consensus.

To see the majority of this thread/discussion please see the
attached file (above) consistentGradingTread.rtf.

-----------------------------
Original Description:
Assignments, Tests & Quizzes (Samigo), and Gradebook currently store and display point-based assessment values in different maners. The recent discussion in the email thread in the "Sakai DG: Assessment Tools" illustrates why this is important and suggests appropriate resolutions. Exisiting assessment tools and any new related tools should conform as best as possible to a standard approach to point-based storage and display.

In particular, the developing consensus for storing point-based assessments values appears to be doubles. By storing with as much percision as possible, then round-off errors are less likely to generate confusion for students and instructors.

For the display of points, the developing consensus is for two decimal places. This will help also help reduce confusion related to round-off errors. For example, 0.33 or 0.67 perhaps more clearly indicate you received one-third or two-thirds of a point, respectively, on an assessment item. A desire for configuring the number of decimal places, at the system-wide and/or site-wide levels, has also been expressed; as has the desire not to allow such configuration.

column1: [SAK-3588] Validate specific end-date for recurring event on Frequency screen where it can be corrected.

3. When you click on "Save Frequency" no alert is displayed and you are back to the main schedule item view.
4. If you then try to "Save Event", you are presented with an Alert.

The end-date should be validated when the "Save Frequency" button is pressed. If it fails validation, then a "warning" alert (or confimation page?) should be displayed indicating the possibility of an error. The user can then choose to either "Continue" and end up back at the main screen and update the date of the first event; or, they can choose "Revise" and end up back on the Frequency screen and update the end-time of the recurrance. If the user choosees Continue, but then does not fix the descrepency before click on Save Event, then they should get the alert as it happens now.

column1: [SAK-3586] Not properly handling 12:XX conversion to 12:XX PM
column6:
Comment by Nuno Fernandes [23-Jan-2006 08:34] from SAK-1886:

The calendar widget used to select/edit dates, has the correct 00-23 hours format. The problem is the conversion from the widget to the samigo delivery dates text fields (11:00 => 11 AM (OK), 12:00 => 12 AM (should be 12 PM), 13:00 => 1PM (OK)).
column10: Not properly handling 12:XX conversion to 12:XX PM
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Copied from SAK-3607 Closed , as Lydia wanted the workaround in the issue:

The date settings in authoring each come with a calendar widget that allows you to click on a date and type in a time. Times are 24-hour; 1:00 is interpreted as 1am, and 13:00 becomes 1pm.

However, if you type a time between noon and 1pm (like 12:30) into the calendar widget, it is still interpreted as AM.

Workaround: You can edit the settings fields directly after using the calendar widget and change "AM" to "PM".

Fix: The calendar widget should consistently interpret times in 24-hour time. 00:30 should be 12:30 AM, and 12:30 should be 12:30 PM.
column48:
This could be fixed by replacing in sam/tool/src/webapp/jsf/widget/datepicker/datepicker.js, the cal_gen_time2() function:

// time generating function
function cal_gen_time2 (dt_datetime) {
//sakai mod, calculate AM/PM
if (dt_datetime.getHours() < 12)
{
ampm = "AM";
hourPart = (dt_datetime.getHours() < 10 ? '0' : '') + dt_datetime.getHours();
if(dt_datetime.getHours() == 0)

{ hourPart = 12; }

}
else
{
ampm = "PM";
if(dt_datetime.getHours() > 12)

{ hourPart = dt_datetime.getHours() - 12; }

else

{ hourPart = dt_datetime.getHours(); }

hourPart = (hourPart < 10 ? '0' : '') + hourPart;
}
return (
// sakai mod – was (dt_datetime.getHours() < 10 ? '0' : '') + dt_datetime.getHours() + ":"
hourPart + ":"
+ (dt_datetime.getMinutes() < 10 ? '0' : '') + (dt_datetime.getMinutes()) + ":"
+ (dt_datetime.getSeconds() < 10 ? '0' : '') + (dt_datetime.getSeconds())
// sakai mod
// + ' ' + ampm
);
}

I will propose a fix for the related bug SAK-3584 Closed (conversion in the other direction).

This fixes the conversion from the samigo delivery dates (AMPM) to the calendar widget (24h). This could be acomplished by replacing the code block identified by
"// AM/PM -> 24 hour clock conversion" (line 42) in sam/tool/src/webapp/html/calendar.html:

if (obj_caller)
{
var inputDateString = ""+obj_caller.target.value;
var tmpH = this.dt_current.getHours();
if (inputDateString.indexOf("PM") == -1 && tmpH == 12)

{ hours = tmpH - 12; this.dt_current.setHours(hours); }

else if (inputDateString.indexOf("PM") != -1 && tmpH > 0 && tmpH < 12)

{ hours = tmpH + 12; this.dt_current.setHours(hours); }

else ;// no modification needed
}

column1: [SAK-3584] Samigo deliverty dates spanning 12:XX PM times do not work correctly
column6:
Based on issue originally reported in SAK-1886 Closed against Schedule, but also found to be occuring in Samigo:

Comment by Nuno Fernandes [23-Jan-2006 08:34] Delete [ Permlink ]
This problem is not yet fixed and it looks like it is happening in other modules. Setting Delivery dates in Samigo also has this (dangerous) bug.
Besides the described bug, there's also a bug when translating to/from the calendar widget.

I've found a frustrating snag in the Schedule function. The final exam for my
course (FR 231 All site) is Dec. 19th from 10:30am-12:30pm (after noon, hence
PM), but when I enter that, it thinks the exam is 14 hours and displays it on
the 20th as well!!! The only thing I can do is not to give an end time. It's
okay, but just somewhat annoying that I can't show the ending time.
---------

The problem happens when the end time is chosen to set the event (rather than duration). Create an event by starting with a start time of 10:30. Then set the end time. If you pick 12, then 30, then switch the am to pm, the duration gets set to 14 hours instead of 2. It's easy to fix by just setting the duration to 2, but there's something buggy in the calculation when changing from am to pm.

I've finally figured this out!

It turns out that the one filter regular expression that I didn't change for radeox happens to be broken!! (I knew I was being lazy...)

This is caused by the list filter going crazy. Dash at the start of a line, gets interpretted as the start of a square marked list.

The filter RE is:

(^[
p

{Space}](-#*|-#*[iIaA1ghHkKj]\\.)[
p{Space}

]([^\r\n])[\r\n]*)+

The evil thing is the use of
p

{Space}

as it is equivalent to [ \t\n\x0B\f\r] (note the newlines!)

Thus the – on the line above xyz matches as the start of a list.

Take a look at SAK-3714 Closed for a similar problem with the list filter...

column1: [SAK-3580] Upgrade paths from Sakai 1.5.1 to 2.1
column6:
With assistance from Bill Crosbie we have successfully upgraded our Sakai 1.5,1 MYSql instance to 2.1. I have posted and have seen several other postings from individuals who have had similar problems that we experienced initially. I have noted here our process and some things to watch our for.

Items to check:

1) The db upgrade script for 2.0.1 to 2.1 has 3 incorrect SQL statements. I have included those in this email. Bill Crosbie initially discovered the solution

2) You need to add "set names utf8;" to the beginning of the both upgrade scripts. This will solve an error that was occurring when the script ran

3) The two upgrade scripts have a few sections that are commented out.
You will want to check those and un-comment the sections that apply to your instance and upgrade process.

Our upgrade path:

1. Backup existing MYSql db to sql statements. We used the GUI tool for this. We backed up our Sakai and Samigo db.
2. Drop the existing Sakai db.
3. Un-install Tomcat 5.0 and install Tomcat 5.5, applied jdk 1.4 patch.
4. Build and deploy Sakai 2.1
5. We first verified Sakai 2.1 functionality using the default HSQL db.
6. Create new, empty Sakai db in MYSql, apply permissions for SakaiDB account.
7. Import previous Backup of 1.5.1 using: mysql --user=

{dbusername} --password={dbpassword} sakai < BUExport.sql --force 8. Import previous Backup of Samigo using: mysql --user={dbusername}

--password=

{dbpassword} sakai < SamigoExport.sql --force 9. Apply Samigo 2.0 using: mysql --user={dbusername} --password={dbpassword}

sakai < samfix.sql --force 10. Apply 1.5.1 to 2.0.1 upgrade using: mysql --user=

{dbusername} --password={dbpassword} sakai < 20Conv.sql --force 11. Apply 2.0.1 to 2.1 upgrade usingL mysql --user={dbusername}

--password=

{dbpassword}

sakai < 21Conv.sql --force

We were using file system storage for data, made sure path matched in Sakai.properties file.

After that, restarted Tomcat and off and running on 2.1!

column1: [SAK-3577] Chatroom options are not independent of which chatroom you are in
column6:
If you change any of the options under Message Display in a chat room that you create, these changes apply to all chatrooms rather than the specific one you create. For example, if I create a chat room that is different from the sites Main Chat room and change the Message Display from "Show messages from the past x days" (default) to "Show the last x messages", this change applies to all of the chat rooms including the main chat room rather than the specific chat room for which the change was made.

One use case scenario would be to have different Chat rooms in a site used for different temporal styles of conversation. A "online brainstorming" room, where you want to show all the messages in the last, short-time period, so folks can easily see the whole session when they are in it; after the session is over the messages are stale, and don't need to show up after short time period has gone by. Another "general information" room, where you want to see what the last few messages are regardless of the time period

column1: [SAK-3574] "Feedback Authoring" setting problems
column6:
The topmost of the new feedback settings is "Feedback Authoring". In the template, it's got radio buttons to choose between selection-level, answer-level and both, and a checkbox that determines whether or not assessment creators can modify the radio button.

If you turn the checkbox on, assessments created with that template will show the feedback authoring setting the right way.

If you turn the checkbox off, assessments created with that template will just show the header "Feedback Authoring" and nothing else. This looks a lot like an error and confused me for a while. (see screenshot).

What should happen: I think the full Feedback Authoring setting should show up in the settings for core assessments, whether or not the "editable" checkbox is turned on. If the checkbox is turned off, the radio buttons should be grayed out.

Does that make sense?

column1: [SAK-3571] Paging mechanism doesn't work as expected
column6:
Although am logging this as an issue in Membership, I believe this is the way the paging component works everywhere.

Here's the scenario: There are 22 items in the list. My display is set to 20 so I am viewing 1 - 20 by default. When I go to the next page, currently it 2 - 22 are displayed. Only the items the user has not seen yet should be displayed. So, after going to the next page, 21 - 22 should be displayed (if there were more, up to 40 would display).

At face value it may seem to make sense to always display as many items as you can but in thinking through the user goal and workflow of finding a particular item, the current behavior causes extra cognitive load. The user must first figure out which of the items on the list they are already seen in order to figure out which ones to pay attention to on the new page.

column1: [SAK-3568] Roster viewIDphoto could allow unauthorized views of ID photos
column6:
By default the roster tool allows anyone with the site.upd right to view Official ID photos for users with access to the site. If one allows users to create their own sites and makes the roster tool available to them one could be allowing people to gain access to ID photos by creating a site and adding users to it.

There should be an explicit permision for this (roster.viewIdPhotos) - so that realms can be set up appropriately. i.e. staff on a course site will get roster.viewIdPhotos (e.g. through the realm !site.template.staff) but owners of collaboration sites won't. Attached is a patch to implement this.
column10: Roster viewIDphoto could allow unauthorized views of ID photos
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: I edited the above description incorrectly: reference to setting the permission in !site.template.staff should be !user.template.staff (.auth role) - the point being that one could associate the permission with a user type rather than a role within a course type, to comply with local policy regarding access to student ID photos.
column48: Stephen, I believe this issue is resolved with our latest Roster tool code (will be included with 2.4, but is there now in trunk). Can you please take a look and let me know? Thanks!
column52: Thanks, I tested on trunk (nightly2) by clearing the roster.viewofficialid permission from the Instructor role in the site and adding it to !user.template.staff (a new account type), and it worked as expected, so this meets our needs perfectly.

the lines are in dofinish:

}
else

{ manualSections = manualSections.concat("," + "," + "A"/*to be configured*/ + "," + manualAddSubjects.get(j) + "," + manualAddCourses.get(j) + "," + manualAddSections.get(j) + "+"); }

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
I am thinking of making the provider id and course display name configurable through sakai.properties. Please let me know whether you like the following approach:

1. add requiredRosterFields list, which will be shown in the class creation page in that sequence.
For UM, the list will be:
requiredRosterFields.count=3
requiredRosterFields.1=Subject:(ie PSYCH)
requiredRosterFields.2=Class:(ie 101)
requiredRosterFields.3=Sections:(ie 001)
2. some institutions could have more roster fields, but not as required. So we add an optionalRosterFields, which will be shown after those required ones.
optionalRosterFields.count=x
optionalRosterFields.1=xx
...
3.Institutions might want to control the size of the field input area. They can do so by specify those following attributes.
requiredRosterFieldMax.count=3
requriedRosterFieldMax.1=8
requriedRosterFieldMax.2=3
requiredRosterFieldMax.3=3
So that the Subject input field will have 8 chars as maximum, while the other two field have 3 chars.
4. Institutions can sepcify the format of coure provider id, which can be used to integrate with institutional SIS feed later.
For example, we will have "2006 FALL CHEM 001 001" based on the following setting.
courseProviderIdFormat.count=9
courseProviderIdFormat.1=year
courseProviderIdFormat.2=
courseProviderIdFormat.3=term
courseProviderIdFormat.4=
courseProviderIdFormat.5=requiredRosterField
courseProviderIdFormat.6=
courseProviderIdFormat.7=requiredRosterField
courseProviderIdFormat.8=
courseProviderIdFormat.9=requiredRosterField
5. Institutions can specify the format of course site name, which can be used as the course site's name.
For example, a site can have a title of "CHEM 001 001 W06" based on the following format. "W06" is added by Sakai to differentiate same course in different terms.
courseSiteNameFormat.count=5
courseSiteNameFormat.1=requiredRosterField
courseSiteNameFormat.2=
courseSiteNameFormat.3=requiredRosterField
courseSiteNameFormat.4=
courseSiteNameFormat.5=requiredRosterField

Any suggestions?

-Zhen

column1: [SAK-3563] Too much clicking in delivery throws an exception
column6:
This was a Samigo bug that Ed had marked as "Won't Fix", but after consultation with Lydia it is being put in Sakai, since it throws an exception and I found I could reproduce it quite easily.

Per Margaret:

(I'm not sure if this is major or minor, but it is likely to come up.)

Action: Take an assessment as a student (ex: 174 anothermarithtest)

After answering question 1, click the "save and continue button" multiple times. Lots of times.

Result: Either an "index 0, size 0" exeption (see attached)
or a validation error (see attached image).

ok, checked the logic when u click button 1, all the otehr buttons & links are disabled. if u clcik button 1 again, then button 1 is disabled. button 1 can't be disabled the 1st time 'cos by doing so, it won't carry out the action that it is supposed to do. column1: [SAK-3562] Histogram bars do not match Grading mockup
column6:
The bars in the Statistics view of Scores don't match the mockup; the mockup shows them only partially extending across the page, while in the current view they extend totally across even if there is only one correct answer. As well, the
'# Correct Responses' text after the bar is wrapping, unless the browser window is set to full screen.

Two questions:
How far across the box should the '100 percent' mark be?
and
What should the 100 percent mark represent? That is, right now, for a question where 2 out of 3 people answered correctly, should the 100 percent mark be 2 or 3? Right now it would be 2.

column1: [SAK-3558] Cancel action from Add Roster in Site Info lands you in Worksite Setup
column6:
To reproduce, you click Site Info > Edit Rosters and go through a wizard. If you cancel out of the wizard, you end up with the Worksite Setup page in the iFrame that seems to still be the course > Site Info. Here are the steps...

1. In a course site, click Site Info
2. Click Edit Class Roster(s)
3. Click Add Roster(s)
4. Click Cancel
(note: these steps were taken without a roster or requested roster associated with the site.)

This action puts you on the course site creation page from Worksite Setup, yet you are still in your course site.

5. Click Cancel

This action puts you on the My Workspace > Worksite Setup page, yet you are still in your course site.

6. Click the Reset up arrow in the tool title bar.

This action puts you back in the Site Info page for your course.

column1: [SAK-7828] Integration of Assignments Tool with Gradebook
column6:
This was posted as a comment elsewhere, but it deserves its own entry.

The integration of the assignments tool with the gradbook is an urgent need. The majority of our users find that having tools that don't talk to each other, requiring them to do manual work to enter grades into the gradebook, is a major step backwards (to use their words), especially when our homegrown system had this functionality in place. I fear that if this gap is not closed, it will be a hard sell for wide migration to Sakai.

Of course, the gradebook needs to "mature" to provide the grading options presently available in the assignments tool. The assignments tool, optionally, should send the raw scores/grades to the gradebook.
column10: Integration of Assignments Tool with Gradebook
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Vivie, you'll be pleased to know that this work is already in-progress and will not need to go through the Requirements process. See SAK-2271 Closed for details. You might also want to inform the development of this feature by posting any suggestions or use cases you have under that issue.

column1: [SAK-3552] Attaching html documents from Resources breaks internal relative URLs
column6:
If you upload an HTML file to resources along with supporting files like images or embedded media, and the HTML file references those supporting files with relative-to-document URLs or links to other documents in Resources with relative-to-document URLs, all the URLs will work normally.

But when you attach the same document (from Resources, by clicking the "Attach a copy" link) to an announcement or schedule event, the URL for the HTML document itself changes, and the relative URLs all break if the document is viewed as an attachment. Even attaching the linked or embedded files to the same announcement or event does not work.

A workaround is to right-click the document name instead of the "attach a copy" link and copy/paste the URL so that you attach the link to the document rather than the document itself. It seems like this is probably what should happen by default for documents in Resources anyway, since there already is a copy stored in site's resources directory and no apparent (to me at least) need to duplicate the document in the attachment directory - this is working on the assumption that everything is within the same site.
column10: Attaching html documents from Resources breaks internal relative URLs
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Need to worry about that last point for sure, what to do when the Resource is from a different site.
column48: We will add the ability to attach as links, but that is not available yet in legacy tools because of the permissions when attaching from one site to another or when attaching within a site if the permissions are not already open to everyone (for example, attaching an student's submission to an assignment). This ticket should be linked as a subpart of the JIRA ticket for that whole (larger) issue. Not sure of the ticket for that.

column1: [SAK-3548] allow copy pool with same level
column6: question pool has validation for copy to a pool which has same name. It should allow for copy to the same level.
column10: allow copy pool with same level
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
1/. Copy pool to different level:
Only allow to copy if name unique, otherwise, throw error message.
2/. Copy pool to same level :
First time copy: there will be "Copy of" infont of the name: ie. if copy "sub" into its level: pool now will have: sub, Copy of Sub
Second time copy the pool: ie. copy "sub" again: sub, Copy of Sub, Copy(2) of Sub
Same as for n times copy of "sub": adding Copy of Sub
But if you copy "Copy of Sub" which "Copy of Sub" is already in the pool so the new copy pool will be: "Copy of Copy of Sub", etc....

column1: [SAK-7875] Template capability for email messages
column6:
In cases where Sakai sends outgoing email messages and possibly in some other instances, blocks of text are constructed in java code. This means that for sites to customize the text of email messages (whether for language translation or local context), it is necessary to change the java source code, rebuild and redeploy.

It would be significantly simplify Sakai deployment and subsequent customization if email messages could be generated from templates. This would allow templates to be customized either in the filesystem, or through the UI itself if the templates were stored in the database or ContentHosting. A case where the latter might be desirable is to allow site owners to customize the email invitation sent when adding new guest users to a site.

A generic templating capability would allow a template which included replaceable parameters identified by name, e.g.

-------
Dear $Firstname,

Welcome to the $SiteFullName worksite on $SakaiServiceName.
...
-------
column10: Template capability for email messages
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
I've taken the modifications we made at Cambridge and refactored them into a generic templating method that could be used for system emails, HTML or anything else. See the attached java file.
The method (templateProcess) takes a template string (similar to a mailmerge document) and a HashMap containing the template merge fields, and returns the result of the two.
The main method in the attached file is an illustration of how this could be used to implement customisable email templates.
Not being a real java/Sakai developer, I'm putting these up for someone more competant to take forwards and hopefully build into the system for a future release.

For system emails, the ideal implementation would use locale-specific resource files (like existing locale-driven parts of the system), each containing a set of "named" email templates, so something akin to:

File : emailtemplates.properties

addedparticipant.newuser=Welcome to

{systemServiceName}

\n\nYou have been registered as a member of the

{siteTitle}

worksite on...
addedparticipant.existinguser=...
addedparticipant.newguestuser=...
...

and the appropriate methods (e.g. notifyAddedParticipant in SiteAction.java) could be amended to read in the relevant template, collate the merge information and submit the two to the templateProcess method, then mail the result out.

There are a few things to consider here:

I'm not sure ResourceLoader will immediately reflect changes in properties files.
i.e. if you wish to make a change to an email template, you may need to restart the sakai instance to pick up that change. A significant improvement to the resource bundling system would be to make it aware of changes to the properties files and reload them as necessary. That way the instance does not have to be shutdown+restarted to pick up changes.
Alternatively, the templates could be stored in the database or contentHosting, as suggested by Stephen; but this too requires additional work to provide the mechanisms/interface.

Also, the range of parameters that can be used in the email template is going to be hard-coded (as the HashMap). That may, or may not, be an issue depending on how many are defined in the initial implementation.

Hopefully this will provide a useful starting point - feel free to contact me for questions, thoughts etc.

column52:
copied HTML into W3 Valiadator (http://validator.w3.org/check) with following result:

This page is not Valid XHTML 1.0 Transitional!
Below are the results of checking this document for XML well-formedness and validity.

Error Line 8 column 29: required attribute "type" not specified.
<script language="JavaScript">
The attribute given above is required for an element that you've used, but you have omitted it. For instance, in most HTML and XHTML document types the "type" attribute is required on the "script" element and the "alt" attribute is required for the "img" element.

Typical values for type are type="text/css" for <style> and type="text/javascript" for <script>.

¿

Error Line 77 column 844: duplicate specification of attribute "target".
...http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/" target="_blank">W3C Standards pages</a></p><ul>
You have specified an attribute more than once. For instance, you have used the "height" attribute twice on the same "img" tag.

¿

Error Line 77 column 1601: duplicate specification of attribute "target".
...ef="http://validator.w3.org/" target="_blank">HTML validation service</a>.</p
¿

Error Line 84 column 7: end tag for "tbody" which is not finished.
</tbody>
Most likely, You nested tags and closed them in the wrong order. For example <p><em>...</p> is not acceptable, as <em> must be closed before <p>. Acceptable nesting is: <p><em>...</em></p>

Another possibility is that you used an element which requires a child element that you did not include. Hence the parent element is "not finished", not complete. For instance, <head> generally requires a <title>, lists (ul, ol, dl) require list items (li, or dt, dd), and so on.

column1: [SAK-3536] Ability to set display order for roles
column6:
Roles within a realm (site) are always displayed in alphabetical order, in contexts such as a permissions page.

In some contexts, a more logical ordering is desirable, e.g. in order of least to most permissions (Observer, Student, Lecturer), or most common to least common.

It would therefore be useful to be able to define the role ordering in the site realm (or site realm template). All tools which display roles in any context should then use this ordering.
column10: Ability to set display order for roles
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Stephan, this is an interesting suggestion. Do happen to have any examples of other systems or applications where these types of sorting orders are utilized?

Since Roles can be arbitrarily labled, how might one go about determining most to least permissions? Perhaps the total number of the checkboxes checked in a Role's row? Does the list get reordered if you change enough of the checkboxes for a paritcular Role to give it more or less permissions than another Role?

If the ordering is in terms of "commonness", I assume you're thinking about how many users have a particular Role in a site, so Students would probably be always be listed first and Instructor last?

I would worry a bit, if different sorting orders were used for Roles in different parts of the interface, that we would be generating confusion for the users, but perhaps one of these new sorting strategies would be a good one to use across the board.
column48:
I had in mind just a fixed display order defined by the Sakai administrator at the same time that the roles are defined - i.e. the UI would either allow specifying the sort order numerically (1, 2, 3, 4, ...) or a 'move up' / 'move down' style of interface similar to how one can order pages in a site.

So the feature suggested here is for the role creator to be able to define the display order, rather than a new type of sort order which is automatically applied in some way.

The tools would then simply order by the numeric order field rather than alphabetically by role name. If no role order is specified, then they'd be ordered alphabetically.

column1: [SAK-3530] Sakai Events pollutes logs on startup with unnecessary messages
column6:
When Sakai is starting up, the following message comes out about 15 times

java.sql.SQLException: Table not found: SAKAI_SESSION in statement [select EVENT_ID,EVENT_DATE,EVENT,REF,SAKAI_EVENT.SESSION_ID,EVENT_CODE,SESSION_SERVER from SAKAI_EVENT,SAKAI_SESSION where (SAKAI_EVENT.SESSION_ID = SAKAI_SESSION.SESSION_ID) and (EVENT_ID > ?)]
at org.hsqldb.jdbc.jdbcUtil.throwError(Unknown Source)
at org.hsqldb.jdbc.jdbcPreparedStatement.<init>(Unknown Source)
at org.hsqldb.jdbc.jdbcConnection.prepareStatement(Unknown Source)
at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingConnection.prepareStatement(DelegatingConnection.java:185)
at org.apache.commons.dbcp.PoolingDataSource$PoolGuardConnectionWrapper.prepareStatement(PoolingDataSource.java:278)
at org.sakaiproject.component.framework.sql.BasicSqlService.dbRead(BasicSqlService.java:359)
at org.sakaiproject.component.framework.sql.BasicSqlService.dbRead(BasicSqlService.java:287)
at org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.event.ClusterEventTracking.run(ClusterEventTracking.java:545)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:552)

This is because the table has not yet been created. We need to clean up the interaction between the proces that creates the table and the process that queries the table so these messages get cleaned up. A few revisions back we only saw this message once. Now it comes out about 10 times on startup.
column10: Sakai Events pollutes logs on startup with unnecessary messages

column1: [SAK-3526] Change the 'copy' function in question pool to be a deep copy, rather than a link
column6:
Currently in question pool , when you copy a pool or copy questions from one pool to another, only new links between items and pools are created. No real copies are made. This has some unwanted affect on the usage of 'Assgined to' and 'random draw part' in authoring. While we have workarounds for them , we need to document all the scenarios and see if it makes sense to change the 'copy' behavior, so that when a copy is a made, a new item object is created.

See SAK-3096 Closed for one of the scenarios
column10: Change the 'copy' function in question pool to be a deep copy, rather than a link
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: I'm seeking outside counsel on the original design for this problem.
column48:
On Oct 16, 2006, at 12:05 PM, Vivie Sinou wrote:

Marc -

I missed your message back in April or I hadn't joined the assessment group
yet. Thanks for resending it.

The "copy" language is very confusing to instructors. Even if you didn't
change any of the behavior until you had more feedback on usage scenarios,
changing the terminology alone would help tremendously to clarify things for
users.

It is important to use 'copy' to mean 'copy' - a duplicate of the original
that instructors can make edits to and use as a new version. If you are
going to link, call it "link to question pool." There is great value in
linking as changes can happen globally. But, if the behavior is "copy to
question pool" (a duplicate), then, it should say 'copy' - not 'assign' to
question pool.

Adding a function to the action bar on the Questions or assessment page to
allow instructors to "Copy Questions to Pool" ALL at once would be AWESOME!
My instructors would be absolutely thrilled. Because Samigo does not support
importation of pools at the moment, faculty have to create pools from
imported tests, sending question items over one at a time. The workflow is
cumbersome and tedious. The latter would make the whole process efficient
and effective.

Thank you for reaching out to us for feedback.

Best,
Vivie
column52:
"Adding a function to the action bar on the Questions or assessment page to
allow instructors to "Copy Questions to Pool" ALL at once would be AWESOME!
My instructors would be absolutely thrilled. Because Samigo does not support
importation of pools at the moment, faculty have to create pools from
imported tests, sending question items over one at a time. The workflow is
cumbersome and tedious. The latter would make the whole process efficient
and effective.
"

Starting 2.4, Samigo will support importation of pools. This will allow the users to export a one-part assessment into a QTI xml and import it into a pool.
column56: As discussed earlier, in 2.4, we will change the current 'copy Pool' behavior (which is actually creating a linked pool) to creating a real copy. This will be more consistent with the 'copy question' behavior (See bug SAK-8255 Closed ).

column1: [SAK-3520] Having only merged announcements disables the remove function
column6:
See CT-168 for details. Because this is not a CT only issue, but also applies to Sakai, I duplicated for tracking purposes.

If the announcement's list only has merged announcements, then the 'Remove?' label disappears and the 'Update' and 'Cancel' buttons at the bottom of the screen also disappear. Seems like merged announcements don't have the remove function assigned to them.
But if you create an announcement, or created one before merging the others, then the remove functioning is restored.

Comment by Michael Beasley [22-Jul-2005 13:32]
[ Permlink ]
If you have only merged announcements, it takes away the Remove label and the Cancel/Update buttons, but it leaves the checkboxes in place. If you can't manipulate these merged announcements, then those checkboxes are confusing.

Comment by Moises Curiel [22-Jul-2005 14:43]
[ Permlink ]
Yeah, the title is not the problem, it's how it should work - idea is for merged announcements to not be able to be deleted. The problem is that they CAN be deleted if an announcement is created before or after merging announcements.

Getting rid of merged announcements' checkboxes would be a solution. So the checkboxes wouldn't be confusing when there is no meaning for them to show and it would stop the option of deleting merged announcements.
column10: Having only merged announcements disables the remove function

column1: [SAK-3517] Message about updating participants shown to non-maintain users
column6:
Roster always displays the message "To add or remove participants from the Roster, visit the Site Info tool."

This message is only appropriate for users with maintain role (or equivalent roles which can update participants).

The message should therefore be suppressed for access-equivalent participants. who cannot add or remove participants (and will not see any related functionality in Site Info).

As Site Info also may not be present in every site in which Roster is used, but Worksite Setup will always be available to users in My Workspace, it is also suggested that the text should be changed to "To add or remove participants from the Roster, use the Site Info or Worksite Setup tools."

I suspect that the JDK on unix somehow has this jar in its classpath but the Windows JDK does not. column56:
For me, this was also failing on a Unix 1.5 installation. A Google search revealed that the org.apache.xpath.XPathAPI class was moved into the JDK for 1.5 (no need for an external dependency).

If you aren't looking for backwards-compatibility, you can use:

import com.sun.org.apache.xpath.internal.XPathAPI;

in a straight 1.5 compile instead of:

import org.apache.xpath.XPathAPI;

column1: [SAK-3512] The drop down for "Insert New Question" fails when the next question is the same type
column6:
In Authoring, if you choose a type of question identical to the last question you authored, it will just jump to the top (in Firefox) or refresh (IE), instead of giving a new question authoring setup.

To reproduce:

1. Create a SA question. Save it.
2. Go to the "Insert New Question" dropdown underneath it. Attempt to select SA.
3. You will not get authoring for a new question.
4. Choose any other type of question, for example FIB.
5. You will get the authoring tools.

If you exit authoring after making a question and re-enter, you can add a question of the last type. Copy from Question Pool always works.

This is true for all the "Insert New Question" drop downs on the page. If you create a T/F question, then a SA question, then try to insert a new SA under the T/F question rather than under the SA question, you will still fail.

column1: [SAK-3508] Display a mean value for the survey questions.
column6:
Displaying a mean value for survey questions in examination statistics is very helpful for understanding the results. I created a patch ( SAK-34701 Open ) that computes the mean value for MCSC values, weighting the first response as 1, the second as 2, etc, and it is then stored in the bean. I modified the jsp page to output the mean value below the number of responses for questions of type "3" (multiple choice surveys).

I have tested this patch on sakai_2-1-1 and sakai_2-1-1_001.

column48: Both actually, a Contributed Patch so that people have a place to go to find it (and comment on it) and a Feature Request (or Bug sometimes) so that it can be tracked as an issue to address in a future version of Sakai. Once you've created one, you can use the Clone operation to easily make the other, as I've done here.

column1: [SAK-3506] Cannot add survey questions in certain circumstances.
column6:
When attempting to add survey, the error:

WARN: Unable to find component with ID 'selectscale' in view. (2006-01-12 12:07:48,848 http-8080-Processor23_com.sun.faces.renderkit.html_basic.HtmlBasicRenderer)

appears in the log and no form appears. This happens in specific cases. For example:

Test & Quizzes -> Title = "New Assessment" -> Create
Insert New Question -> Survey (Error occurs)

However,
Test & Quizzes -> Title = "New Assessment" -> Create
Add Question -> Survey (Works) -> Answer = "Yes, No" -> Save (Works)
If this is followed with the
Insert New Question (Bottom One) -> Survey (Works) -> Answer = "Yes, No" -> Save (Works)

If we try the same:
Insert New Question (Bottom One) -> Survey (Error Occurs)

However, if I Modify (Last Survey Question) -> Save
Then, Insert New Question (Bottom One) -> Survey (Works) -> Answer = "Yes, No" -> Save (Works)
But repeating fails.

If I try Insert New Question (Bottom One) -> Short Answer/Essay (Works) -> Change Question Type -> Survey (Works) -> Answer "Yes, No" -> Save(Works)

Hopefully my notation for the sequence of events makes sense. In some cases, using Insert New Question somewhere other than the Bottom one works.

column1: [SAK-3504] Consistency of Options in Edit Draft and actual posting
column6:
There is inconsistency between the options when posting a topic to a category and editting that same topic if you save as a draft first.

When posting (without saving as draft) the two radio buttons are:

  • Within this topic, allow replies to any message
  • Within this topic, only allow replies directly to this message

But when editting draft, these radio buttons become:

  • Allow reply to any message
  • Allow reply to topic only.

The user should see the same set of options – the first ones – at all stages.

column1: [SAK-7775] Comprehensive 'remove user' functionality
column6:
There is a need for a more comprehensive "remove user" fucntionality than currently exists. One that not only deletes the user, but all the appropriate, associated data, such as their MyWorkspace site, their memberships, etc., rather than leaving it orphaned in the db. Note that for some cases, such as users from external providers, it may not be desireable to delete all the related artifacts when deleting the internal user representation in Sakai, so support should be provided for both the current and the proposed delete user functionality. This likely to be a larger problem in projects than in course sites, where users from outside the orginization are likely to be using guest accounts.

Use Cases:

  • Deleting a user and all their associated material
  • Deleting just the Sakai, internal user account, but not their associated material

----------------------------------------
Original Description:

When a user is deleted through the GUI (Users tool, 'Remove user'), not all artefacts and associations of the user are removed. For example, the user's my workspace site remains, as does realm membership or any sites of which the user was a member.

In some cases, this behaviour is desirable (for example where a user was created internally but also exists through a provider), whereas in other cases it is undesirable, leaves behind orphaned data in the db and/or may have security implications (OOTB configurations and configurations where userids of internal users may not be unique across the lifespan of the application, e.g. guest accounts where the email address is the userid).

The issues are described further in these JIRA items:

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-655
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1535
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1456
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-2973

A more comprehensive 'remove user' capability is required (whether invoked via the GUI, web services or API), which is flexible or configurable enough to cope with various deployment scenarios, i.e. ways in which the Sakai internal user db and external providers interact.
column10: Comprehensive 'remove user' functionality
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Related to this, but perhaps a separate issue, is what to do with users' artifacts from tools that are removed from a site. Should there be a difference between deleting a tool form a site and removing it (hiding the tool and its content)? Should artiifacts be completely deleted when a tool is deleted or removed? Should artifacts be hidden, but if the tool is re-added, then the previous content is still there? (Gives an easy way to recover from accidently removing a tool.) Should artifacts be hidden, but if the tool is re-added, then a choice presented for starting fresh or restoring previous content? (Gives an easy way to clean out a tool, such as when new instructors explore their site by creating junk content when they are getting used to Sakai or starting a new term.)

column44:
I think we need to remove the line
The owner of this site can revise what appears here by using the options tab above.
from the myworkspace_info.html file in
/trunk/sakai/reference/library/src/webapp/content

The file was taken from the generic webcontent tool and wasn't modified when the tools were broken up. The tool isn't really meant to be editable by each user, but is a way for installations to deliver some standard message about my workspaces to users when they are in their my workspace.
column52:
Requesting to reopen this issue as many of our users use this option to customize their 'My Workspace' (isn't it why we called it that, because it is theirs to customize as they like? )

Users do not have the ability to change that tool to a web content iframe, so they are basically 'stuck' with a canned message.

My vote is to put the functionality back, if we can.

From: Daphne Ogle <daphne@media.berkeley.edu>
CC: Jason Ming Sun <jmingsun@unisa.ac.za>, Stephen Marquard <marquard@ched.uct.ac.za>, sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org

I've attached the mock-up for 'home' from last summer when we did all
the work to try to make legacy tools more in-line with the style
guide. You can see on page 5 that the user has the ability to set
their site description to a URL. This was QA'd and approved on
production for 2.0.

I don't know when or how the decision was made to change this but from
the users perspective I think it's a bad idea. No matter how it worked
in the back end, users used this functionality to customize their site
description.

-Daphne

John Leasia wrote:

column60:
Documenting the current workaround for this:

  • Using Admin Sites editor, edit the !user site
  • Select Pages / Home
  • Select the sakai.iframe.myworkspace tool
  • Change the tool selection to sakai.iframe (from sakai.iframe.myworkspace)
  • Set the Source in the tool config below to /library/content/myworkspace_info.html

This will affect new user my workspaces as they get created. To force existing my workspaces to be recreated, delete existing workspace details in the db with something like (mysql syntax):

– optional: drop all user myWorkspaces, so they get new ones (with new stuff)
delete from SAKAI_SITE_USER where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
delete from SAKAI_SITE_TOOL_PROPERTY where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
delete from SAKAI_SITE_TOOL where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
delete from SAKAI_SITE_PAGE where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
delete from SAKAI_SITE where site_id like '~%' and site_id != '~admin';
column64:

column52: I believe this problem could be resolved by requiring the username in the first column to match usernames of users in the site. I sent an email to David Goodrum to find out if this requirement would cause any problems for a particular use case.
column56: Waiting for final decision on whether an audit on the usernames would cause any problems.
column60: Sent email to David Goodrum.
column64:
When importing a csv file in Post 'Em, the first column must contain usernames. I have spoken to the stakeholder (David Goodrum) for this application and he concedes that we should require these usernames to match the usernames in the site. There are a couple of scenarios to consider when building this functionality:

1) The csv file may only contain a subset of the usernames contained in Site Setup (Site Info). This is fine as long as the usernames that are provided match the usernames in Site Setup.

2) One or more usernames in the csv file do not match the usernames in Site Setup. If this occurs, display the following error message for each specific situation:

Error for one non-matching username:

The following username is not associated with a participant in this site:

khancock

To continue, you must first add this participant to the site or remove the participant from the csv file.

Error for more than one non-matching username:

If more than one username in the csv file does not match a username in the list in Site Setup, one error message will be displayed. For example:

The following usernames are not associated with participants in this site:

khancock
mmmay
jlannan

To continue, you must first add these participants to the site or remove the participants from the csv file.

3) The username field is left blank for one or more participants. If this occurs, display the following error message for each specific situation:

Error for one blank username:

The following field does not contain a username:

column 1, row x

To continue, you must first provide a username for all participants in the csv file.

Error for more than one blank username:

The following fields do not contain a username:

column 1, row x
column 1, row y
column 1, row z

To continue, you must first provide a username for all participants in the csv file.

I believe that covers all possible scenarios. Please let me know if you have any additional questions. Thanks!

column1: [SAK-3498] Need way to prevent site owners from overwriting their role status when adding participants
column6:
When adding site participants, users frequently use long userlists copied from a directory listing or other list. Frequently, they (themselves) are also on that list.

If the user then specifies that all the users they are adding are to be "members" or "students", they overwrite their owner permissions and are locked out of higher-level site access.

FIX: There should be a check so an existing site participant cannot be added via "Add Participants" or, at least, if a participant is already in the site, their already existing role should not be overwritten.

column1: [SAK-3496] PATCH FOR 2.0.1: Missing icon url in sakai.properties causes malfunction in Worksite Setup and Site info tools
column6:
This is a achilles heel for WSetup.

Each icon definition needs a name and a url to the icon image. The skin (css file name) entry is the only thing optional. However, if the url is missing by any chance, Site Info or revising mode in Worksite Setup chokes over the null value of icon url. The site creation process is also affected, using site id as title for new site.

  • Zhen

column1: [SAK-3494] "From" field in notification shows address that is impossible to reply to
column6:
This behavior was introduced by a fix that may have exceeded the original issue.

It is logical that a recipient may want to reply to the person who triggered an announcement/notification for some reason. This is not currently possible, but was before the fix was made.

Stephen Marquard has an idea about resolving this. It is included here:

Date: Wed, 11 Jan 2006 12:35:55 +0200
From: Stephen Marquard <marquard@ched.uct.ac.za>
To: Seth Theriault <slt@columbia.edu>
Subject: Re: Notification email changes

[...]

My suggestion for resolving this is a sakai.properties option which you can set to enable sending notifications from user addresses if available.

If not set, it defaults to current behaviour. If set, notifications will use the full name and email address of the user triggering the notification if
available, otherwise it will use the user's full name but no-reply, e.g.

No sakai.properties option set:

From: "Sakai Service Name" <no-reply@some.domain>

else if sakai.properties set:

If user has an email address configured:
From: "Stephen Marquard" <smarquard@some.domain>
else
From: "Stephen Marquard" <no-reply@some.domain>
column10: "From" field in notification shows address that is impossible to reply to
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: SAK-2035 Closed is the original issue
column48: we've had a couple of complaints about this from users since the fix for SAK-2035 Closed was put in place. Essentially the user can no longer tell who sent the announcement or updated a resource and this information is often times helpful when trying to follow up. Even if it's not listed in the From: field, the sender's name should be listed somewhere within the message.
