column64: Seth, it sounds like this Feature Request ending up getting addressed somewhere along the way. Is that right?
column132:
A related feature request: replying to no-reply@domain.edu silently fails.

Recently, from an instructor: "My students keep telling me they try to use reply to send me messages. (Alas.)"

Seems like a philosophical question, whether replying to a no-reply address should be rewarded with a bounce message. Maybe a little tough love is in order here. In the way-back world, did we fill the reply-to address with email address of the person who posted the announcement? Maybe this is the feature being requested... the ability to set the announcement to

Allow email reply?
No-reply
Reply to me

If-n Message Center is active, I suppose the reply could go into the sender's private message box. And then there's the whole thread about a single stage for messaging. How might this seemingly straightforward feature request relate to that?

column10: Gradebook deadlock detected
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
1) Can you attach a chunk of the Tomcat log leading up and including this error?

2) Any ideas of what the users were doing and seeing when it happened?
column48:
Update: IU isn't able to supply the relevant log, and doesn't know what the user experience was. Although I'm no Oracle DBA, some quick online research seemed to indicate that there could be a number of causes for this, and not all of them might be preventable, in which case our main concern would be graceful recovery from the exception. Unfortunately, without reports from the end users, we can't know whether it was handled well or not.

In email, Lance clarified: "We see dead locks on a pretty regular basis and my intention for filing this was not to attack this particular problem but to start a trail to see if we start seeing patterns of deadlocks... We have not had enough time or resources to dedicate to tracking down these deadlocks. Please share anything you find along the way and we will do the same."

Under the circumstances, it's not clear to me yet that this is a major bug. At any rate, I won't be able to start progress on it until more information is available. Hopefully someone else will hit the same problem and add a comment here.
column52:
I'm going to close this one down.

  • We never got more information about the circumstances or effects of the logged situation.
  • We never reproduced it locally.
  • Pretty much all of the relevant logic (including Hibernate) has changed between 2.1 and 2.2.

If more information on it shows up for 2.1.*, this report should be re-opened. If something similar shows up for 2.2, we should create a new issue.

column1: [SAK-3491] Unable to delete mail (mail.revise.* functions checked instead of mail.delete.*)
column6:
After confirming mail message deletion, method MailBoxAction.doRemove_confirmed() is called. This will get a lock for the current message (for exclusive editing) and will then delete it:
try{
MailArchiveChannel channel = MailArchiveService.getMailArchiveChannel((String) state.getAttribute(STATE_CHANNEL_REF));
MessageEdit edit = channel.editMessage((String) state.getAttribute(STATE_MSG_VIEW_ID));
channel.removeMessage(edit);
} catch (PermissionException e){
(...)
}

But, channel.removeMessage() is never called. This is because channel.editMessage() attempt to get a lock after verifying that the user has any of the mail.revise.own/mail.revise.any (inexistent functions!!) => this will always return false and message is never deleted.

I actually workaround it in this way (bugfix with similar approach?):
1. call BaseMailArchiveChannelEdit.editMailArchiveMessage() (which is mail-specific) instead of BaseMessageService.editMessage();
2. override editMessage() in BaseMailArchiveChannelEdit with a copy of BaseMessageService.editMessage():
a) replace SECURE_UPDATE_OWN and SECURE_UPDATE_ANY by SECURE_REMOVE_OWN and SECURE_REMOVE_ANY (the only editing possible in a mail message is deleting it);
b) remove (???) ((BaseMessageEdit) msg).setEvent(function); <== not visible in this class, should fix?

Code looks like this:
// method MailBoxAction.doRemove_confirmed()
try{
MailArchiveChannel channel = MailArchiveService.getMailArchiveChannel((String) state.getAttribute(STATE_CHANNEL_REF));
//MessageEdit edit = channel.editMessage((String) state.getAttribute(STATE_MSG_VIEW_ID));
MessageEdit edit = ((BaseMailArchiveChannelEdit)channel).editMailArchiveMessage((String) state.getAttribute(STATE_MSG_VIEW_ID));
channel.removeMessage(edit);
} catch (PermissionException e){
(...)
}

// method BaseMailArchiveChannelEdit.editMessage()
public MessageEdit editMessage(String messageId) throws IdUnusedException, PermissionException, InUseException
{
Message m = findMessage(messageId);
if (m == null)
throw new IdUnusedException(messageId);

// pick the security function
String function = null;
if (m.getHeader().getFrom().getId().equals(SessionManager.getCurrentSessionUserId()))

{ // own or any function = SECURE_REMOVE_OWN; }

else

{ // just any function = SECURE_REMOVE_ANY; }

// security check
if (!allowRemoveMessage(m))

{ throw new PermissionException(eventId(function), m.getReference()); }

// ignore the cache - get the message with a lock from the info store
MessageEdit msg = m_storage.editMessage(this, messageId);
if (msg == null)
throw new InUseException(messageId);

// .setEvent() is not visible in this class!!!!!
//((BaseMessageEdit) msg).setEvent(function);
return msg;
}

Hope this helps!
Nuno Fernandes.

column44:
Latest update: I should correct my last observation:

you do not need to modify MailBoxAction.doRemove_confirmed(). Only override editMessage() in BaseMailArchiveChannelEdit is needed.

Sorry for the mistake.
column48: This is a clone of SAK-4541 Closed
column52: Joanne, just assigning this to you so you can check Nuno's comments and close if everything has been addressed with your fix. to SAK-4541 Closed
column56:
Nuno, thanks for spending time on this. My fix were in svn r9294 for Sakai 2.1.2, and r9301 for sakai 2.2.

Actually no need to override of service code. In EmailArchive service, delete permission and revise permission are seperated, not like in some other tools, these two permission are ties together. I was confused by this at the begining.

My solution is, instead of calling "editMessage(msgId)" to get a message edit object, let the tool call "getMessage(msgId)" directly. After getting the message object, the tool uses MessageService.removeMessage(msgId) to delete the certain message. Then the right permission "delete.any" will be checked, instead of "revise.any". If the user has the power, then done, the message got removed.

column1: [SAK-3483] Fix for WinXP clients timing out when creating a new WebDAV location through apache httpd frontend
column6:
Original description (from email):

>>> If I try to connect to webdav through apache/ssl/mod_jk, the windows xp
>>> wizard just hangs, whereas if I try directly to port 8080 on tomcat, it
>>> works just fine.

We found the same problem with the Sakai 2.1.1 branch (as of 11 Jan 06), also with apache/ssl/mod_jk. The associated patch solves this problem.

This should be fixed in TRUNK and applied to the 2.1-maint and 2.1.1. branches.

Johan van den Berg wrote:
> Worked like a charm! Thanks for the help Feliz!
>
> Please find attached a patch for 2.0.1
>
> Johan
>
>
> On Wed, 2006-01-04 at 10:15 +0000, fribeiro@ufp.pt wrote:
>> Johan,
>>
>> We had windows clients hanging in the same configuration as yours; I'm not
>> sure if it's a proxy in the middle or Apache, but here goes what we found out:
>>
>> the doPropfind method opens an input stream with 0 bytes to read and blocks:
>>
>>
>> legacy/dav/src/java/org/sakaiproject/dav/DavServlet.java
>>
>> after:
>>
>> DocumentBuilder documentBuilder = getDocumentBuilder();
>>
>> // Parse the input XML to see what they really want
>> try {
>> InputStream is = req.getInputStream();
>>
>> add:
>> if(is.available() == 0) throw new Exception("Exception:
>> Zero bytes");
>>
>> you have probably to import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;
>>
>> I hope it helps;
>>
>> Without Apache this didn't happen.
>>
>> Feliz
>>
>> Quoting Johan van den Berg <vdberj@unisa.ac.za>:
>>
>>> If I try to connect to webdav through apache/ssl/mod_jk, the windows xp
>>> wizard just hangs, whereas if I try directly to port 8080 on tomcat, it
>>> works just fine.
>>>
>>> Anyone else see this happening on 2.0.1?
>>>
>>> Also, I checked the code, and it seems as though all error messages are
>>> just ignored, and never sent back to the client (not even logged at the
>>> moment), so I hacked the code a bit to return a response.sendError with
>>> the message, so at least now XP comes back with a error if I try to go
>>> to an invalid course or invalid user, but still just hangs on a valid
>>> connection.
>>>
>>> Any help would be appreciated, as we need this to allow our lecturers to
>>> easily import content from our legacy systems. I don't really want them
>>> to go directly to tomcat, because then the webdav documentation that one
>>> gets on the resources page becomes invalid.
>>>
>>> Kind regards
>>> Johan van den Berg
>>> University of South Africa
>>>
>>> ----------------------
>>> This automatic notification message was sent by Sakai Collab
>>> (http://collab.sakaiproject.org/portal) from the Sakai Development site.
>>> You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace > Preferences.
>>>
>>>
>>
>>

>> You can modify how you receive notifications at My Workspace > Preferences.
>>

column7: Win XP SP2 (client), Apache httpd with mod_jk, Tomcat 5.5.12 (server)
column10: Fix for WinXP clients timing out when creating a new WebDAV location through apache httpd frontend
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Note that this patch also applies successfully to the 2.1.1 branch.
column48: This patch was applied in r5261 - thanks to all who helped on this.
column52:
Unfortunately the fix is wrong. It inserts a line

if (is.available() == 0) throw new Exception("Zero bytes");

There are two problems:
1) If available == 0, we don't fix the problem. We exit without processing the input. This causes PROPFIND to behave as if it were always FIND_ALL_PROP.
2) As far as I can see avaialble is always 0, so this happens in all cases, not just the mod_jk case it was intended to hack around.

The net effect of this patch is to disable most of the functionality of PROPFIND.

Note that available() checks how many characters can be read without blocking. Presumably this is intended for use with non-blocking I/O, where you will come back later and try again. It's not appropriate in this case.

So why does the code hang without this patch? I don't know, because I'm not using mod_jk. However my theory is that by the time the data in the TCP connection has been buried in 5 levels of interfaces, the network connection is mishandled. I suggest as a workaround using the code from doput to read contents from the HTTP request, putting it in a buffer, and then handing the XML parser an input stream on the character buffer. That lets us read from the HTTP request using code we know works. I assume an input stream on a character buffer isn't going to hang.
column56:
The fix resolved the immediate problem for us, that of XP clients hanging - a greater evil than PROPFIND not behaving correctly which hasn't yet caused us problems so far (not to say that it won't in the future).

We would be happy to test an alternate patch in our setup (that is, with mod_jk).
column60:
After consulting with Chuck Severance, I've tried a different fix. Please test. I tried duplicating your problem but couldn't, so I have to rely on you to test it.

I tried testing with tomcat and apache on OS X, connected with mod_jk. I then created a network place on XP, using both SSL and non-SSL connections to Apache. No problem. The report said the wizard hung, so I assume as long as I got through the create a network place wizard, and then did a few operations correctly, I'm OK.
column64: I dropped in DavServlet.java from TRUNK (r5780) into our 2.1.1 build, and it all seems to work fine so far, using SSL via mod_jk.
column132: Revised code has now been incorporated into the trunk and released as of 2.1.2.

column1: [SAK-3481] Can't add attachments using syllabus tool when using force.url.secure
column6:
We currently use the force.url.secure option to force sakai to work properly with our load balancer.

If the force.url.secure configuration option is set, adding an attachment using the syllabus tool doesn't work, a nested copy of the gateway is displayed instead (see attached screen shot).

All other tools we've tested (discussion, etc.) are able to add attachments correctly when the force.url.secure option is set.

column56: Anthony, can you verify that you are no longer having this problem?
column60:
We originally needed the force.url.secure option because we were proxying a non-SSL tomcat connector using our load balancer (which has an SSL accelerator). We ended up configuring tomcat to support SSL and setting the appropriate proxyPass attribute in our server.xml file. Even though this consumes a little more of our processing power for SSL, it was definitely worth it, as the new configuration is much easier to maintain.

If no one else is using this, I would quietly put the option out to pasture.

column1: [SAK-7895] Sakai services should minimize dependencies and references to other services
column6: Sakai services should strive to model data management for a set of objects and minimize the use of other Sakai services in both the API and implementations. By clearly separating concerns, this will lead to Sakai services being more modular and easier to adapt services for enterprise integration. Since Sakai services are layered, no sakai service should ever reference a higher level service. Even references at the same level should be avoided unless absolutely necessary.

column1: [SAK-3465] Please add the ability to look up a tool using its tool name (sakai.resources) rather than having a GUID
column6:
It would be a useful Charon capability to allow a page to be included in some other environment to allow a user to have access to their Sakai resources using a URL of the following form:

/portal/page/sakai.resources?sakai.site=~csev

This was requested initially by Lance Speelmon.
column10: Please add the ability to look up a tool using its tool name (sakai.resources) rather than having a GUID
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
This was completed and checked in as r5218

The following URLs are now supported in Charon:

http://localhost:8080/portal/page/sakai.resources?sakai.site=~csev
http://localhost:8080/portal/tool/sakai.resources?sakai.site=~csev
http://localhost:8080/portal/title/sakai.resources?sakai.site=~csev

In this form, the specified site is scanned and the first placement of the tool within the site is the one chosen. This works to replace either the page id or the tool id for these three forms (page, tool, title). When the page form is used, the definition is to select the page that has the specified tool placed on that page. If there are more than one tool is on the page, all the tools on the page are rendered. Unless the site allows anonymous visitors, the URL pattern demands the user to be logged in prior to looking up the site.

column44:
For a New Forum, let's change 'Save Settings' to 'Post Forum'. For an existing Forum (Forum Settings), let's keep the 'Save Settings' label, with one exception. If a Forum has been saved as a draft, let's change 'Save Settings' to 'Post Forum'.

Similarly, for a New Topic, let's change 'Save Settings' to 'Post Topic'. For an existing Topic (Topic Settings), let's keep the 'Save Settings' label, with one exception. If a Topic has been saved as a draft, let's change 'Save Settings' to 'Post Topic'. In the situation where a topic's forum has been saved as a draft, the button within Topic settings should remain labelled as 'Save Settings'.

I hope this makes sense. Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks!

column1: [SAK-4704] Post'Em layout/template not working
column6: In Sakai Post'Em, I an trying to upload a .csv file along with a template file. The .csv file will upload fine by itself. When I use the advanced settings to include the display template file, the preview version (Verify Upload) actually looks OK, but when I click OK, I get t a blank screen and the file doesn't get listed upon refreshing the Post'Em screen. I'll attach the two files that I"m testing.
column10: Post'Em layout/template not working
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: The Advance feature of a design template is not critical for the first release. - David Goodrum
column48:
I have been looking into the template functionality, and I am not sure that it is programatically feasible. The current approach is to have the user upload HTML code, hopefully a table, that contains $0, $1, etc. to represent the student data that corresponds with header 0, 1, etc (see layout_template.txt). Somehow we have to identify the portion of the template that contains this student data and repeat it for every student. We also have to make sure that any extra information (such as the info within the <p> tags in the attached template) is also included in the final display. From a programming point of view, this HTML code comes to us as a long string that we have to break into pieces. Just a few of the problems include:

1. It requires the user to provide html code that we then populate with our data. The user could upload anything (multiple tables, incorrect HTML code, etc). It is very difficult to do any audits on the uploaded template, and it will be very easy to break. We could never program for every possible situation.
2. In the program, we have to somehow guess which portion of the HTML code needs to be repeated for every student. I think we have to make too many assumptions that could easily be wrong depending on what the user uploaded.
3. Currently, we have some special rendering features for the gradebook view. We display the username in red if they have not viewed their information and change this to black when the student's info has been viewed. We also add a column at the end that displays the "last checked" information. Integrating this into the template HTML is difficult and cannot be done 100% accurately if the user gets too creative with their HTML code.

Does anyone have any other thoughts?

-Michelle
column52:
I received some clarification on the requirements for the layout template from the following document:
http://www.indiana.edu/~best/postem/layout.html

I was taking this template beyond its scope previously, so I will look into this problem some more.
column56:
r13320
I have added the template functionality back in. Before this can move much further, it needs some documentation for the user. We can start with the document:
http://www.indiana.edu/~best/postem/layout.html

This document is not completely accurate, but it is a good place to start. One significant change I had to make was regarding the use of $0, $1, $2 ,... to represent the data. When you have 11 columns of data, your $10 will show up as whatever your data for $1 is with a 0 attached to the end. To solve this problem, the template must use $0$, $1$, $2$, etc. to represent the data. I will attach a new version of layout_template.txt to reflect this change.
column60: The original template with the $0$, $1$, etc. change.
column64:
r13385
Changed to use a length of 4000 instead of the default of 255 to store the template. Also added an audit that will not allow user to upload template with more than 4000 characters.

column1: [SAK-3447] Institutions should be be able to configure default tools for new sites
column6:
The toolOrder.xml configuration file provides a primitive way for Sakai installations to determine which tools get shown for new sites, what order they're shown in, and whether any are required.

However, there currently seems to be no way to specify that certain tools be selected by default for new sites. Any tool that's not required will be left unchecked.

"Default tools" are a requirement for UC Berkeley.
column10: Institutions should be be able to configure default tools for new sites
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Ray,

There could be a "required" attribute for each tool entry inside toolOrder.xml file, like the following:

<tool id = "sakai.siteinfo" required = "true" />

By this way, each institution could specify the required tools for each site category.

Does this answer your question?

thanks,

  • Zhen
column48:
Thanks, Zhen. I know about the "required" attribute, and I mentioned it in my first paragraph.

What I'm talking about is an overridable default: a tool whose checkbox is checked by default, but which can be unchecked by the site creator. (The required tools can't be unchecked.)

The current source code in SiteAction.java and the VM files unnecessarily confuses things by referring to the required tools as a "defaultList". That variable name should probably be changed the next time someone's in that area of the code.

Right now I'm working on a local patch which will add a "selected" attribute to toolOrder.xml, like the following:

<tool id = "sakai.resources" selected = "true" />

I'll attach the patch here when it's working.
column52:
I got it now. What you need is a "default tool(s) set", which is overridable by site creator, besides a "required tool(s) set", which is unchangeable.

If this is a general request, could you please check in your patch to Sakai trunk?

I can work on renaming "defaultToolList" to "requiredToolList" in SiteAction.java and related vms.

thanks,

  • Zhen
column56:
I checked my changes into the trunk as revision 5222.

I'm assigning this to Glenn so that he can do a code review.
column60: Putting <tool id = "<tool.id>" selected = "true" /> in the toolOrder.xml file causes the tool to be checked in the list of tools presented when setting up a site, as seen on test machines - 008.

column1: [SAK-3444] SAKAI_SITE table stores role name rather than role key
column6:
Instead of using ROLE_KEY to refer to a role like other tables in Sakai, the JOIN_ROLE column of SAKAI_SITE is stored as a string. As a result of this redundancy, the SAKAI_SITE table needs to be updated in tandem with SAKAI_REALM_ROLE when a role name changes. JOIN_ROLE should instead use the role key.

(This could be described as a design bug, but I've entered it as a feature request.)
column10: SAKAI_SITE table stores role name rather than role key
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: The realm key is not part of the authz group API, so no other service (such as Site) can use it. The API only supports a realm id string. The "other tables in Sakai" you mention are all private to the authz group API implementation.
column48:
I understand that the legacy site management subsystem of Sakai is split from the legacy "realm" management subsystem. But any client who needs to store a persistent pointer to an object owned by another service should probably also be given access to a stable UID for that object.

(To take a simple example, that's why the Gradebook gets a unique system user UID even though it doesn't necessarily display it: so that a student's grades don't vanish if she changes her name.)

Since there's more to a role than just a name string, it might be a good idea to provide a stable handle to the role object for code that needs to specify it.

column1: [SAK-7801] Support for HTML editors
column6:
There have been reports that you are going to provide a single place for interfacing HTML editors. We certainly need this. However we need more than just a place to plug in an editor. We also need some facilities in the core to support an HTML editor. Here are some things we've found that we need. In reading these requirements, note that the HTML editor will be used for preparing HTML pages in Resources, but also portions of pages in announcements, quizes, etc.

  • a file picker. People want to put links in their HTML document. Most HTML editors have buttons to insert a normal link and an image. Many HTML editors have a "browse" button in the tools. We need a URL that the browse function can go to. At a minimum that should give you a directory listing of Resources, with a button next to each item that lets you choose it in Javascript. It might be a good idea for the file picker to be able to choose among several different areas, e.g. Resources for the course, for the faculty member creating the page, and from sites in which shared content is housed.
  • support for HTML editors that create images and equations. This includes support for uploading files through HTTP POST. However you should also consider where images should go. The obvious approach is an images folder in Resources. However there are reasons for students not to be able to get a listing of images. If you are preparing a test, images may include equations and other items that would help a student guess what is going to be on the test. Either you need to be able to protect the images directory in resources from browsing by students, or it should go in a separate place which the faculty member can browse but the student cannot.

column1: [SAK-7892] Structuring content for presentation
column6:
Current the Resources tool is the only place other than Melete where we can put content. Many faculty want the ability to structure the way material is presented. The commercial tools all have some way to construct an "organizer page" (called different things) where items can be placed. Unlike the current Resources tool, organizer pages are constructed to present content rather than maintain it. So an entry will normally have a title and a description, but not the various icons present in Resources.

I am not sure whether the right way to do this is to provide an alternative view into Resources folders or a completely separate tool. However I suspect that it makes sense to use the resources tool for maintenance, to avoid giving faculty two different ways to do essentially the same thing.

Faculty see the left margin as part of the way content is organized. Thus we also need a tool for adding items and changing the order in the left margin. I would try to make that interface look as close as possible to the interface for maintaining organizer pages.

Which ever approach you take, here are some things needed for the organizer page:

  • items should be any of the items in a current resources folder; plus pointers to any tool, and to individual entries such as an assignment, a discussion item, an RSS item, another organizer page or a quiz; plus choices from a set of items defined by the local administrator (links to the Library and other common things at the University)
  • it must be easy to change the order of items on the page
  • there should be a choice of presenting items in a Sakai iframe or in a new window
  • it must be easy to put a link from the left margin to one of these pages
  • it must be easy to change the order of items in the left margin
  • for items in the left margin it shoulbe possible to choose whether to present the item in a Sakai iframe or a new window

If you create a new tool for this, i.e. you leave the current Resources tool alone, faculty will still want the ability to control the order in which items in resources are presented.

I am also concerned about the ability to share content in Resources and other content presentation. Not all content is specific to an individual course. E.g. our language departments have constructed an environment where students see content from a course, from the specific language department, and from the system as a whole.

We need a place to maintain shared content (an obvious choice would be a site not associated with any one course), and the following sorts of facilities:

  • something like a symbolic link, that would let a course import either individual items or whole resource folders/organizer pages, and get the current version even if it changes. It must be possible to put such links in the left margin or on organizer pages.
  • the ability to import portions of the left margin (actually, it might be better to have the ability to put it somewhere else, such as the right margin). To see what I'm looking for, take a look at http://fas-digiclass.rutgers.edu/page.jsp?dept=french The "reference" section on the right should show in all French courses. [At some point we're going to have to move this site into Sakai. At the moment I don't think we could do it.]

Some thought needs to go into authorization. While a lot of the shared material is public, we need to assume that not all of it will be. The lowest level of authorization would be attaching a list of rosters to the shared sites. This could be done simply by making them course sites. However there are issue with this. (1) The maintaners of these sites are not always authorized to see the students in all the rosters. (2) Maintain a list of all individual sections using the shared content could become burdensome. You'd really like the ability to define one or most sites that can use the shared content, with the ability for course sites to use wildcards (so you can say any site associated with a course in a specific discipline).

column44: When I ask for the ability to import part of the margin, it is not good enough simply to provide a template, i.e. a sample that has the right items in the margin, which people can use in building a new course. The problem is that the French department may need to update their list of resources. So we need this to be a link to something in a shared site.

column1: [SAK-3442] Rutgers 2.1.0, AccessServlet changes
column6:
Implements 4 features:

1) Aliases. If you create a mail alias for a site, you can access its resource section with the same alias, e.g. http://server/access/myalias
2) Content view. If you access a folder via /access/content, normally you get an error. With this patch you will get a directory listing in a format that is appropriate for end users. It shows the description of the folder and each item, so it looks a lot like a Melete organizer page.
3) If you specify ?basedir=xxx or ?sbasedir=xxx [for Sferyx], directory listings have a special format intended to support pick lists in HTML editors. Our users want to be able to insert images easily in HTML. Part of that is for the HTML editor to be able to show them a listing on their /images directory and make it easy to pick an image. This is the server side of that. The basedir format should be easy to use in any Javascript code. The sbasedir format is tuned specifically for Sferyx' file picker.
4) implemented file upload via HTTP POST operations. This is also intended for HTML editors, to let them upload images. Sferyx uses this technique, and I believe other HTML editors do as well.

Interaction with other patches. I don't yet have 2.1.0 versions of our other patches. However I believe the 2.0.1 versions may port fairly easily except for this patch. (This one was hard because AccessServlet was refactored for 2.1.0.) See Jira entry SAK-2505 Closed for a list of our 2.0.1 patches.

1) Users without write access to resources can't see in a directory whose name starts with "protected." Other parts of this feature are in ResourcesAction.java, chef_resources_list.vm, chef_resoures_newlist.vm. If you don't want this feature, look for "protected" in BaseContentService.java, and remove the whole paragraph (surrounded by blank lines).

2) Users can change the order of entries in resources. This patch uses the proper order in displaying directories, but ResourcesAction and the vm files [same list as (1)] need to be changed to let the use change the order, and to use the proper order in the Resources tool.

column181:
I applied access.diff and basecontent.diff to our 2.1.1 development build:

1. The issue with copyright-flagged results is resolved.
2. There are still validation issues with the documents produced by ?basedir (not so serious) and ?sbasedir (more serious).

The best way to identify and resolve these is to test with Firefox 1.5 with HTML Validator extension installed.

The validation issue with ?basedir is the use of unescape & in URLs, e.g.

<a href="../?basedir=/wikiimages/&field=url">
rather than:
<a href="../?basedir=/wikiimages/&field=url">

This is not serious and occurs elsewhere in Sakai, but technically should be fixed.

?sbasedir has lots of validation issues, mostly around mismatched tags - screenshot attached.

column1: [SAK-3436] assessment scores not reflected in review list
column6:
Found on all 3 nightly coursework-s1 instances.

On the main delivery page, there's a section for submitted assessments where the student can see assessment name, time submitted, score, etc. The scores on this page should be consistent with the ones in Samigo grading and in Gradebook.

Right now, the scores on this page don't include points for either auto-scored or manually scored questions. The score will always say 0.0 unless you make an adjustment on the total scores page in grading, in which case it'll show that only. (The scores in Gradebook and in the grading tool itself are accurate.)

Steps to reproduce:

1) Take an assessment as a student, and submit it for grading.
2) Look at the assessment in the review list. The score will be 0.0.
3) Log in as the instructor/admin and modify the score for an individual question, on
either the student scores or question scores page.
4) Log back in as the student and look at the reveiw list. The score is still 0.0.
5) Log back in as the instructor/admin and add 1 to the score on the total scores page.
6) Log back in as the student and look at the reveiw list. The score is now 1.0.

column48:
After speaking with Jarrod about this, there are a couple of comments I'd like to make with regard to the spec.

  • The To field should only display for Sent messages, not Received messages
  • The To field should display the recipients as they were selected from the To field when composing or replying to a message. So, if a user selected Instructor Role, Group A and Jose Sanchez, then the user would see the following in the To field for a sent message

To: Instructor Role; Group A; Jose Sanchez

The same applies to the To column in the individual message view for Sent messages, but the characters displayed will be limited to 25.

I'll add these items to the spec. Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks!

column1: [SAK-3426] Default maintainer role is hard-coded but should be configurable
column6:
By most indications, institutions should be able to configure Sakai role names through the database. However, there are a couple of places where the string "maintain" is hard-coded as the default maintainer role. This default is used when the MAINTAIN_ROLE field of a SAKAI_REALM role is null, which often seems to be the case.

The following files hard-code the "maintain" string:

legacy/component/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/legacy/authzGroup/BaseAuthzGroup.java
metaobj/api/src/java/org/sakaiproject/metaobj/worksite/mgt/WorksiteManager.java

At UC Berkeley, we discovered that when we tried to capitalize role names (e.g., "Maintain" for "maintain" in all database records), new users were not able to see their own workspace. When they logged in, "My Workspace" would show as a disabled tab and "Site Unavailable" would show as the active tab. We found that no SAKAI_SITE_USER record of the form ('~new_user_id', 'new_user_id', -1) was being created for these users. On further investigation, we saw that the "!site.user" realm (the template for "My Workspace") was showing "maintain" as the "Maintain Role" even though there was no role defined with that name.

When I changed "maintain" to "Maintain" in those two Java source files, compiled, and re-deployed, new users were successfully entered into SAKAI_SITE_USER.

Locally, we'll work around this issue by changing the template realms to explicitly use the "Maintain" role rather than containing a null MAINTAIN_ROLE field. But it's probably still a good idea to let institutions configure the default to match the local role names.

column1: [SAK-3425] Question subpools sort regardless of depth
column6:
Seen on all local and MIT stable instances.

In the Edit Pool view of Question Pools, pools sort alphabetically but not hierarchically. This makes it very hard to tell where pools and subpools belong.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Go to question pools in T&Q.
2) Create a pool named C.
3) Within that, create a subpool named A.
4) Within that, create a subpool named B.
5) Click on pool C to go to the View/Edit pool screen.
6) Use the arrows to expand all the subpools.

The screen will refresh, and the pools will be sorted in the order:

A (subpool)
B (Sub-sub-pool )
C ( top-level pool)

It's unclear whether sorting was ever implemented correctly; the only previous JIRA issue I can find on this is SAK-35733 Closed .

column1: [SAK-3411] Enable/Disable Users on a System-Wide Basis: Need a way to know if users in SAKAI_USER are allowed to login
column6:
The only way to disable an user account in SAKAI_USER is to set its password to null or deleting the account completely.
A better way would be to add an boolean ACTIVE column to SAKAI_USER.

Two situations where deleting the user is not an option:

  • an user account is temporarily disabled - maybe for administrative reasons;
  • an user account is disabled but we want to keep the account for the record.

column1: [SAK-3410] Copyright settings - default of  "Material is in public domain"
column6:
The default copyright for Resources is: "Material is in public domain"

This is unclear - are faculty (a) releasing the content they have created into the public domain or
(b) indicating they are using content created by someone else that exists in the public domain?

Either way, it seems like the default should be "Copyright status is not yet determined" so if faculty doesn't select an option, there is no tacit agreement to relinquish their own rights as copyright holder (if they created the resource) or someone else's rights by inadvertently declaring another person's content part of the public domain.
column10: Copyright settings - default of  "Material is in public domain"
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
The choices and default can be controlled by sakai.properties entries. Below are what should be the default according to the sakai.properties from the 2.1.006 tag. But when I check on the stable builds of 2.1.006, the default is Material is in public domain. So I think there's a bug in that the default.copyright setting isn't being followed. Otherwise, it seems that an installation can change the default to whatever they'd like, if the copyrightttype and copyright.default settings are working as designed. So changing this to a bug. Once that's fixed if you feel that the default text for Sakai OOTB should be changed please submit another feature request.

  1. the copyright options for the resources tool

copyrighttype.count=6
copyrighttype.1=Material is in public domain.
Copyrighttype.2=I hold copyright.
Copyrighttype.3=Material is subject to fair use exception.
Copyrighttype.4=I have obtained permission to use this material.
Copyrighttype.5=Copyright status is not yet determined.
Copyrighttype.6=Use copyright below.

and you can set which of these is the default using the sakai.property
default.copyright=I hold copyright.

column1: [SAK-4890] DF / Permissions / Delete
column6:
For clarification, if a user has the 'Delete Own' permission, then he/she may delete his/her own messages as long as no user has replied to the message. If a user has replied to the message, then the 'Delete' button would instead be labeled 'Delete Unavailable' and would be grayed out.

The user will receive a warning message prior to actually deleting a df message. The user will receive the following message at the top of the View message screen: 'Are you sure you want to delete this message and its responses? If yes, click Delete.'

In the rare case where a user is attempting to delete a message at the same time that another user is attempting to reply to the same message, the following should occur depending on which action happens first:

Delete occurs first:

Provide a message to the user at the top of the Reply screen that states the following: 'The message you are attempting to reply to has been deleted. You may not reply to this message.'

Reply occurs first:

Provide a message to the user at the top of the View message screen that states the following: 'The message you are attempting to delete has a reply. You may not delete this message.'

If a user has the 'Delete Any' permission, then he/she may delete any users message. If the message has children, the children will be deleted along with the parent.

The user will receive a warning message prior to the system actually deleting a df message. The user will receive the following message at the top of the View message screen after clicking Delete: 'Are you sure you want to delete this message and its responses? If yes, click Delete.'

In the rare case where a user is attempting to delete a message at the same time that another user is attempting to reply to the same message, the following should occur depending on which action happens first:

Delete occurs first:

Provide a message to the user at the top of the Reply screen that states the following: 'The message you are attempting to reply to has been deleted. You may not reply to this message.'

Reply occurs first:

The reply is deleted along with the parent message.
column10: DF / Permissions / Delete
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column48:
It's almost there!

  • If replies exist to message, the button says Delete Unavailable
  • If user deleted when another is replying and delete occurs first, the error message is displays to replyer ( 'The message you are attempting to reply to has been deleted. You may not reply to this message.')

Problem is
If user deleted when another is replying and reply occurs first the deleter is not given an error message - the page refreshed with the delete button saying Delete Unavailable. column1: [SAK-3407] Update button not working properly?
column6:
Update button does not seem to work properly with current announcements page layout. Pressing "Update" results in message that "you must choose an announcement first!" But clicking on an announcement takes you to the announcement page, where you can revise it.

If the purpose of update is to refresh the page, then it doesn't work. If the purpose is to enable you to revise an announcement, then update is unnecessary, since you can revise the announcement using the "Revise" link, or by clicking on the announcement itself and revising it on a subsequent page.
column7: IE 6.0, MySQL, XP, but probably an issue across all browsers and platforms.
column10: Update button not working properly?
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Mike, the purpose of the "Update" button is for use in conjucntion with the checkboxes under the "Remove?" column to delete announcements.
column48: My suggestion then is to revisit the UI. Perhaps replacing "update" with "remove" or "delete" would make more sense.
column52: This confusion is further exacerbated when using a narrow browser window and the right-hand side of the screen (the Remove? checkboxes) is not visible, making the role of the Update button even more unclear as to what it applies to.
column56: This needs to get assigned to a UI review
column60: Added UX component.
column64: [Bulk Comment] This issue is reported as affecting Sakai 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.1, and/or 2.2; however, it is not reported as affecting a currently supported version of Sakai (2.3 or 2.4). If this issue is indeed still a concern for a supported version of Sakai, please do re-open the issue and add the appropriate 2.3 and/or 2.4 version to the Affects Version field. (Please do not remove existing Affects Versions when adding the new Affects Versions.)

column1: [SAK-4946] DF/New messages first drop to bottom in default view
column6: The most recently posted message is put at the bottom of the list of messages when it is composed in the default View All Messages mode even though it is the most recently posted message and should appear at the top. In addition, when you're in that view and switch to Unread Only, the unread message (the most recent one posted) will be at the very bottom of the screen--in a forum with a lot of messages, that will be off-screen. If you move out of the current screen and come back to it (so the most recently posted message moves to the top like it should) and view unread only, then the unread message appears at the top of the screen.
column7: OS X 10.3.9 and Firefox browser v1
column10: DF/New messages first drop to bottom in default view
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Messages should be sorted by date in descending order when View is set to All Messages and Unread Only, meaning that the most recent item should appear at the top. This should have been addressed with r5075 ( SAK-4808 Closed ), but I'm not seeing it on Nightly2 (r5078).
column48: r5086 - newly posted message show up at the top of list now. not sure about the problems for unread view. please take a look at it. -Chen

column1: [SAK-3403] HTMLArea + Firefox 1.5 yields hidden JavaScript errors
column6:
HTMLArea on Firefox 1.5 creates hidden JavaScript errors. The errors are hidden in the JavaScript console by default, and do not appear to affect functionality.

I'm reporting this only so that people know its a known, apparently harmless issue. There are no known effects of the bug besides the warnings in the (typically hidden) JavaScript console.
column7: Firefox 1.5 on Mac and Windows (at least)
column10: HTMLArea + Firefox 1.5 yields hidden JavaScript errors
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
This bug has been reported by several other products using HTMLArea, but no fix known yet:

http://xinha.python-hosting.com/ticket/431

http://code.campware.org/projects/campsite/ticket/1566
column48:
Here is a potential explaination scoured from the above sites that may or may not be correct:

The first one is simple enough... it looks firefox is now compaining about I.E. specific css properties... not a huge deal, there is probably some way of hiding it from firefox though...

The other one I have no idea what was being attempted here... it could probably just be changed for an actual color...

column1: [SAK-3402] HTMLArea initially has no cursor with FireFox 1.5
column6:
This is a small UI bug in Firefox 1.5 with HTMLArea that does not affect functionality.

Firefox 1.5 does not initially display an editing cursor in the HTMLArea/WYSIWYG editor. The WYSIWYG editor still works fine, I tested all the buttons. This means that when the user clicks in a blank HTMLArea, they do not get the expected feedback of a blinking cursor. However, as soon as they type anything, they do get a cursor.

This is a minor bug since it only affects blank HTMLAreas in Firefox 1.5. I verified that the bug is not present in Firefox 1.0.X.

There is no easy fix for this bug.
column10: HTMLArea initially has no cursor with FireFox 1.5
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: I would recommend ignoring this as a very minor known issue.
column48:
Jim,

I'm assigning this bug to you for record-keeping since I think you're the current maintainer for the WYSIWYG editor - but I recommend that you don't work on it since its so minor (-;
column52: Whoops, the bug IS present on Windows Firefox 1.5...
column56:
I believe this is actually a symptom of a greater problem; in Firefox 1.5, an invisible hard space seems to be inserted when the WYSIWYG initializes, as documented in SAK-3121 Closed .

The verdict there was "don't fix", as 1.5 wasn't supported.
column60: I should clarify that the invisible hardspace causes all attempts to export assessments created under FF 1.5 to fail.
column64:
I disagree that this is too minor to fix. It is very disorienting for users not to see a cursor in an input box, as this is the cue to start typing.

I would rate this a major issue from a user experience point of view.
column132: Bumping up the priority, as suggested by Stephan. Also, keep in mind that 1.0.x Firefox usage is going down (where this works right) and 1.5 is on the increase (where it works wrong), so the user-impact is increasing.
column143: Jon, Did you find documentation of the cause of this problem somewhere? What makes you say there's no easy fix? I'm asking to see if you can give me some indication of where to start? Thanks. Jim
column150: Laura, Can you provide step-by-step directions for how to see that this causes a problem in "exporting an assessment." I'm not sure what tool that is referring to. Thanks. Jim
column154: Jim, I'm fairly sure that they mean Samigo here.
column158: The switch to FCK as the default editor makes moot any issues related to HTMLArea. If there is a similar issue with FCK, please reopen.

column1: [SAK-3401] Clarify No Annoucements Message
column6:
In a site with Announcements that have only been created as "Display to Site", there are no Announcements listed when the "View" drop-down is set to "Public". The message that appears in the interface says:

There are currently no announcements at this location.

This may confuse the user, if they do not remember that the view is set to Public, rather than all, and they are expecting to see announcements. Since selection of "Public" filters to just show such announcements, let's change the message to:

There are currently no public announcements at this location.
column10: Clarify No Annoucements Message

When a new site is being created, if only one site type is allowed and the type is not defined as "course" type, "specifying site information" page will be returned; otherwise, if the only site type is "course" type, the first page returned is the "please select term for course site" page. "

column44: Vivie, I'm unable to reproduce this issue on the QA servers. Can you provide more details, such as what type of resource you were working with (e.g., file upload, URL, HTML, simple text). If a file upload, then what type of file? What type of site is the Resource area in question in (e.g., My Workspace, a course site, a project site)? column48: If you have more information on this, please reopen the issue.
column52:
Also encountered (but not reproducibly) by Nuno Fernandes, as reported in email to sakai-dev:

----Original Message----
From: Nuno Fernandes nuno@ufp.pt
Sent: Friday, January 13, 2006 7:10 AM
To: sakai-dev
Subject: Upload size limit exceeded without uploading?

Hi all,

Is there anyone with the behavior described below?

We notice a strange behavior on Resources: on an existing item on
resources, click on "revise properties", change some property (without
changing the file) and apply. The message "Alert: The upload size limit
of 20MB has been exceeded" will be shown. This is non-deterministic: it
only happens sometimes - and, apparently, only in MS IE6 (see attached
image).
An OverloadQuotaException is been thrown in
ResourcesAction.captureValues(SessionState state, ParameterParser
params) because "fileItem" is null (as expected, because file wasn't
changed).

Nuno Fernandes.
column56: It is also reported that even though the alert is displayed, the changes to the properties are still successful.
column60:
I was able to reproduce this problem only on MS Internet Explorer 6 (tried also with Firefox). I am using Sakai 2.1.0.

The error message is printed after revising properties (when coming back to resources listing). The following information is based on my tests and debugging (problem is hard to reproduce):

a) It occurs only when we revise a "file upload" item (see c) );
b) Editing any property can lead to this problem;
c) An OverloadQuotaException is thrown in
ResourcesAction.captureValues(SessionState state, ParameterParser
params): "upload_file" var is TRUE and "fileitem" is NULL;
d) File was NOT replaced (only other properties changed - like title, public domain, etc.)

I'll comment again if I get more information...
Nuno Fernandes.
column64: The problem was that the form in the "modify properties" mode could under certain circumstances generate two requests to the sakai server. The second request generated the error messages. This will be corrected in a few other contexts in legacy tools.
column132: This has been fixed. If possible, it would be good to get this into 2.1.1. It is a low-risk fix with lots of adverse impact if it is not fixed.

column1: [SAK-3387] Making skinning simpler
column6:
I don't claim to be very adept at css but my approach to skinning Sakai for my institution may illustrate some things that could be done to make skinning a little easier for those of us who don't have a lot of time to spend on "look and feel" issues between all the other things it takes to get a Sakai pilot up and running with a technical/support/advocacy staff of one:

Not knowing the ins and outs of css, I eyeballed the default template and identified about four or five shades of blue/grey, matched those up with the four or five shades of purple that represent our school's colors, and then did a search and replace on the blue/grey hexadecimal values as I found them in the default skin. This didn't work for reasons that are probably obvious to anyone who works some with the skins (e.g. 1: search and replace won't change the twenty or so images that define things like the curved tabs – changing those requires fiddling with a tool like Photoshop 2: the hexadecimal values that are used to define the colors in the default skin appear to be more than four or five).

To make skinning easier I'd suggest the following:

-Make a default skin that doesn't depend on images which are school-color specific. This will allow institutions to make a pilot skin for their school without having to drag out Photoshop and crank up their image changing skills.

-Consolidate the list of basic colors that are used in the css and put those in an ordered spectrum list in some master file. Someone who wants to quickly change the colors should be able to go into this consolidated list and switch out hues without doing a search and replace. It will also spare that person the many hours of time it took to nit-pick through the css and identify all the hexadecimal values that represent blue (I'm still not sure I found them all).

Hope this helps – the larger idea here is to create a default skin that someone can change without using Photoshop and without knowing the finer ins-and-outs of css.

Also, there are trade-off if you want the custom flexibility. I Stanford also just did a new a skin and New York. Perhaps it's time for a lessons learned? The group could think about tips for others in skinning and if there are any new ways to simplify without taking away customization that people use. Just a thought...

column1: [SAK-3386] Download/Upload not working.
column6:
After using the site import feature, I noticed that Samigo quizzes were not being transferred to the new site. As a workaround, I tried exporting the test from the old site using the export feature in Samigo. Rather than exporting a file, Samigo exported XML directly to a browser window. I tried cutting and pasting that text into an xml file and then uploading the file into the Samigo tool in the new site but it failed to work. I'm really reporting a number of bugs here:

1) When using the site import feature, quizzes are not imported.
2) When exporting xml in Samigo it doesn't (at least by default) download to an xml file. Instead it outputs to the browser window.
3) The Samigo import feature fails to import xml that it exported.
4) On a failed import the user isn't notified of what exceptions are being thrown.

Hope this helps.
column10: Download/Upload not working.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Some of these bugs are not really bugs, but misunderstanding of given features

1) When using the site import feature, quizzes are not imported.

This is a 'bug" in site import. It is not a bug in Samigo. That is to say that the authors of site import did not consider the retention of test and quizzes data as part of the job of site import. I think it would be better described as an enhancement request for site import.

2) When exporting xml in Samigo it doesn't (at least by default) download to an xml file. Instead it outputs to the browser window.

It actually creates a browser window with an xml mime type, so that you can review the file created. You should be able to save it. That's what the instructions "Choose Download to generate an IMS QTI-compliant XML file
to download to your computer. Choose File on the browser menu and save page" mean. In case of confusion we also documented this more fully in sam/docs/README.import_export.txt
read Section 2. (Export Assessment XML Format.), there are some extra options in Firefox that confuse some people.

3) The Samigo import feature fails to import xml that it exported.
We'd need to have more information on that in order to reproduce the problem. However look at the README.import_export.txt documentation I recommended above. It is possible to save an xml file as text in Firefox,

4) On a failed import the user isn't notified of what exceptions are being thrown.
column48:
3continued.... -jira only allows so much information-

ahem, I will try again....

3) The Samigo import feature fails to import xml that it exported.
We'd need to have more information on that in order to reproduce the problem. However look at the README.import_export.txt documentation I recommended above. It is possible to save an xml file as text in Firefox,
which saves only the text nodes--don't choose that option.
column52:
sorry... JIRA is retarded in how much detail I can put in.

to continue...

4) On a failed import the user isn't notified of what exceptions are being thrown.

Actually it does. However usually the the XML parsing is not super helpful unless I dump an entire stack trace.
For example, if you try to do something really wrong, like import a JPEG file, it will try to create an XML W3C document and then to parse it. It won't get that far, because the document is not created.

The exception is almost invariably a NullPointerException. However the error message also instructs the user to makesure that the document is OK.
column56:
Ok. One of these bugs I reported is a "misunderstanding" and failure on my part to read the fine print. In our own testing tool we archive tests as well – but the default is that the archive saves to a file not to the browser window. I can't claim that our users are representative of how other people would expect the export to work. I can say however that we started with outputting to the browser but that our users preferred having it output directly to a file (it's one less step for the user after all).

I've also attached a short 1 question exportAssessment.xml file which I tried to import into Samigo in 2.1 using (this time) I.E. 6.0. The xml failed to import and no exceptions were reported to the screen. In fact after the import Samigo failed to display anything – a blank pagerenders in the Tests and Quizzes iframe instead. In the next reply I'll attached the screenshot (scroll to the right, its a wide screen). Cheers, Luke

column1: [SAK-3350] Gradebook / Pass/Not Pass should be configurable per institution
column6: The terms Pass/Not Pass and the required grade of P/NP should be configurable per institution. At IU, we use S/F instead of P/NP, so transferring these grades to our Registrar during official final grades time has proved to be quite cumbersome for the users as they have to first input P/NP in the Gradebook and then when they import their grades into the Official Final Grades Gradebook they have to change everything to S/F. If these grades were configurable, a university could set this up at the admin level and relieve the pressure from the user. Please let me know if you need any additional information. Thanks!
column7: Windows XP SP2, IE6 SP2, Oracle Stable 2.1
column10: Gradebook / Pass/Not Pass should be configurable per institution
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column48: This is really a feature request for new functionality in the Gradebook, not a bug.
column52: See SAK-8012 Resolved , which incorporates this issue in the larger context of the need for configurable grading schema.
column56:
Anticipating this kind of need, UC Berkeley provided in the source release a short instruction file called add_custom_grade_mappings.txt (you can find it in sakai-src/gradebook/xdocs). The solution involves a fairly simple extending of the org.sakaiproject.tool.gradebook.GradeMapping class.

What's particularly nice in your case is that the existing examples of doing such an extension includes PassNotPassMapping.java which can be found in /sakai-src/gradebook/component-data/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/gradebook

Configuring so that you get S/F instead of P/NP in your gradebook should be pretty straightforward following what was done for PassNotPassMapping.

In the long term, work is being considered here for some more elegant configuration capabilities possible, especially dealing with localization. This work may supersede the solution mentioned above.
column60: Added PassNotPassMapping to Oncourse overlay.
column64: In revision 9202 of the Sakai 2.2 trunk, the Gradebook added support for more easily configurable grading scales. See "gradebook/xdocs/add_custom_grade_mappings.txt".

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Kris, This was this fix does.
a) Lets you edit topic settings even if the forum is locked
b) Shows a lock sign in front of topics (even though the topic themselves are not individually locked)
c) Unlocking forums will unlock topics which ever not locked intentionally.
column48:
Rashmi, I think a problem I just found may be related to this fix. Here's what I did (Windows XP SP2, IE6 SP2, Oncourse Staging):

1. In Forum Settings, I clicked Yes next to Lock Forum.
2. Then I clicked Save Settings.
3. Next I clicked Topic Settings next to a Topic (unlocked) under the locked Forum.
4. I clicked Revise.
5. I added a Short Description and clicked Save Settings.
6. I get a WSOD.

I've tested this same functionality when the topic is not locked and when only the topic itself is locked (not the forum) and it works fine, which is what makes me think that this fix is the most likely cause of the problem above. Please let me know if you need any additional information. Thanks!

column1: [SAK-3305] webdav / unable to set up network places to two user accounts at the same time
column6: I set up two user accounts on the MIT Stable instance running Oracle (Sakai 2.1.006). I went in and uploaded a file to each account via the web interface. I then tried to set up a network place for each account on the same machine. The first account connected without a problem. I was able to see the file that I had uploaded and upload/download operations were working perfectly. I then tried creating another network place for the second user account. I got all the way through the creation process, but when it tried to access the folder I got an error (see screenshot). The file that I had uploaded did not show up, and every time I tried to upload a new file, I get an error telling me that the file name already exists (even though it shows me a 0 byte file as the existing one).
column7: Windows XP (SP-2) / MIT Stable running Oracle (Sakai 2.1.006)
column10: webdav / unable to set up network places to two user accounts at the same time
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: One possibility is that WebDAV shares session information between folders? I noticed that if you are logged into Sakai using IE as user X, and you set up a WebDAV folder as user Y, your Sakai session in IE changes to user Y, which is rather unexpected (IE 6.0, WinXP SP2).
column48: I think Stephen's comment is getting at the underlying problem here, how Windows XP handles its sessions. It was unable to connect to the same instance of Sakai using two different user accounts, as initially reported; however, I was able to connect to two different Sakai instances using two different accounts. We probably will not be able to fix this issue from Sakai, so we'll have to come up with a workaround, if possible. (Note that in the similar problem of trying to access Sakai as two different users with a browser, the workaround to the similar problem is to use two diffferent browsers, such as IE with one user ID and Mozilla with the other user ID, however, that doesn't help in the case of WebDAV and Windows.)
column52: Is there a definitive answer on whether or not we're going to attempt to fix this?
column56: No responses, assuming this will not be fixed for now.

column10: help for database connection
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Hello,

Sakai is configured by default to work with hysqld. If you would like to use it with an external database, such as MySQL or Oracle, then you need to obtain and install that database software separately. MySQL is freely available and is one of the databases which is documented for use with Sakai. (Check out the documentation at http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/DOC/Database+Configuration for assistance with configuring Sakai and MySQL.)

For general help questions, you can send email to sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org. Before doing so, however, you need to join the "Sakai Developement" worksite on http://collab.sakaiproject.org, if you haven't already, in order to have permission to post to the list. Joining that Sakai Worksite will also provide you with access to the Email Archive on that site, which represents another great source of information on configuring and developing with Sakai.

column1: [SAK-3303] Repeated authentications generate repeated WARNs in log about existing sessions
column6: LoginUtil.login() doesn't appear to be checking for existing sessions. Instead, it tries to create a new session every time.
column10: Repeated authentications generate repeated WARNs in log about existing sessions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
My e-mail message to sakai-dev about this for posterity.

–

Date: Thu, 22 Dec 2005 17:46:51 -0500 (EST)
From: Seth Theriault <slt@columbia.edu>
To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
Subject: DAV, Sakai sessions, and addSession WARNs
Hi everyone,

While modifying the stock Kerberos provider to do some caching (to
alleviate any load that DAV logins might put on a KDC), I have been
taking a closer look at the DAV servlet's behavior.

For 2.1, a change was made to force re-authentication for every DAV
request. This wasn't being done before, but should have been for
security reasons. A side effect of this change seems to be that the
Sakai logs begin to fill with the following lines:

WARN: addSession: already have a session (2005-12-22 17:29:05,096
http-9090-Processor25_org.sakaiproject.component.adaptor.UsageSessionServiceAdaptor)

after the user re-authenticates for DAV.

I think I have tracked this down to the login() call in:

legacy/util/src/java/org/sakaiproject/util/LoginUtil.java

which is called in:

legacy/dav/src/java/org/sakaiproject/dav/DavServlet.java

In this case, login() never checks for an existing session, but just
tries to create a new one. This is producing the WARN message in the
logs.

I did some poking around and came across assureSession() in:

kernel/request/src/java/org/sakaiproject/util/RequestFilter.java

where there is some checking done, etc. It's a "protected" thing so I
am assuming it's local to the RequestFilter.

I am thinking that DavServlet needs to be using calling something like
assureSession() instead of login(). Or perhaps login() could be made a
bit smarter? Ideas anyone?

For completeness, this particular issue isn't specifically reported in
JIRA, but one open item has the same error message with slightly
different circumstances:

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-2548

Seth
column48:
My e-mail message to sakai-dev about this for posterity.

–

Date: Thu, 22 Dec 2005 17:46:51 -0500 (EST)
From: Seth Theriault <slt@columbia.edu>
To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
Subject: DAV, Sakai sessions, and addSession WARNs
Hi everyone,

http-9090-Processor25_org.sakaiproject.component.adaptor.UsageSessionServiceAdaptor)

after the user re-authenticates for DAV.

where there is some checking done, etc. It's a "protected" thing so I

I am thinking that DavServlet needs to be using calling something like

column52:
Revision 5349 fixes this problem.

This changes the startSession code to remove the WARN message when
the startSession is called when a UsageSession already exists. The
existing session is returned if the UserId of the current session matches
the UserId of the "new" session. If these two do not match, a brand new
session is created and a warning message is emitted.
column56:
Additional unnecessary logging cleanup.

Revision: 5350

Modified:
trunk/sakai/legacy/dav/src/java/org/sakaiproject/dav/DavServlet.java
Log:
Change logging level for some normal use cases. The use case is that the
Windows XP DAV client checks for a file to exist before creating it.

Prior to this mod this generated a WARN in the log. This is a completely normal
occurance so the proper log level is debug.
column60:
More detail:

Because DAV is effectively re-establishing UsageSession on each request, we need a way in this code to "assure that a session exists". The current method signatures are startSession which pitches a WARN if the session exists and getSession which pitches a WARN if the session does not exist.

Neither of these methods would work because they were too WARN-happy. Also startSession had a possible security bug because it would happily return whatever UsageSession was in Session regardless of whether the ID's matched between the sessions.

So I fixed all of these at the same time.

I made it a non-WARN in startSession and silently returned the existing session when the ID's matched.

When the ID's did not match, I did not return the "old session" - I issued a WARN (this is truly a bad situation) and made a new session with the right user ID so that I never had the chance to return the "wrong session". I doubt that there is any way to get this to happen from the outside but I figured, why not clean it up in case some other layer of code screwed up.

The only possible improvements beyond this would be to:

(a) make an assureSession or
(b) update the UsageSession record in the memory and/or in the DB if the userAgent or IP address changed.

I figured that (a) was unnecessary because startSession could be reasonably modified to "do the logical thing" and (b) might become a performance issue if we kept banging the DB to update the agent or IP address.

One thing possibly to add a warn about is a changing IP address and then wipe and rebuild the session - this could be added. I don't think that a changing user agent is a good idea to get all flustered about (i.e. make a new session just for for a user agent change). The question is whether to just INFO or make a new session when the IP address changes. My feeling is that if we feel that it should be logged then we should make a new session - so the log does not fill up for the next 5000 requests where IP address mismatches.
column64: This should have been resolved in the 2.1.2 release. Unfortunately, there were not sufficiant QA resources to test this in that cycle. If you find this is still a problem, please reopen the ticket.

column1: [SAK-3300] Profile not shown for users Instructor and Student when vieweing from Roster
column6:
In the Roster, clicking on a Profile as "Student" or as "Instructor" (not as admin user) shows no profile as below:

No Picture is Available
Public Information
No public information is available for this user.
Personal Information
No personal information is available for this user.

When listing all students/instructors, pictures are shown if "Show Official ID Photo" is clicked for admin and Instructors but not for Students.

Note: all user profiles exist and are public.
column10: Profile not shown for users Instructor and Student when vieweing from Roster
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
I now clearly understand what's happening:
This bug is only true when creating user profiles with the API, because if SakaiPerson.setHidePrivateInfo() and SakaiPerson.setHidePublicInfo() were not set, the corresponding fields in SAKAI_PERSON_T table will be NULL. Later, in profile tool (edit), these null fields wiil be interpreted as "not hidden". The problem is that, the profile search and the profile accessed within the roster tool, interpret the NULL value as "hidden".

If, when creating users through the API, one sets SakaiPerson.setHidePrivateInfo(false) and SakaiPerson.setHidePublicInfo(false), everything works correctly. The problem is that the NULL value is interpreted differently in different class methods (Edit profile/Search profile/ View profile in Roster).

FIX: interpret HIDE_PRIVATE_INFO/HIDE_PUBLIC_INFO fields in SAKAI_PERSON_T table as 0 (false) if not set (ie, NULL) in the Edit Profile (Profile tool).

NOTE: this is related with SAK-3299; actually, it is the same bug.
column48: See SAK-3299 Closed for progress gonig forward on this issue.

Since there has been no recent activity on this issue, it is likely that the Bug no longer exists in more recent versions of Sakai; however, if this issue is indeed still a concern for a supported version of Sakai, please do re-open the issue and add the appropriate 2.3, 2.4, and/or 2.5 version to the Affects Version field. (Please do not remove existing Affects Versions when adding the new Affects Versions.)
