column1: [SAK-3298] Profile picture display distorts aspect ratio
column6: Profile picture is always sketch: it should be propotional resized. Please note that, when viewing the profile from the Roster, picture is not sketched.
column10: Profile picture display distorts aspect ratio
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Nuno, Could you please clarify further what you mean by "sketched"? Thanks. (I'm thinking you probably mean stretched or perhaps skewed?)
column48: I'm sorry, I meant streched. The image is being scaled but not in 1:1 (eg, an image of 150x100 should be resized to 75x50 and not 75x75).
column52: Obrigado!
column56:
When specifying an external URL for profile pics, the URL is being included using HTML like this:

<img id="profileForm:image2" src="https://vula.uct.ac.za/access/content/user/marquard/public/stephen-nov05-smaller.jpg" alt="User selected picture" height="75" width="75" />

i.e. both HEIGHT and WIDTH attributes are specified, hence the aspect ratio of the displayed pic in the browser is incorrect (unless the source pic happens to be exactly square).

Only a WIDTH attribute should be specified, so that the pic scales appropriately, preserving aspect ratio.
column60:
Also an issue in the Roster display when pictures are displayed (with external URLs), e.g.:

<td class="rosterGroupByRoleColumns_1"><img src="https://vula.uct.ac.za/access/content/user/marquard/public/stephen-nov05-smaller.jpg" height="75" width="75" alt="" /></td>
column64: attached are 2 patches to fix this for 2.1.1
column132:
This is probably a result of specifying 75x75 for the image size, instead of just specifying a width setting. See the related JIRA.

It would be nice to get this fixed, as it's a trivial fix, and this is one of the patches we have to keep applying (since 2.1.1) whenever we move to new versions.
column143: As far as I'm aware, these sizings were all moved to CSS in Gonzalo's refactoring, and the scaling issue fixed in the default CSS. So this can probably be marked resolved.
column150: Resolving for now. Re-open if problem still exists.
column154: This has been verified

column1: [SAK-3297] Official Photo (University Id Picture) is not shown.
column6:
Official photo (University Id Picture) is never shown in the Profile Tool. This looks a bug in the ProfileManagerImpl.java, in the method getInstitutionalPhoto(String uid, boolean siteMaintainer): switching the sakaiPerson object with sakaiSystemPerson object jumps over this limitation (this should not be, however, the correct fix).
From what I have seen, entries in SAKAI_PERSON_T table are created with the key pair (agent_uuid, type_uuid) and, in my experiments, type_uuid of user's profiles are always of 'UserMutableType'. But in the referenced method, an entry of (agent_uuid, SystemMutableType) must NOT return null in order to display picture!
column10: Official Photo (University Id Picture) is not shown.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
There has been some discussion around this in the sakai-dev at collab, originally coming from a StaleObjectStateException occuring after modifying the user profile. This is related.

Actually, there is a working way of setting the university picture and avoiding the later exception from occurring:
1. create an entry in SAKAI_PERSON_T for (user ID, UserMutableType) with all user information; this is viewable and editable by the user. PHOTO column MUST be null or a StaleObjectStateException will be thrown after the user tries to modify their profile;
2. create an entry in SAKAI_PERSON_T for (user ID, SystemMutableType) with ONLY PHOTO (I have UID_C too) fields filled;

This way, profile will be edited by the user (without generating the exception) and Universite picture will be shown.

In my opinion, this bug should be different. maybe one of the proposals below?:

  • procedure to set University photo must be documented;
    or
  • sakai should check for image in (user ID, UserMutableType) before checking (user ID, SystemMutableType) => implies fixing StaleObjectStateException thrown after editing profile.

Nuno Fernandes.
column48:
Hi Lance,

Forwarding your post:
"What we have working at Indiana is photos in the SystemMutableType
record as you suggested. Having a photo in the UserMutableType should
also work but we have not tested that scenario."

Photos in UserMutableType are never shown (actually, having anything different from NULL in JPEG_PHOTO in this UserMutableProfile profile leads to the StaleObjectStateException refered above).

Probably it would be good to have these two possibilities (photos both in User and SystemMutableType)?

Nuno.

column1: [SAK-8082] Need the ability to deny permissions
column6: A deny permission is needed in order to be able to control read/write access to subfolders. Without it, read access to a subfolder can't be prevented since you can't take away a permission granted at the parent folder, and in order to get to the subfolder, you need readd access at the parent. A deny capability would also be useful in conjunction with the !site.helper realm, to deny certain permissions to a role in all sites. See SAK-1609 Closed for further details.

column1: [SAK-3292] public view link
column6:
Currently rwiki view pages include a 'public view' link at the bottom. The two cases for using the 'public view' (which gives a wiki view excluding tool menus, etc. and optionally excluding breadcrumbs) are:

a. for using wiki pages elsewhere in a site (e.g. as a site home page) - requires user to be authenticated to Sakai
b. for using wiki pages in a completely public context (doesn't require Sakai authentication).

Case (b) isn't currently completely supported, and some extra work needs to be done to handle this case smoothly.

We'd like to suggest that this should be presented in the UI as follows:

1. Remove 'public view' from the view page link (as it's potentially confusing to users)

2. Add 'public view' link to the page Info. However, if the backend implementation of 'public view' will still take a while (to allow wiki to display pages without an authenticated Sakai session), then the link could be named 'plain view' to make its purpose clearer.

For anyone who would like to suppress 'public view' in the meantime, here is a simple patch to do so (2.1x-maint r4873)

— rwiki/rwiki/src/webapp/WEB-INF/command-pages/view.jsp.orig 2005-12-22 12:00:11.056266367 +0200
+++ rwiki/rwiki/src/webapp/WEB-INF/command-pages/view.jsp 2005-12-22 12:00:22.927017180 +0200
@@ -103,11 +103,6 @@
</div>
</div>
</div>

  • <jsp:element name="a"><!--
  • --><jsp:attribute name="href"><c:out value="$ {viewBean.publicViewUrl}

    "/></jsp:attribute><!--

  • -><jsp:attribute name="target">publicview</jsp:attribute><!-
  • ->public link<!-
  • --></jsp:element>
    </div>
    </div>
    <jsp:directive.include file="comments.jsp"/>

column1: [SAK-3290] Suppress Edit link if user does not have page edit rights

column10: Suppress Edit link if user does not have page edit rights
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
At one point we did this and we were asked for consistent header bars, so we put it back in.

We could grey out, but this goes against the Style Guide.

I notice that the rest of sakai removes links that are permission denied (Worksite Setup)

What should we do ?
column48:
I think there are 2 possible UI approaches:

  • Hide links that aren't available (rest of Sakai)
  • Grey them out (e.g. Windows)

Having an active link that doesn't let you do anything is leading the user into a dead-end (plus also not giving any clues about whether a page is editable or not).

So my vote, for consistency, is to remove the link.

One could also consider replacing 'Edit' with a 'View Source' link so that users can still get to the markup of a locked page - for example to copy it into another page which they can edit.

column1: [SAK-3288] wiki contents not duplicated, when sakai worksite duplicated (through worksite setup)
column6:
Using the worksite setup in Sakai to duplicate a site which contains a wiki, results in the site being correctly cloned, all bar the wiki contents - instead the wiki on the newly created "duplicate" site just contains the standard pages that you get when you add the wiki to your site, rather than the pages in the duplication-source wiki site.
This is a feature we would like to see added as it would be really useful to us. This extra integration would also make rwiki behaviour more consistent with other sakai tools, eg. the resources tool.
One usecase for this is:
students contribute to a class created encyclopedia, at a set date you want to clone that 'encylopedia' to assess it (without the need, to continually look at the page historys), but you would like them to be able to continue contributing to the original 'encyclopedia'.
column10: wiki contents not duplicated, when sakai worksite duplicated (through worksite setup)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Being a newly added tool, support for duplication and Export/Import is not yet implemented in the wiki.

We should consider raising the bar for tool migration from contrib to "enterprise bundel" to include these abilities.

Note that for some tools, such as Discussion, and probably Wiki too, the most common goal of duplicating a course site tends to be a fresh, clean start, but with organizational elements preserved; in other words, content generated by previous semesters' students is left behind, however, the desire is to have categories, topics, page hierarchies, etc. be part of the duplication. If the desire is to also include content, such as in the use case described above, then the tool's Export/Import functionality can be used to achieve that result, after a site has been duplicated. It is also worth considering presenting the user with the option of importing just structure or both structure and content when duplicating a site or creating a site and re-using materials from a previous term.

column1: [SAK-3287] Option for case-insensitive internal passwords
column6:
For users which are held internally in the Sakai database (i.e. not authenticated through a provider), passwords are case-sensitive.

Some institutions may regard it as desireable to have passwords be case-insensitive to reduce support queries, especially where users are accustomed to case-insensitive passwords on other systems (e.g. Novell servers).

There should therefore be an option (in sakai.properties) to make internal Sakai passwords case-insensitive by implementing the following:

  • When passwords are created or updated, force the supplied password to lowercase before adding the hashed password to the db
  • When a password is supplied for authentication, force the the supplied password to lowercase before creating a hash for comparison with the db password hash
column10: Option for case-insensitive internal passwords
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Should probably also support conversion mechanisms for switching between modes.
column48:
Internal Sakai passwords are stored as hashes, so there is no possibility of converting from case-sensitive to case-insensitive passwords (as the cleartext password is not available).

It would be possible to switch from case-insensitive to case-sensitive, with the starting point being all passwords lower-case. Switching the other way around would effectively break all passwords which had upper-case characters in them.
column52: Right, not convert the passwords but support for the conversion of Sakai between the two modes, which means you need some mechanism to inform the users and reset the passwords when switching modes, such as emailing new passwords to already registered uesrs.

column1: [SAK-8012] Gradebook as grading schema provider/helper
column6:
Since grading schemas can be common across multiple tools, I think gradebook should provide a service and/or a helper tool so that other tools can draw from some common set of grading schemas. Such a service should provide a way to define a customizable and extendable set of schemas. Other tools then can incorporate this functionality or build upon it, instead of writing tool-specific schemas. Users, administrators and developers of the system benefit when common tasks are handled in a uniform manner (they don't have to recreate grading schemas for different tools, with potentially unfamiliar UI's).

It would be nice if the common set of grading schemas was easily configurable, perhaps similar to the way other lists of things are handled in sakai.properties. For example,

gradescales.count=4
gradescale.1=A,B,C,D,I,W
gradescale.2=Pass,Fail
gradescale.3=A+,A,A-,B+,B,B-,C+,C,C-,D+,D,D-,F
gradescale.4=5,4,3,2,1

and then Assignments, Gradebook, T&Q would provide those scales for use and limit the acceptable values to those specified when the scale is not a point range.
column10: Gradebook as grading schema provider/helper
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

column1: [SAK-7900] Timed Release of Resources
column6:
Our faculty want finer grained control over when resources are visible to students. They want to be able to upload resources, yet still constrain the dates/times at which they are readable.

Use cases:

  • An instructor wants to pre-load all her resources at the beginning of the term, but organized into one folder for each week of class, and each folder is automatically "turned on" at the beginning of each week.
  • An instructor wants to upload exam solutions to the site, but set them to be visible only at midnight following the exam day.
  • An instructor wants "stale" content to disappear from the student's view after two weeks, yet still wants to keep the content visible to teaching assistants and instructors of the site.
column10: Timed Release of Resources
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: This is also an essential requirement (similar timeframes) for University of Cape Town (UCT) and University of South Africa (UNISA)
column48:
Also esential for University of Cambridge, we are getting demand from many TA's and Instructors who have gotten used to this feature in Coursework and so use it at course setup time to deliver content acording to the teaching plan.

They are not to happy about having to go in once a week and release material manually.

column1: [SAK-4494] Site Usage Statistics Tool [Formerly REQ-5]
column6:
Sitestats tool, currently a Contrib Project.

See: http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/STAT
column10: Site Usage Statistics Tool [Formerly REQ-5]
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
I agree. Many of our faculty are really after us about this. We probably can't do a final cutover to Sakai without it.

Our faculty seem to want two different things:

  • the ability to see which parts of the site have been used
  • the ability to see what specific students have done. They want to be able to see whether students have looked at readings, etc.

This is an area where individual institutions are likely to need to tailor things. I'd try to do a fairly general tool that lets people design their own reports. One approach would be to make the data available via SQL and depend upon a good general-purpose SQL report generator. Report generation is a specialized function where lots of work has been done. It may not make sense for the Sakai community to duplicate this work. I haven't assessed the tools, but I'd assume there would be an open source tool we could use.
column48: We, at University of Lleida (Spain), have make a tool that shows, for each student in a course, the global number of visits to the course for the student and the last visit time. When you click on a specific user, you can view all the visits relative to this student. We have make it using the information stored by presence tool.

column1: [SAK-3281] Wiki page titles should preserve case
column6:
It would be nice if Wiki page titles preserved case. For example if you create a new page from an existing page with a link like:

[BBC News]

the page itself is headed

Bbc News

which is unexpected when acronyms are used in the page title. This is not to suggest that page titles should be case sensitive (as they are in mediawiki for example), rather that the case used when the page is initially created is preserved, i.e. preserve case for page title display purposes (page title, Index, Recent Changes) but match case insensitively.
column10: Wiki page titles should preserve case
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
There is also some inconsistency with subspace page titles which the above may resolve. At present if you create a subspace with a link such as:

[Group 1 / Topics]

the subspace name gets lowercased in page titles, so you get:

group 1/Topics

as the page title. Preserving case should address this as well.
column48: We feel that fixing SAK-3281 Closed will resolve this issue
column52:
We need to create a seperate page title attribute associated with the page.

When a page is created the page title is set to the verbatum contents of the link, and the page name is set to the normalised contents of the link

eg
[BBC Home Page] will generate
page-title='BBC Home Page'
page-name='/32-234234-234-234234-234/bbc home page'

New links that normalise to the same page name will link to the page eg
[BbC hoMe page]
will link to page-name='/32-234234-234-234234-234/bbc home page'

1. Should the page Title be editable
2. How should breadcrumbs be rendered
2.1 <a href="..... view?pageName=bbc%20home%20page">BBC Home Page</a>
2.2 <a href="..... view?pageName=bbc%20home%20page">Bbc Home Page</a>
3. How should page links be rendered (as above)
4. Should there be restrictions on changing the Page Title (eg normalises to the same page name) or should it be completely editable.

I think we need to answer these before we start implementation
column56:
Here are my votes:

1. Page title should be editable as part of a Rename operation (when that's supported)

2. Breadcrumbs should be rendered with the canonical case (i.e. not normalized)

3. Page links should be rendered as they occur in the page (so if you link to [bbc home page] that's what you'll see in your link text, but the page title will display 'BBC Home Page' when you get there).

4. You can edit the page title as a Rename operation - if it renames to the same normalized page, then the page title is updated but the page name stays the same, otherwise both update (and to be fully useful, rename should leave behind a 'redirect' like mediawiki - i.e. going to the old name redirects you to the new name, so you don't break all incoming links).
column60:
I would prefer to see case sensitive naming, and observation of the supplied case rather than a seperate page naming convention which too my mind would complicate the markup syntax.
I think it would be better to risk having two pages like 'Henry' and 'henry', than the current arrangement. Ideally when they try to create 'henry' it would be nice if we they were informed that 'Henry' already existed (if it did), and asked them if they wished to continue anyway.

column1: [SAK-3278] My Workspace Resources broken for accounts with @ in username
column6:
When guest accounts are created with an @ in the username (i.e. using an email address as the account id), Resources in My Workspace is broken. Steps to reproduce:

1. Login as admin
2. Add a new account of type guest, username = email address (e.g. someone@xyz.com).
3. Login as the new user
4. Click on Resources in My Workspace

The same behaviour can be seen when adding such users via Add Participants in Worksite Setup (as guest users).

See screenshot.

column48:
The problem is present in TRUNK in r4851 so is not fixed.

catalina.out logs (from a user abc@xyz attempting to access resources):

WARN: org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.content.DbContentService@392814.enableResources: org.sakaiproject.exception.IdInvalidException: cannot contain any of the following characters: / \ % * ? # & = id= cannot contain any of the following characters: / \ % * ? # & = (2005-12-21 16:12:04,656 http-8080-Processor25_org.sakaiproject.component.framework.log.CommonsLogger)

which seems odd as the forbidden characters list doesn't include @, but perhaps @ is being escaped to something using one of the forbidden characters?

column1: [SAK-3277] Formatting of password in automated email can lead to confusion
column6:
When you add a guest user to a site using the tool in "worksite setup" and select to send the user an email notification. They get a password which is a negative number:

"our password is -154976478. You can later go to the Account tool in your My Workspace site to reset it."

It is potentially confusing to the user as to whether their password is "-154976478" or whether the dash is just a separator and their password is "154976478".
column10: Formatting of password in automated email can lead to confusion
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
The password was randomly generated by using current time value as the seed. Since user can always change his password later, I don't think that negative password for first time login usage will cause big problem.

Thanks,

  • Zhen
column48: No - from a support view this is a big problem - its unclear to users what their password is (is that a hyphen before the password? etc) - this is unepeced behaviour to the end user, who is likely to be unfamiliar to Sakai.
column52:
Zhen, how about reformatting the email messsage to clear up any potential for confusion here by putting the password on its own line. I don't have a copy of an actual email in front of me, but something like:

...your password is:

-154976478

You can later go to the Account tool in your My Workspace site to reset it....
column56:
Done as suggested in r4857.

  • Zhen
column60:
I'd still like to agrue that the password should not be a negative number - this is unexpected behaviour and is causing us major support headaches. If the number generated is negative can't we do something like:

if (i < 0) {
i=i * -1;
}

?
column64:
Index: sakai/legacy/tools/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/sitesetup/SiteAction.java
===================================================================
— sakai/legacy/tools/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/sitesetup/SiteAction.java (revision 4873)
+++ sakai/legacy/tools/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/sitesetup/SiteAction.java (working copy)
@@ -10565,6 +10565,10 @@
//because of cosign security for emailInIdAccount account, password can be set to anything
Random generator = new Random(System.currentTimeMillis());
Integer num = new Integer(generator.nextInt());
+ if (num.compareTo(new Integer(0)) < 0)

{ + int intNum = num.intValue() * -1; + num = new Integer(intNum); + }

pw = num.toString();
uEdit.setPassword(pw);
UserDirectoryService.commitEdit(uEdit);
column132: Dave, could you elaborate on what the unexpected behavior is that is causing major support headaches? I thought I understood from the first comments that it was just a case of the hyphen being interpreted by users as a separator character, rather than being part of the password itself. Placing the password on its own line eliminates that, so what are the remaining concerns? Thanks.
column143: Zhen, is there any reason not to just absolute-value this number and force it to be non-negative?
column150:
Hi Guys,

Basically we are finding that users don't expect a password to be a negative number - its an unusual case and the first system that I have come across that does this. Users do expect either a number (like a pin) or a mix of numbers and letters. Most seem to assume (regardles of the formating) that the minus is not part of the password - this results in a support call.
column154:
Fixed with r5099, which makes sure that the returned pseudo random password is always a positive number.

  • Zhen
column158:
Just tested this against the stable instance running oracle and the password is still being sent as a negative number-

"You have been added to Sakai Based Service (http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8120/portal) by Kevin Brokamp.

Your password is
-284953007

You can later go to the Account tool in your My Workspace site to reset it."
column167: Unfortunately only the first part of this issue, formatting the password on its own line was fixed in time to make 2.1.1.002 (r4857). The change (r5099) to ensure a non-negative value is only in trunk at this time.
column181: no more negative numbers.
column185: new layout of passwords verified; on the emails received, no numbers were negative

column1: [SAK-3276] security service cache improperly configured
column6:
The security service cache was configured as a "soft" cache, rather than the "hard" cache it needs to be. Our experience with "soft" reference caches is that they are either not implemented properly in Sakai or they don't live up to their promise of easier memory management; either way, we don't use them anymore.

This could maybe result in a less efficient cache, but I have not yet confirmed that being "soft" or "hard" makes a real difference there.
column10: security service cache improperly configured
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Even though this may not be an operational problem, I fixed it to be "hard" like the other caches anyway.
column48: verified in production implementation

column1: [SAK-3275] double score in fill in the blanks with multiple correct answers ( {case1|case2} )
column6:
Not sure if this has been reported or not, I cant find anything in Jira about it. Please point me in the right direction if I¨m wrong.

In test and quizzes, one of our teachers have fill in the blanks questions with acceptable variations of the correct answer (like

{case1|case2|case3}

). When the students has done the test some (not all) student results on those questions are doubled compared to the designated point.

This behaviour is close: http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-2683, but it seems as it is the "piped" ( | ) answer key and not the wildcards that somehow is messing up for us...

I've had problem to reproduce this myself in a worksite of my own. It happends in a course site with 100+ students and intensive use of T&Q.

column1: [SAK-3233] Unable to add new guest users in Sakai 2.1 worksite
column6:
I am unable to add new users to a Sakai 2.1 worksite. To reproduce the issue, as the maintainer of a project site:
1. Clicked Site Info
2. Add Participants
3. To the lower box (Guest(s) Email Address), added an external email address that has not been previously used in Sakai.
Attempted to save in the final screen, but received an error "Alert: guest <my email> is invalid. <my email> could not be added - account does not exist."

I was able to add an external email address to my new worksite for my other external account, but it had already been added to another published project site some time ago in Sakai 2.0. Also, I am still able to add an external user on our production instance of Sakai 2.0 with no problem.

Just to check, I went into the admin site to manually add my external email account as the User ID, but it told me that the User ID was invalid.

Currently, we have the Whitelist Tool installed on both Sakai 2.0 and Sakai 2.1.

Let me know if you need any further information from me.

Dawn Eckert

column1: [SAK-4839] PM / Groups of participants are missing in the To field
column6:
The To field currently includes the following groups:

Entire Class
All Instructors

Additional groups should include the following:

All Assistants
All Students
All Observers
All Visitors

In a project site, this list would be different, so it would include the following:

Entire Site
All Project Owners
All Assistants
All Candidates
All Members
All Observers
All Reviewers
column10: PM / Groups of participants are missing in the To field
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Jarrod, Josh Holtzman just brought this bug to my attention because he wanted to know if we were planning to hard code the roles that would be listed in the To field, which made me realize that the way I worded this bug isn't quite right. What should happen is the To field should include all roles that are available in a particular site, no more, no less. So, in Oncourse CL, the roles that are included in a class site are listed above and these should be included in the To field. However, in Sakai, the roles that are included in a class site are Instructor, Student, and Teaching Assistant, so these are the roles that would be included in the To field. I hope this makes sense. Please let me know if you have any questions.
column48: Raising the criticality of this bug. Within a project site, 'Entire Class' needs to be 'Entire Site'. You could use 'All Participants' instead. Actually, that's probably better.
column52: Resolved.

column1: [SAK-3221] rwiki.update and rwiki.admin rights not applied
column6:
Setting rwiki.update and/or rwiki.admin rights for a user appears to have no effect - these rights do not show up in the rwiki tool for the user under page info.

To reproduce:

  • Create a project worksite
  • Add a user with access role in that site
  • Verify that for the realm setup for that site (or the !site.template.project realm) the right rwiki.update has been granted
  • Login as a user with access role
  • In the wiki tole, try to edit the home page
  • Select page info - Update is shown as 'no'

It appears the minimum rights required to edit pages are in fact superadmin.
column10: rwiki.update and rwiki.admin rights not applied
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Are you sure that 'group' edits aren't disabled for that page? The default permissions on auto-generated pages have update permissions enabled for only the owner. (Which is the worksite owner.)
column48: Sorry, you are correct - I hadn't figured that out. It seems I can change this to work the way I'd like it to by editing prepopulateComponents.xml (i.e. enable group write by default).

column1: [SAK-3219] announcement notification sent with blank body and title
column6: Due to a bug in thread-local caching when an announcement is posted, notiications of announcements from users who don't have the annc.all.groups permission end up using an expired cached version of the announcment, one without the body or title.
column10: announcement notification sent with blank body and title
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Fixed by clearing the thread-local cache of the message that is updated in the commit(), so the old version is not used when processing the notifications.

column1: [SAK-3212] RWiki Tool registers incorrect realm functions on startup
column6:
The RWiki Tool by default registers the following functions:

rwiki.admin
rwiki.delete
rwiki.read
rwiki.superadmin
rwiki.update

rwiki.delete should not be registered as it is for future features, but rwiki.create MUST be registered in order to allow users to create pages.

column1: [SAK-7857] Allow users to specify their default WYSIWYG editor preference
column6:
Allow users to select the WYSIWYG editor of their choice (HtmlArea, FCK Editor, Sferyx, etc.). This could be surfaced under Prefereces. The setting should make their editor of choice the default in all Sakai tools in the user's sites. (This setting presumes that a Sakai tools' functionality will not be dependent on a particular WYSIWYG editor.) It may also be desirable to have the list of possible WYSIWYG editors configurable as a system-wide setting, i.e., in the sakai.properties file.

Use Cases:

  • Scientific users might want a WYSIWYG with good equation support.
  • Project site users might want a WYSIWYG with complex formating support.
  • Foreign language users might want a WYSIWYG with good spell-checking and internationalization support.
  • Support resources maybe limited, so one might want to limit the number of different WYSIWYG editors on a system-wide basis.
column10: Allow users to specify their default WYSIWYG editor preference
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
I am not so sure that this is a good idea. For large installations, the technical support costs of this much flexibility may be a problem. Since the editor is used nearly everywhere it is very bad for it to enxperience problems.

Perhaps a compromise is that Sakai has a system-side configuration option that determines the set of possible editors. If the configuration option only specifies one editor, users are not given the choice.
column48: Giving users lots of editors may be an issue. However I do thing we want at least some choice. Scientific users will want something with good equation support. This may result in a heavy-weight editor such as Sferyx that other users will not want. In fact there are several different approaches to equation editing, and users may need to pick one. Another approach is to provide a single editor, but have buttons that let the user call a specific equation editor as needed.
column52:
No, I wouldn't support giving users too many editor choices. I can imagine the support nightmares.

I was thinking about two choices - a light option and a robust option. For some users (and disciplines), an editor like sferyx is not necessary. Others would prefer to use a light weight editor, like FCK. But in some subjects, like in mathematics, foreign languages, etc. instructors can't work without an editor like sferyx. Even in subjects where a powerful editor is not necessary, we are finding that some users like access to a powerful editor for webdav support, spell-checking, etc. and are asking for this option!

Again, a couple of good editor choices would be nice - and if that's not possible, perhaps we can achieve the same results (satisfy the needs of a wide range of users) in another way. The need is there.
column56:
I guess that a good compromise here is in the properties file let the installing person specifiy a list of the editors which they wanted to make available. If the system installer only put in one, then this preference would not appear. If there was more than one then users could pick amongst the options. Then we have our cake and eat it too.

For smaller groups like scientists as Charles H suggests, they might not get confused. For 100,000 users - one choice is the best bet.

column1: [SAK-3211] Linear assessment type should be high-stakes
column6:
When you take an assessment with linear organization, you can only view the questions in order; there is no "previous" button or table of contents to let you return to previous questions. This implies a high-stakes test.

However, you can easily get around this by exiting the assessment in the middle with "save and exit", or by closing your browser. When you return to Sakai and retake the assessment, you'll start back at the beginning, with your previous answers saved.

We should decide whether linear assessments should be high-stakes or not. If not, there's no reason not to have a previous button. If they are, then when you exit the assessment and return you should return to the page you left and not the start.

column1: [SAK-3196] Style Guide does not differentiate between "Remove" and "Delete"
column6:
The Sakai 1.5 Style Guide recommends under Format for Common Words and Phrases (p. 45):

"remove <something> As in Remove Topic (not Delete Topic)"

--------------------------
"Remove" and "Delete" refer to different actions so their use should be clarified in the style guide.

"Remove" is typically non-destructive and the item is not deleted, but rather removed from display or selection. Ex: remove an attachment (but not delete the original file or resource), remove selected users from a list (but not delete the user account).

"Delete" refers to actually deleting the item and making it non-retrievable. Ex: delete a resource, discussion topic, or schedule event from the database.

See:http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/UI/Terminology+Inconsistencies+for+buttons+and+links
column10: Style Guide does not differentiate between "Remove" and "Delete"

column1: [SAK-3187] Course Grade Calculation Logic is Incorrect
column6:
We have a serious problem with the course grade calculation where the instructor has overridden a grade for a student more than once (2 times in this case). We have two rows that are in the table gb_grade_record_t for this particular assignment and this particular user. According to these two rows, the points_earned was last updated on 12/12/2005 at 5:53 PM and should be set to 0, however, two different issues are being misrepresented in the ui. First, the course grade calculation and the individual assignment is awarding 4 points to the student when it should be awarding 0 points. Second, the log indicates that the points earned was modified 3 times when the db only shows it being modified twice. Needless to say, this is causing grave concern for our faculty that are using the Sakai gradebook and we need to take immediate action on this issue.

select * from gb_grade_record_t where student_id = 'xxxxxxx' and GRADABLE_OBJECT_ID = 67584

ID OBJECT_TYPE_ID VERSION GRADABLE_OBJECT_ID STUDENT_ID GRADER_ID DATE_RECORDED POINTS_EARNED ENTERED_GRADE SORT_GRADE
------ ----------------- ---------- --------------------- ------------- ------------ ------------------ ---------------- ---------------- -------------
520131 1 1 67584 xxxxxxx xxxxxxx 12/12/2005 5:53 PM 0 (null) (null)
520196 1 0 67584 xxxxxxx xxxxxxx 12/12/2005 3:23 PM 4 (null) (null)

2 record(s) selected [Fetch MetaData: 1/ms] [Fetch Data: 2/ms]

[Executed: 12/15/05 11:38:18 AM EST ] [Execution: 208/ms]
column7: Windows XP SP2 IE 6 SP2; Oncourse Production 2.1.r4370
column10: Course Grade Calculation Logic is Incorrect
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
We have also seen instances where an instructor gets in to modify a grade numerous times in a single day, the grade is not reflected properly in the database. I have attached a screenshot of the log that shows in the UI and I've posted what I'm seeing in the database below-

ID OBJECT_TYPE_ID VERSION GRADABLE_OBJECT_ID STUDENT_ID GRADER_ID DATE_RECORDED POINTS_EARNED ENTERED_GRADE SORT_GRADE
------ ----------------- ---------- --------------------- ------------- ------------ --------------------- ---------------- ---------------- ---------------
409848 2 8 24195 xxxxxxx xxxxxxx 2005-11-22 05:32:05.0 11 (null) 2.5368418589323
547593 1 4 24197 xxxxxxx xxxxxxx 2005-12-15 11:52:27.0 6 (null) (null)
548179 1 2 24198 xxxxxxx xxxxxxx 2005-12-15 11:44:16.0 5 (null) (null)

As seen in the UI, I posted a grade and hit save 5 times. The grades I entered were 5,6,0,5,6 respectively. Everything seemed to save ok, but when I look in the database, the last two entries are combined and there is no entry for the 0 grade that I entered.

Steps to reproduce:
Enter the gradebook and enter a grade for a student and click save.
Enter a different grade for the same student and click save.
Enter a 0 grade for the same student and click save.
Enter a grade for the same student and click save.
Enter a grade for the same student and click save.

You will see in the UI log that all 5 grades are listed accurately, however if you look in the DB (select * from gb_grade_record_t where student_id = 'xxxxxxx' and gradable_object_id='xxxxxxx') the grades have not been accurately recorded. In fact, what is recorded in the database is the sum of the last two grades (or some combination thereof)
column48: Screenshot of what appears in the UI
column52:
These bizarre results are due to the existance of multiple grade records for the same student and the same assignment. There should always be only one. If there's more than one, the results will be spectacularly unpredictable.

This breaks down to two tasks:

1) The Gradebook database schemas should be defined to enforce a uniqueness constraint for the combination of GRADABLE_OBJECT_ID and STUDENT_ID in the GB_GRADE_RECORD_T table. Theoretically, if there are no bugs anywhere else, this shouldn't be necessary. But it would be a guaranteed last line of defense, and it would make it a lot easier for DBAs to understand what was going on. Once the duplicates are there, they'll never go away, and they'll keep causing serious problems.

2) We should try to understand how the duplicate records happened in the first place. So far I haven't been able to get them to occur, even with multiple users updating new assignments at the same time.
column56:
I've changed the Hibernate mappings and SQL files to set a uniqueness constraint on the GB_GRADE_RECORD_T table. I've also added indices for the two key columns.

This change was checked in as revision 4716.

Lance, Oliver: What do you think about putting this into the maintenance branch? On the one hand, it's a change in the DB to prevent something which "should never happen" under normal conditions. On the other hand, we know that abnormal conditions sometimes occur, and when we do get duplicates, the problem is very difficult to notice and to fix.

We still haven't figured out what triggered the duplicate records at Indiana. At Berkeley, they happened when a DB script modified the STUDENT_ID fields directly.
column60:
For those who have already moved from 2.01 to 2.1, the database update can be handled in the following three lines of SQL:

alter table GB_GRADE_RECORD_T add unique (GRADABLE_OBJECT_ID, STUDENT_ID);
create index GB_GRADE_RECORD_G_O_IDX on GB_GRADE_RECORD_T (GRADABLE_OBJECT_ID);
create index GB_GRADE_RECORD_STUDENT_ID_IDX on GB_GRADE_RECORD_T (STUDENT_ID);
column64: Attached source to incident for record removal.
column132:
Thanks for the fix-up script, Jarrod and Lance.

Since we still haven't figured out a way to generate the source problem by normal use of the 2.1 code, I'm going to mark this as resolved for now.

Earlier today, I sent email to Glenn, Lance, and Chuck asking how to package the DB update:

'Better to move the new SQL out of "sakai_gradebook_2.0.1_to_2.1.sql" and into a script called something else, like "sakai_gradebook_2.1_SAK-3187.sql"? That way non-maintenance-branch 2.1 developers would be able to run it.'

I haven't gotten an answer yet, so for now I'm assuming the all-in-one updater that I checked in is OK.

Lance and Oliver will decide whether the change is worth checking into maintenance or not. Given how serious the problem can be, it kind of makes sense to me.
column143: I've gotten word back to split out the new SQL updates for the benefit of "vanilla" 2.1 installations.
column150:
Relocation checked in as revision 4787.

Plain 2.1 deployments can now update their local databases by running "sakai_gradebook_2.1_SAK-3187.sql" for the appropriate database type.

column1: [SAK-3176] Support for Batched and Plural Operations
column6:
There is a need to perform more than one operation per web service request.

Reasons:

  • convenience
  • performance, each request requires a SOAP transaction

It should be possible to specify a format for batching operations of any type, in an XML format. This was how SakaiScript pre-webservices operated.
column10: Support for Batched and Plural Operations
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Motivational email recieved from Luke:

Would it make sense to pluralize the addMemberToSiteWithRole and
addNewUser methods? That is, make two new methods called:

addMemberToSiteWithRoles
addNewUsers

Right now, at least as far as I can infer using Coldfusion, I have to
make a separate Web service call each time I enroll a user in a site –
that's expensive.

All that would need to be done to make enrollments much more efficient,
at least for the addMemberToSiteWithRole method, is to turn the userid
parameter into a userids parameter. This parameter would accept a comma
delimited list of userids.

column1: [SAK-3174] following InstallGuide.html for 2.1.0 = error on command "maven sakai"
column6:
I followed the guide exactly as written, and hit an error when I got to Build and Deploy Sakai section. I read the troubleshooting section, but didn't find any help. Here's the bug...

I typed:

"maven -x sakai" and got the following:

Build Failed:
File /root/.maven/cache/sakai-2.1/plugin.jelly
Element... maven:reactor
Line... 34
Column... 6
Unable to obtain goal.

Above this was this bit of text:

/root/src/sakai-src/sections/sections-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/section/decorator/InstructorSectionDecorator.java:168: cannot find symbol
symbol: method compareTo(java.lang.Object)
Location: classs java.lang.Object
int managersComparison = managers1.get(0).toString().compareTo(managers2.get(0));

That looked suspicious to me, so I aded ".toString()" to the end of the "managers2.get(0)" line hoping it would solve the problem. Well, when I ran "maven -x sakai" again and didn't hit the same problem This time I got an out of memory error. I recalled seeing THAT, so I consulted the troubleshooting manual again. I found something stating, "you'll likely need to alter your JVM settings." This is all well and good, but didn't help me by giving much indication of WHERE I would do this. On a whim (I've been using linux for a decade or so) I looked to see if there was a java.conf file in either /etc or /etc/java. I found /etc/java/java.conf and saw a line marked, "JAVACMD_OPTS=" I added the line " -XX:MaxPermSize=128m" to it, but that didn't help. I figured maybe I was looking in the wrong place, so I went looking in the post-installation configureation area. That said to set an environment variable called JAVA_OPTS, so I did. No help.

I'm not a java programmer, so I threw in the towel. Am I barking up the complete wrong tree here? Any ideas?
column7: Fedor 4 with recent patches running on Del PowerEdge 2650 with raid HW.  2 GB RAM, 2.8 Ghz processor (IIRC)

column44: Seth, as the "install guy", any ideas on this one?
column48: Kevin, for install issues like this you might also want to post your question to the sakai-dev mailing list (sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org) in order to reach a much broader auidence and someone who might have direct experience with this.
column52:
This error was caused by using the 1.5 JDK, instead of the 1.4 version. As of 2.1.0, it is CRUCIAL to use 1.4.2 if you want full functionality in Sakai.

My message about this to sakai-dev:

Date: Thu, 15 Dec 2005 12:49:05 -0500 (EST)
From: Seth Theriault <slt@columbia.edu>
To: sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org
Subject: clarification on 2.1.0 and JDK versions

In JIRA issue SAK-3174 Closed , Kevin Metcalf reported the following error:

> /root/src/sakai-src/sections/sections-app/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/s
> ection/decorator/InstructorSectionDecorator.java:168:
> cannot find symbol
> symbol: method compareTo(java.lang.Object)
> Location: classs java.lang.Object
> int managersComparison =
> managers1.get(0).toString().compareTo(managers2.get(0));

This happens if you try to compile/deploy Sakai with the 1.5 JDK, something
that is NOT "officially" recommended. For the moment, you MUST use 1.4.2 to
get full functionality. I think this is noted in the release docs but I
guess it could be more prominent.

The transition to 1.5 will happen at some point, but there are a few issues
including this one; it was described by Glenn noted back in a November
message:

"This is an interesting change in the Java language. Comparable in 1.4
defines compareTo(Object), but in 1.5, it is now:

Comparable<String>

Not just Comparable - and instead of the type-generic Object, it needs a
String."

The entire contents of Glenn's November message pushed into this JIRA item.
It is available at:

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-3174

Of course, there are those who like to run Sakai under 1.5 – myself
included. My preliminary tests show that you can do it with 2.1.0, BUT it
requires you to give up Section Info functionality and make one small change
to some Samigo code. Feel free to contact me if you would like a copy of the
message I sent about this to sakai-dev in November.

Seth

Glenn's original November message:

Date: Thu, 17 Nov 2005 18:32:51 -0500 (EST)
From: Glenn R. Golden <ggolden@umich.edu>
To: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>
Cc: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>
Subject: Re: compilation problem building 2.1.0_003 from source...

Sakai is not ready to be used with java 1.5 yet. You will probably run into
some compilation and possibly runtime errors. Please stick with 1.4 until
we make the big switch.

  • * *

This is an interesting change in the Java language. Comparable in 1.4
defines compareTo(Object), but in 1.5, it is now:

Comparable<String>

Not just Comparable - and instead of the type-generic Object, it needs a
String.

  • * *

I'm looking forward to getting into Java 1.5 (or 5.0, as Sun seems to be
calling it), but please, for Sakai, use 1.4 for now.

Thanks.

  • Glenn
column56: Anyone interested in running 2.1.0 with the 1.5 JDK can contact for more information on the requirements and my local setup.
column60: Closing issue as "fixed." The real fix is to rework Sakai to use the 1.5 JDK but the timeline on that is unknown.
column64: OK, this really shouldn't be closed. It's related to to SAK-195 Closed
column132: JDK 1.5/5.0 is the common thread here.
column143: Sakai 2.1.0 is not currently advertised as JDK-1.5 compatible, so there is really a non-issue for now. Please follow SAK-195 Closed for progress on making Sakai JDK-1.5 compliant, (or content Seth for the 2.1.0 workarounds.)

column1: [SAK-3172] Alert Message for too long of a Title needs fixing
column6:
If a long title is entered for naming a resource item (test with Simple text document)

the error:

Alert: The name is too long: /group/8c02045b-50fb-412e-0027-13c2ecb96af7/Presentations/Etymologically syllabus means a label or table of contents. The American Heritage Dictionary defines syllabus as outline of a course of study. We agree that a syllabus should contain an outline, and a schedule of topics, and many more items of information. However, we suggest that the primary purpose of a syllabus is to communicate to one_s students what the course is about, why the course is taught, where it is going, and what will be required of the students for them to complete the course with a passing grade..txt

appears. The latter part of the error is the actual title

Alert: The name is too long: /group/8c02045b-50fb-412e-0027-13c2ecb96af7/Presentations/ is the general form of the error message.

Why is the word "name" being used interchangeably with title? This might confuse the user. Also, there is no character limit specified either in the alert or on the Resources page
column10: Alert Message for too long of a Title needs fixing
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column44: For uploading a file, the limit (if there is one) on the title field must be longer, as the same title lenght that triggers the alert for a simple text does not for an upload.
column48:
The alert message should use the word "Title" as that is what is used in the interface. It should also indicate what the character limit is that was exceeded; 255 characters?

Because the title could be extremely long, it does not make sense to show it as part of the error message.
column52: Is this still an issue as of 2.2.0?
column56:
I tried this on 2.3.0.002, and with the above, absurd title pasted in. It took the whole thing without an alert.

So I tried pasting it in twice, doubling its length. It also took that without an alert, and now one resource listing looks like a paragraph.

If there's a limit, I'm having trouble reaching it now. Marking as resolved.
column60:
I'm reopening because there's been no change in the code to deal with this problem. It still occurs on nightly2. I'm guessing it also occurs on the qa servers for 2.3.0.

To reproduce, try to create an empty folder with the name "Etymologically syllabus means a label or table of contents. The American Heritage Dictionary defines syllabus as outline of a course of study. We agree that a syllabus should contain an outline, and a schedule of topics, and many more items of information. However, we suggest that the primary purpose of a syllabus is to communicate to one_s students what the course is about, why the course is taught, where it is going, and what will be required of the students for them to complete the course with a passing grade" or any string that is more than ~210 characters. You will get a message that says the title is too long, but it will not really explain how to fix the problem. For example, it doesn't tell what's the longest valid title.

The problem stems from the fact that the total length of the resource-id is 247 characters, and the resource-id includes starts with the full id of the containing collection. And the title the user entered is added to that. So if the id of the containing collection is 30 characters long and you create a new folder inside it, the "title" can be 217 characters long, but if the containing collection's id is 240 characters long, the title of the new folder can be just 7 characters long. Is there some way to explain that to the user coherently?

Also, the error message refers to "title" but shows the resource id.

I would welcome suggestions about what the error message should be.
column64: SAK-3172 Resolved describes a problem that occurs more frequently because there is no way to show descriptions in a list view of a resources folder. SAK-5929 Closed suggests that descriptions be shown.
column132: Design suggestion for Resources tool.
column143:
So the problem is that we need to write an error message to replace

Alert: The name '"Etymologically syllabus means a label or table of contents. The American Heritage Dictionary defines syllabus as outline of a course of study. We agree that a syllabus should contain an outline, and a schedule of topics, and many more items of information. However, we suggest that the primary purpose of a syllabus is to communicate to one_s students what the course is about, why the course is taught, where it is going, and what will be required of the students for them to complete the course with a passing grade' is too long.

But the problem is that we can't explain succinctly how long it can be, because that depends on the ID of the containing collection.

We could calculate it on a site by site basis, but then we'd get phone calls about 'why does his site have a different limit to mine?'

In the interests of making it easy for people, I'm tempted to make a guess at how long the greatest ID of the containing collection is likely to be, and tell people that they can have N chars, where N is a nice round number and N < 247 - estimate of ID of containing collection.

How about a message like:

"Sorry - the name you entered is too long. The maximum length for a name is 200 characters, including spaces."
column150: How does the workaround I suggested here suit you, Jim?
column154: Bulk closing issues that have not been updated since 2015 and earlier. Please reopen if this is still an issue and you have new information or if this is a feature you'd like to still have consideration for.

column1: [SAK-3171] new template should start with default settings
column6:
When you create a new template, it should start out with the default settings (all settings viewable/editable, including the one for template information).

Right now when you create a new template, it starts out with a mixture of some settings viewable/editable and some not. This is counterintuitive and requires the user to check every setting carefully, instead of starting from default and just changing what they wanted to.
column10: new template should start with default settings
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
This is what I'm thinking unless there are major objections:

New Template:

  • All Display/Edit? checkboxes checked
  • Other default settings (radio buttons) "as is" on Template mockup

Default Template:

  • Initially all Display/Edit? checkboxes checked, but can be changed by admin user
  • Initially all other default settings (radio buttons) "as is" on Template mockup, but can be changed by admin user

New Assessment w/ no template selected (aka the "Default Template"):

  • Settings defined by the current Default Template

Remember we had these conclusions back in Novemeber:
Anyway, we came to this agreement/understandings:
¿ keep the "Default Template"
¿ the "Default Template" is the template used if no template was chosen by an instructor
¿ the "Default Template" has all "viewable/editable?" settings on and where there are default value settings, they match the mockups
¿ only show the "Default Template" to the admin user
¿ if there are no other templates than the "Default Template", than the "Choose Existing Template" label and pulldown menu won't show on the instructor Assessments page (in line with our "don't show if nothing to select" rule)

I'll add this detail and changes to the mockup.
-mARC
column48:
will fix based on Marc's comments:

New Template:

  • All Display/Edit? checkboxes checked
  • Other default settings (radio buttons) "as is" on Template mockup

column1: [SAK-3164] Some special characters in folders/filenames cause errors in WebDav
column6:
Some files that include special characters in the title are getting an error stating "An error occurred copying some or all of the selected files". Folders seem to have the same problem although they receive the error "You do not have permission to access this Web Folder location". This is happening with @ , & , # , % , and ^ characters.

Steps to reproduce-
1. Connect to WebDAV on an instance running 2.1
2. Try transferring a file and/or folder with @ , & , # , % , or ^ in the name
column7: Windows XP / IU Production / MIT Stable
column10: Some special characters in folders/filenames cause errors in WebDav
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: I tired those characters in a folder name and they worked fine. I found a problem only with the | (pipe) character. Tested on CTools instance of 2.1 (testctools.ds.itd.umich.edu) (r4548)
column48: SAK-3278 Closed should take care of @. For the others mentioned here (as well as some other characters that are illegal in Sakai resource-id's, including all characters with ascii values above 127), we need a policy. If we create files with those characters in their names, the files will be inaccessible through the Resources tool, the Access servlet and WebDAV. I've been told that the Sakai DAV servlet's beahvior in some cases violates the DAV protocol by substituting other characters for these "illegal" characters in filenames. That causes errors in some DAV clients, which may rely on the file being uploaded with exactly the same name as it had on the client's filesystem. Apparently, the Sakai DAV client should reject many files it does not.
column52: I believe that the characters that cause files to be rejected would cause problems if used as resource-ids in sakai. If there are specific characters being rejected that should not be rejected, please reopen and provide detailed info.

column1: [SAK-3160] Getting java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: when inserting a question.
column6: Ed, this is the one I showed you: I have an assessment with 2 parts, and part 1 has 2 items. When i tried inserting another item after the 2nd question, I get ArrayIndexOutOfBoundException.
column10: Getting java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: when inserting a question.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Appears to be that JSF is losing part of the string in the format "10,3,4" and returning "10,3" (no select insert item number) to the action listener.

The try catch block anticipates this possibiliy and prevents a crash but it logs an error and doesn't take a user meaningful action.
column48:
I think that what is happening is that the value of the component is being connected to the sequence numbers of the question's itemData sequence number within the part's question list in the list of parts for the assessment. (I trust I make myself obscure.)

In the render phase for the page the value of the sequence is "1", "2", etc. However somehow the sequence value is being clobbered and is null or "". Doing experiments, the sequnce number always becomesthe empty stringwhen it fails, this is independent ofwhat else is in the string, or what the delimiter is. So it sounds like there is a problem in the UI mini-model, at last as understood by the component. The other thing that seems to be connected with the backing beans is that this seems to occur with mulitple parts.

This bug may have existed in earlier versions of the UI, but remained undetected.
column52:
Fix details.

It seems very difficult to track down why the sequence number is getting lost in the JSF lifecycle in the nested lists in the backing beans (it appears) when there is more than one part. Therefore I have added a workaround fix that supplies 0 for the sequence number if it is not available.

This fixes two things.
1. No error or warning is logged
2. The type of item chosen is retained, and in the correct part.

This leaves a small problem that the insertion will be in the beginning if the sequence number is lost.

You can verify when this happens.
If the log shows selectItem.getItemValue()=10,2,5 it has correctly gotten a sequence number of 5 for part 5, if you see selectItem.getItemValue()=10,2, then it will be supplied with an insertion at 0 (start) in the part.

Fix revision 4648.
column56: Issue should be QA'ed during upcoming 2.1.1 cycle before closing.

column1: [SAK-3154] Clicking on link to Resource from a document outside of Sakai without first being logged into CAS brings you to wrong place
column6:
For an institution using CAS for authentication, a problem occurs when a link to a document in Resources is clicked on and the user has not yet authenticated to CAS.

The behavior seems to be:

  • User clicks on link to Resource on CAS-required server.
  • User is brought to the CAS login page (as expected), but the service URL does not reflect the original resource URL that the user originally clicked on.
  • After authenticating, the user is then brought to their 'My Workspace' instead of the Resource URL that was originally requested.

Thoughts: the portal is somehow not passing the correct requested URL to the CAS authentication screen?
column10: Clicking on link to Resource from a document outside of Sakai without first being logged into CAS brings you to wrong place
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Verified on SVN tags/sakai_2-1-2_003 on mysql and Sakai QA (svn tags/sakai_2-1-2_003)(Oracle) and took me directly to the resource.
column48:
This issue is still affecting us. The problem goes like this:

  • You open a document in Microsoft Word which contains a link to a resource in Sakai. You ctrl-click on the link.
  • Word visits the URL to check it before giving it to your browser.
  • Sakai establishes a session, stores the link to the resource in the session, returns the cookie to Word
  • Word eats the cookie, yum
  • Word receives the "302 Moved Temporarily" response, and gives the CAS link to your browser
  • Your browser helps you log in and you then go to Sakai, authenticated.

The problem is that the session which indicates the resource that you wanted was eaten by Word. Your browser does not have that cookie. So you go to your workspace instead.

OpenOffice doesn't have this problem.
column52: This is also affecting Indiana's 2.6 implementation, as well.

column1: [SAK-3148] Samigo should take advantage of Sakai file upload mechanism
column6: Samigo will upload files to a temporary directory using the jsf file upload filter. For consistency it should use the Sakai file upload mechanism.
column10: Samigo should take advantage of Sakai file upload mechanism
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Not sure what sakai file upload mechanism is. can you find out?
column48:
Lydia,

we wrote our own 'cos at the time when we wrote it, Sakai couldn't do value change. I also don't understand why we need to use Sakai file upload if ours work. I thought this is a community effort. Why shouldn't we use our own?

Daisy
column52:
I'm suggesting that Samigo be able to use the Sakai mechanism so that it is consistent across Sakai tools. This allows any required changes to be reflected consistently across all tools rather than having to change file upload code in multiple places. It also makes Sakai installation easier since Samigo doesn't need to have special administration done for its unique upload mechanism. It also should be less work for tools to reuse an existing helper rather than maintain their own.

The stand alone version of Samigo may want to retain the Samigo file upload mechanism. In that case it should be configurable which file upload method is to be used so that the one appropriate to the execution environment is chosen.
column56:
Glenn, Stephen M, Seth and a lot of other people asked the same question. So I am posting our rationale here:

Historically, we have file upload working before ContentHosting was
available. Dave has filed a similar request on JIRA already and we
have discussed about it at Stanford. I think what we have decided is
that it is OK for Samigo to manage the uploaded file (which is an
answer to a question) itself. This way, all the answers are managed
and maintained by Samigo. Samgo allows users to submit mutilple time
per assessment and multiple uploads per questions. Only authors and
course instructional staff are allow accessed to it. With only 2
programmers, we really don't have time to revisit features that is
completed.

However, after 2.2, we would need to provide functionality to allow
instructors to upload file as a question in Samigo. This is teh time
we want to use Content Hosting. Maybe after that, we will also agree
with you & Dave that answers submitted can also be managed by Content
Hostng and our experience will allow us to make the transaction
easier. Let's wait and see.
column60:
1. in version 2.3, Samigo has taken advantage of the sakai file picker. We are using this capability for attaching files to assessment, assessment part and assessment question. See SAK-4396 Closed

2. there is one thing that we found out and have concern about
SAK-6326 Closed - orphan records in CONTENT_XXXX when "cancel" is hit

3. We would also like to have another attribute in the jsf tag that would direct the filepicker to execute a method call when exiting filepicker through the "Finish" button. At the moment, we splattered our JsfTool servlet with those exit methods call.

4. To convert the file upload question to use the file picker, we need Jim Eng to help us get started .
column64:
talked to Lydia, using file picker for file upload question will be reviewed in 2.4. Time is better spent on QA at this point. The file
attachment would be more complex for file upload question and I am not sure if we should use the same technique that we did with authoring.

1. there is the open url issue that we need to consider
2. how do we add access right to the file based on author and admin of the site
3. for file system storage, there is no directory structure based on
assessment#, question# and personEid. does that matter to us?

Lydia alos pointed out that the file picker screen has too much features that we don't need for file upload question. e.g. We don't need those files in Resource to show up and we don't need to be able to add link.
column132: This will be post 2.3, Not sure when yet.
column143:
Lydia,
You may be able to use a filter and disable selecting/linking in the file
picker. We do that a little in many of the OSP tools. We don't turn off
everything, but you should be able to get an idea by looking at some of our
code.
To get started, Check out the ContentResourceFilter.java (content-api) and
BaseExtensionResourceFilter.java (content-impl).
The bean is defined in content's components.xml (id of
org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResourceFilter.base).
What we do in OSP is extend that bean (or class) and override certain parts
to get our desired affect. If yours it to disable selecting, then your
allowSelect() method would just return false.
Then, when you call the file picker, you'd set a session variable with the
filter you want.
Let me know if you have questions or want me to point you to more of our
examples.

Chris

column1: [SAK-3146] Help tool should be configurable (enable/disable) on a site by site basis
column6: The Help tool isn't really a tool, so it can't be turned off on a site by site basis. Some sites want to provide their own help and it is confusing to have two help pages. Need to be able to control Help just like any other tool, and at least allow support to add/remove the tool from sites.
column10: Help tool should be configurable (enable/disable) on a site by site basis
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
I don't know, John - Help is a system wide feature, not specific to any one site. Why would we expect it to act differently depending on what site you are on?

Maybe the mistake is showing it on the left side toolbar, where it looks site specific like all the other tools. Maybe it would be better to place it in the top banner or bottom or somewhere clearly not site related.

Then a site could add a "help" site page, with custom content for the site, and it would not seem to be double help or be confusing - and the system-wide help would still be available.
column48:
Some may want to, for a particular site like Teaching Support, direct people to a different help. Maybe a project site is being used with only webcontent tools pointing to some other tools, and the site owner wants them to go to a particular other place for help. Configurable seems to me is better - gives the most flexibility to handle oddball cases that we probably can't even think of. Having it configurable doesn't break the existing use, just makes it able to fit more uses in the future.

It if were moved elsewhere that would be better I think since it's not controllable like other tools. Though it should still be up to the institution as to whether to include it.
column52: For 2.1.x configuing it on/off would be okay, however, moving it to the top banner or somewhere else would have to wait for 2.2.
column56: Changing issue type to Feature Request, as the Help tool is currently working as designed (even if the design is limited)
column60: The patch to CharonPortal in SAK-2607 Closed addresses this. Setting the site property display-help-menu to false will disable the Help menu in the site. This would only be accessible through the Admin Sites editor though.
column64:
I would agree that it is misleading for 'Help' to appear as a tool.

As John and Glenn say, it would be perfectly feasible for a site admin to wish to use the name 'Help' for other purposes.

It appears odd to users that they cannot control this 'tool' in Page Order tool, for example.

Being with the site tools menu also makes Help look as though it changes from site to site - just as there is always a tool called Home but that tool contains different content in different sites.

I would suggest that we should change the portal template so that at a minimum, individual institutions can choose whether Help appears as a tool or not.

I would then suggest that the standard Sakai skin should put Help somewhere else. It should appear somewhere that is clearly the same as you move from site to site (just as the banner, site tabs and logout button remain the same as you move around). Perhaps it might live up in the top with the 'Logout' button, for example?

column1: [SAK-7960] Gradebook should focus on getting data in
column6:
The current gradebook seems to focus much of its attention on evaluating scores, i.e. presenting % of right, current cumulative grade, etc. Given limited manpower, it should be focused on gathering data. Faculty use different ways of combining scores. Some are incredibly subjective. Many of them don't want to show anything other than scores on assignments. Those that would be happy to show a cumulative grade would need great flexiblity in how it's calculated, such as weighting, dropping lowest assignments, etc. But those faculty say they would be happy to download the data to excel, do calculations there, and upload the actual grade. Thus what we need is:

  • The ability to disable showing anything other than raw scores
  • Accurate scores from tests/quizzes and assignments
  • An additional column next to the username that can be loaded by the external providers with an institutional ID (typically student number). This is needed to let us corollate data in Sakai with data in University student systems, which operate by ID number rather than Sakai username.
  • Ability to upload a column of data from a spreadsheet or other external source [would need to upload 2 columns, the data plus the username]
  • Ability to create a column via a web service, so we can feed from other systems [ex: attendance taking]
  • Ability to delete a column
  • Ability to move columns
  • Ability to assign categories to columns (e.g. to separate test, homework and attendance) and to use those to group display if desired
  • Ability to add text columns or some other way to provide explanations of special cases for students
column10: Gradebook should focus on getting data in
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column44: I said we needed it within a year. However it's important for us to be able to tell faculty sooner what is happening to the Gradebook. This is in fact a general issue with us: In many cases the time critical thing is a commitment, not when the feature is released.
column48:
Ditto - on all of Charles' points, especially the info in the narrative and the first two bullet items.

We need the gradebook to provide raw scores at this time and not attempt to evaluate learner performance since higher level functionatliy (weighting of scores, dropping lowest scores, ec.) is not in place and would take much longer to be implemented. We, too, need accurate scores from tests & quizzes AND the assignments tool, ASAP. Of even more critical importance to adoption of Sakai by our users is the integration of the assignments tool with the gradbook. This must happen with half a year (in time for fall productions). The gradebook needs to "mature" to provide the grading options presently available in the assignments tool. The assignments tool, optionally, should send the raw scores/grades to the gradebook.
column52:
This sounds like a sensible prioritization.

All this said, we shouldn't lose track, long term, of the need to include advanced gradebook functionality (e.g. running scores, formulas and weighting, dropping lowest or earliest score, automatically populating a grade with 0 if a due date is past). This type of functionality can't be duplicated with ease in Excel and many of our faculty are used to having it available in our homegrown online gradebooks. In fact, many of our faculty who've moved to WebCT Vista 3.0 have been frustrated that these features don't exist yet in our WebCT deployment. So long term it would be a good idea (for our faculty at least) if this functionality was incorporated into Sakai.

column1: [SAK-3145] stealth support by configuration, not code editing
column6:
To "stealth" a tool, one must now edit the tool's tool.xml file. Rather than modifying the application code, we need to be able to specify which tools are to be stealthed via something in sakai.properties.

A "stealth" tool is one that is running in Sakai, but does not show up in worksite setup as an available tool. It can be added to a site via the Admin site editor.
column10: stealth support by configuration, not code editing
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
The org.sakaiproject.api.kernel.tool.ActiveToolManager can be configured with the "stealthTools" property,
a list of comma-separated tool ids (no spaces) for all tools that are to be stealthed.

This can be overridden in sakai.properties with:

  1. stealth tools. A stealth tool is a tool that is running in Sakai, but is not available to be added to a site in Worksite Setup.
  2. A stealth tool can be added to a site using the Admin site tool.
  3. List any tools to be stealthed, using their tool ids, in a comma-separated string (no spaces).
  4. In this example, the rwiki tool, su tool, roster tool, and the assignment tool w/o grading are stealthed:
    stealthTools@org.sakaiproject.api.kernel.tool.ActiveToolManager=sakai.rwiki,sakai.su,sakai.site.roster,sakai.assignment

Stealthed tools will not be listed by the tool manager when findTools() is called with a category - this has the effect of ignoring
these tools' categories as defined in their tool.xml (without the need to edit those tool.xml files). This results in the tools
not showing up in Worksite Setup's tool lists, but showing up in the Admin Site Editor.
column48: Issue should be QA'ed as part of upcoming 2.1.1 QA cycle before being closed.
