column1: [SAK-3138] Ability to create a form item should be available as an independent helper
column6: Should be able to place a button/link in a tool other than Resources in such a way that it launches a helper to create an arbitrary type of form item and places it in some collection to make it available to the user. The collection in which the form-item is created will need to be specified in the URL attached to the button/link.
column10: Ability to create a form item should be available as an independent helper
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: How much flexibility do clients (other tools) need as far as where the item is created? Suppose there was a state attribute specifying that the item is either (1) in the site's root collection or (2) in the hidden attachments area? Is that enough? Or does there need to be an interface through which the user picks the collection/subcollection?
column48:
I think we can get away with passing the following info:

  • is this a newly created form instance we are after
  • the resource UUID of an existing form to edit
  • the form definition id of a new form instance to create
  • in the case of a new form, the resource parent (collection id) to create the item under
column52:
We've added two helper modes, one for creating a new item and one for editing an existing item. A tool that wants to launch Resources as a helper does two things:

1) it must "set up" the helper, setting state attributes to indicate what helper mode it's in and setting parameters for its action.

2) it must dispatch to ResourcesAction whenever the state attributes indicate the tool is in helper mode.

Here's a sample of the dispatcher code from CalendarAction:

String mode = (String) sstate.getAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_RESOURCES_MODE);
if (mode != null)
{
// if the mode is not done, defer to the ResourcesAction
if (!mode.equals(ResourcesAction.MODE_ATTACHMENT_DONE))

{ template = ResourcesAction.buildHelperContext(portlet, context, runData, sstate); return template; }

// when done, get the new attachments, (if null, there was no change)
List attachments = (List) sstate.getAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_ATTACHMENTS);
if (attachments != null)

{ // CalendarAction's state has a special method for managing attachments state.setAttachments(attachments); }

// clean up
sstate.removeAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_MODE);
sstate.removeAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_RESOURCES_MODE);
sstate.removeAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_ATTACHMENTS);
}

Here's an example of setting up to create a new item as an attachment to a calendar item:

// place tool in helper mode
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_MODE, ResourcesAction.MODE_HELPER);

// specify that it's in mode to attach a new item
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_RESOURCES_MODE, ResourcesAction.MODE_ATTACHMENT_NEW_ITEM);

// specify type of item to create. In this case, it's a "form" item.
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_CREATE_TYPE, ResourcesAction.TYPE_FORM);

// specify that you are creating ONE item
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_CREATE_NUMBER, new Integer(1));

// set the home collection in which the item will be created
String home = ContentHostingService.getSiteCollection(ToolManager.getCurrentPlacement().getContext());
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_CREATE_COLLECTION_ID, home);

// specify that attachments should be links rather than copies
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_ATTACH_LINKS, Boolean.TRUE.toString());

Here is an example of setting up the helper to modify a particular item:

// configure attachment editor
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_MODE, ResourcesAction.MODE_HELPER);
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_RESOURCES_MODE, ResourcesAction.MODE_ATTACHMENT_EDIT_ITEM);

String attachmentId = rundata.getParameters().getString("attachmentId");
sstate.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_ATTACH_ITEM_ID, attachmentId);
column56: Note that when creating a new "form" item, the attribute named ResourcesAction.STATE_STRUCTOBJ_TYPE can be set to indicate the type of form item to create. The value of this attribute must be the id of a pre-defined MetaObject form that is published and available to the current user. In the current implementation, these seem to be 32-character hex strings that are assigned by the MetaObject tool.
column60: John, Please try again. The helper should be working now. Thanks. Jim
column64: One more thing, John. It might be nice to "lock" the form type when creating/editing a form item. For example, if you're invoking the helper from a particular context that requires a "work-history" form item, you might want to make the form-type read-only, so the user can alter the contents of that form item but can't change it to a "contactInfo" form item. This could be done by creating a new state attribute to indicate that the form-type is read-only. Then it would be up to ResourcesAction to enforce that. If you'd like to have that capability, reopen this item and assign it to me with a comment explaining your requirements. Thanks. Jim
column132:
Jim,

We do need the ability for the user not to change the form type. This is going to be the case for a "create new" as well as an "edit". I am fine with passing in a flag for that.

column1: [SAK-3136] Add value-type for "rich text" in Forms Item editor
column6: We need to define an XML Schema Datatype for rich text. When a property in an XSD file (defining a form item-type) has a value type of rich text, it should insert the WYSIWYG editor into the form at that point.
column10: Add value-type for "rich text" in Forms Item editor
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
John Ellis suggested using an annotation to tag strings as rich-text for fields that should use the WYSIWYG editor. The annotation is "ospi.isRichText". Here's an example:

<xs:element name="comments" base="xs:string">
<xs:annotation>
<xs:documentation source="ospi.label">Comments</xs:documentation>
<xs:documentation source="ospi.isRichText">true</xs:documentation>
</xs:annotation>
</xs:element>

John will deprecate the "ospi." prefix and change it to "sakai." as we generalize the use of this feature within Sakai.
column48:
We added rich-text fields in form items. To specify a rich-text field, add an annotation with source "ospi.isRichText" and a value of true, as shown in an earlier comment. Here's another example:

<xs:element name="comments" type="xs:string">
<xs:annotation>
<xs:documentation source="ospi.label">Comments</xs:documentation>
<xs:documentation source="ospi.isRichText">true</xs:documentation>
</xs:annotation>
</xs:element>

Note there's no length restriction in this case.

column1: [SAK-3134] SakaiPortalLogin should have optional presence
column6:
The webservice endpoint SakaiPortalLogin (and SakaiLogin?) should have an option for user presence. i.e. for the created sessions to appear in Users Present and Chat Tool. Use cases where presence would be desired include portlet and desktop client logins, and other services where webservices might be employed for an alternative login. But there are also use cases where presence would not be desirable, so this best made an option. Whether this is implemented as additional arguments to the current methods or as new methods, I am not sure (I don't know if webservices allow for method overloading).

This feature request is directly related to the bug SAK-2473 Closed .

column1: [SAK-3133] Matching statistics only show number of correct responses, not total responses

To reproduce:

2. Take it as a student and match everything correctly.
3. Take it as a different student and make every match incorrect.
4. Log back in as the instructor and look at the Statistics page for the Scores of that test. You see:

Responses 1
% Students All Correct 100

when it should be 2 and 50.

This may have come about due to trying to correct SAK-1932 Closed .

column1: [SAK-3132] Allow instructors to create left-menu button that links directly to a subfolder within the site's resources folder
column6: This request comes from Charles Hedrick of Rutgers. Charles said that instructors would like to temporarily display a button linking directly to a subfolder in the site's resources as a way of pointing to resources related to the unit they're currently covering.
column10: Allow instructors to create left-menu button that links directly to a subfolder within the site's resources folder
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Here's Charles request in more detail:

I'd like a picker that can be used to create links in both
resources and site management (for web content that will show up in the left margin). It
should have three sections:

  • a browser to let you find and pick anything in resources (and as authentication
    improves, other content you can make accessible)
  • a list of tools in the site; the link would be to that tool (when you're building
    course content, you often want to be able ask the user to go to discussi8ons and
    contribute, etc)
  • a list of links configurable by the administrators. These would be for site-specific
    resaources such as the Library

One of our biggest complaints is the difficulty of setting up the left margin. I do copy
and paste from the address bar, but (1)many users don't find that obvious (2) this will
end up with links that have the whole portal framework, whereas we actually want links
to the appropriate iframe.

The intent is to let people set up left margin links to folder in resources containinig
contents for a unit or week, or to other commonly used content. The picker would be used
in setting up folders in resources to put all the resources for a particular unit or
lesson there.
column48:
Charles suggests a workaround, which is to navigate to the folder, copy the URL from the browser, and then add a web content tool with an appropriate label that links to that URL. He mentions that the problem with that is that the iframe contains the full Sakai portal framework. This can be improved on a little by capturing just the URL for the frame containing the resources tool, instead of taking the URL from the address bar. But that still has problems.

This actually gives you a view of the resources tool that shares state with the original instance of the resources tool. I suspect that the URL used for the web content tool doesn't actually point at the subfolder. If the user changes the view of the resources tool, those changes will be reflected in the view seen in the web-content tool. Also, any user can later navigate upward within that tool. Ideally, this view would be a separate instance of the resources tool with the subfolder as its home collection. That is not currently possible in sakai.

Charles also suggests a nifty tool for making this task easier and to make it easier to create web content tools with other commonly used links in them. That's probably better handled as a separate JIRA ticket. This ticket refers just to the idea of allowing more than one Resources tools in a site that point to different resource collections (or subcollections).
column52:
The real requirement here is for content providers to be able to structure presentation of their content. This includes organizing it by unit, week, etc, and having pointers from the left margin to the units. Within one particular unit we want to be able have not only standard resources, but pointers to quizes, discussion topics, etc. This kind of structure is typical in the commercial tools. Typically there is something like an "organizer page" where you can put content of all types, and some ability to point to organizer pages from the margin.

I'm suggesting a specific implementation, largely because (1) it's fairly easy to do, and (2) it uses resources, rather than creating a whole new tool. I'm actually not so concerned about what implementation is done, although I think users might find it easier to understand if resources is coopted. Otherwise you'd have two tools that are confusingly similar. However after looking at the requiements, you might decide that a separate "content organizer page" tool makes more sense.

The implementation I have in mind does three things:

1) You need to have a way to make a resource folder look more appropriate for content presentation. That means losing all the widgets for uploading and managing content, and adding in descriptions. I have already done this via accessServlet. One should think whether that's the best approach. I also have code to change the order of items in a resource folder, which is essential.

2) You need an easy way for people to add things other than standard resources on one of these content pages. I'm suggesting adding a content picker, so the user would create a URL resource, and then have this content picker make it easy to pick the most common types of URL:

  • pointers to other things in resources, including both individual resources and folders
  • pointers to the major tools. The idea is that in a particular unit I may want to say "as part of this unit, please contribute to the discussion topic ..." I'd rather have a URL going directly to that topic, but at this point individual topics aren't addressable by URL, so that best I can do is insert the URL of the discussion tool itself. I believe this is true of all the major tools except resources. (In the long run this should be fixed. I'd like a URL pointing directly into a specific discussion topic or quiz.)
  • pointers to common installation-specific content, e.g. the URL to the Library reserves.

3) You need a way to point to a content page from the left margin. I'm suggesting that the same content picker makes sense for building items in the left margin. In the long run, you'd like a left margin tool that lets you manage what's on the left margin, inclluding adding things and changing the order. But at the moment I'd do this by adding the cohtent picker to the "web content" tool. (In the long run I'd suggest that you might want to use the same tool to manage items in the left margin and items on content pages.)

column1: [SAK-3128] Schedule / Calendar size bug in FireFox
column6:
I've encountered a problem with the Schedule tool in Sakai when
using Firefox for a PC. In IE, when two items are posted on the same
day in the schedule, the column width widens to show both items; but in
Firefox, the columns seem to have a static width so that the second item

column1: [SAK-3125] Allow site maintainer to set order of resources in list mode
column6: Users can sort resource list on various columns in the list view. Default is that they are sorted alphanumerically by title. User can select sorts by date or creator and later restore sort by title. User can also select between ascending and descending order in any of these sorts. People have requested that we allow maintainers to determine order in which items are listed. To do that we might need an additional column in the list view and a user interface for setting the values in that column and designating that it should be used as the default sort-order for the site. Should we develop mockups of possible designs for this?
column10: Allow site maintainer to set order of resources in list mode
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Done. See 2484. I actually didn't add a column to the display. It seems like you don't need to show a sequence number, since you can see directly by the order in which things show. I cause defined sequence to override alphabetic.

There is an interesting implementation issue: what happens if the user adds an item after you've sorted? What i do is the first time someone moves an item, I generate sequence numbers for all items, starting with default alpha order. I then make the adjustments the user asked for. If new items are added, they don't have sequence numbers. I show unnumbered items at the end, in alpha order. If you don't like that order, obviously you can move the new items.

The only significant issue with my implementation is that I do an Up but not a Down. There's no reason in theory you can't do Down. It's just more complex and I didn't have time. If you do it, you'll probably want to do both. Of course you can move an object down by moving the one below it up.
column48: In the proposed solution Charles posted, if a user sorts by date, is there a way to get back to the instructor's sort order? If not, does that matter?

column1: [SAK-3124] Allow users to see descriptions of resources in list view
column6:
Many people have requested that descriptions show in the list view. I'd like to suggest that we develop mockups and/or prototypes of various approaches to this. We may even want to do some user testing or focus groups. Here are some ideas we might consider:

1) Description appears in the "title" attribute of the tag so it appears when the user points cursor at the link. I think this may not work well in some browsers.

2) Description appears indented under the title of the resource

3) Site maintainer can set options for whether description appears. Possible settings might be "Do not show descriptions in list", "Show X characters of description", "Show first X lines of description", "Show complete descriptions".

4) Same as 3, but allow user to override maintainer's settings for current session (similar to user overriding mainatiner's settings for date/time or number of messages shown in chat)
column10: Allow users to see descriptions of resources in list view
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
see 2505. Rutgers uses two separate views of resources. I consider the current tool useful primarily as

1) a way for authors to upload and maintain content
2) a way for users to view content if they are sort of a big bag of Word documents, or something

But it is not a useful way to present content to students a la Melete.

My answer was to create a separate view. It removes the widgets for uploading and changing data, and adds the descriptions, and changes some of the style. This is a much cleaner view for users. I don't object to adding descriptions to the resource too. In fact that may be more convient than requring people to pull up the properties menu to change the description. But that will make the tool even busier and thus even more questionable for users. Please consider implementing our separate tool that provides a clean view, emphasing title and description. If you create a set of folders, use appropriate descriptions, and use this view, you can pretty much duplicate the functionality of melete, but somewhat more flexibly.

Obviously this can also be done by choosing options on what you want to show. But if you do that, you'll find that content maintainers and users need different views. So either you'll need different options per role or you'lll need to provide at least 2 different views and show different information. The problem with making the options per-role is that the content maintainer needs to be able to see the user's view as well.

I did it in accesservlet because I wanted faculty to be able to produce presentations that didn't require students to visibly use Sakai, i.e. to see the whole set of decoration. You might choose to do it within the resources tool itself.

column1: [SAK-3123] gradebook database error 2.0.1->2.1
column6:
After upgrading our 2.0.1 installation to 2.1.0 the gradebook of existing sites stopped showing and exceptions thrown in the log. Running the below line on the database fixed this issue. I'm not sure if this is The Right Thing To Do, but it solved this issue for us and I believe something like this should be added to sakai_2_0-2_1_mysql_conversion.sql.

UPDATE GB_GRADABLE_OBJECT_T set NOT_COUNTED=0 where POINTS_POSSIBLE is not NULL;

–
Klas Lindfors
Stockholm University
column10: gradebook database error 2.0.1->2.1
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
On Oracle and MySQL, null booleans will throw a NaN exception in the Gradebook code. As a result, after creating the new NOT_COUNTED column with "alter table", my database update scripts should have explicitly set NOT_COUNTED columns for assignments to zero with the following line:

update GB_GRADABLE_OBJECT_T set NOT_COUNTED=0 where NOT_COUNTED is NULL and POINTS_POSSIBLE is not NULL;

This was a big miss for us – I didn't test the DB upgrade sufficiently as part of 2.1 delivery.

I've checked in the fixed scripts as revision 4545. They should also go into the maintenance branch. I'll send email to Lance and Glenn about updating the Sakai-wide update scripts accordingly. Oliver, what do you think the best approach is for alerting 2.1 upgraders?

column52:
After further experimentation, this has been determined to be a specific bug that shows only in Firefox 1.5. It's possible, in fact that it is really a Firefox bug, rather than Sakai.

To reproduce:

1. Pull up any instance, stable or nightly, on a Firefox 1.07 or early browers.
2. Create assessment.
3. Add SA question (or anything other question that uses the WYSIWYG).
4. Save the assessment and export. It will work fine.
5. Install Firefox 1.5.
6. Create assessment in the same instance.
7. When you add a question, you will notice something odd; when you click in the WYSIWYG box, your cursor is not visible, though when you start typing the text appears there.
8. Save the question and assessment.
9. Export. You will get the error:

XML Parsing Error: undefined entity
Location: http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/samigo/jsf/qti/exportAssessment.xml
Line Number 1689, Column 75: <mattext charset="ascii-us" texttype="text/plain" xml:space="default"> </mattext>
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------^

10. Re-install Firefox 1.07.
11. Repeat steps 1-4. The assessment will work fine.

The broken assessment created in 1.5 will still be broken – to see an example, log into nightly mySQL as laurahb/laurahb and look at the test 'spacebug15'.
column56: Note that spacebug15 looks fine, it's only when you try to export it that it fails.

column1: [SAK-3120] IFrame integration of Sakai is problematic with current url-based site navigation
column6:
The use case of including sakai in gallery mode using an iframe is made problematic by the way charon portal navigation is handled.

It appears that charon's portal navigation (i.e. which worksite you have selected – or is that "site navigation"?) is purely url-path based.
The ramifications for this in a tabbed portal enviroment (e.g. uPortal) is that if you include sakai in an iframe, you will lose portal navigational state each time you leave a tab.

e.g.:

go to the tab where sakai is included in gallery mode; navigate to a different worksite in sakai; change tabs; change back; you will be back in "My Worksite" (or whatever worksite is indicated by the url target of the iFrame) and not in the worksite which you left it as would be expected.

A workaround to this would be to use something like CWebProxy (in uPortal anyway) to retain state as you change tabs, but this poses other problems (e.g. file uploads will be broken).

Really what is needed a way to store portal navigational state in the session or cookies (Perhaps a front controller which simply keeps track of the navigational state in a session or simple cookie-keyed hash and simply redirects to appropriate site url when the cookie and current url do not match... or something which tracks "last tool used"?) I understand that worksite and tool state ARE kept in session someplace already.

column1: [SAK-3118] Logout from Gallery mode returns user to site mode
column6:
When using gallery mode, logout returns you to "site" mode, when using the default loggedOutUrl=/portal

A workaround to this is to set loggedOutUrl=/portal/gallery in sakai.properties. But of course this means that all logouts will go into gallery mode. Even those in site (or portal) mode.

On top that the use case for gallery mode becomes fuzzy after logout. Gallery mode when logged out, gives you the authenticated gateway view without login fields. So when logged out, you are eternally logged out.

A workaround for this is to set loggedOutUrl=/authn?url=/portal/gallery, effectively forcing authentication after log.

But again setting loggedOutUrl seems to affect site and gallery mode, so ALL logouts go to forced authentication of gallery mode.

It seems to me that site mode logout and gallery mode logout should have separate configurable loggedOutUrl's.

Overall, the use cases need to be clarified for gallery mode. I will add other jira issues concerning other problems I have encountered with gallery mode.

column1: [SAK-3116] Processing of HTML and pseudo-HTML tags in WYSIWYG is inconsistent, causes errors
column6:
Upon reopening a saved question, the WYSIWYG editor processes anything it thinks is HTML tags. This is problematic in two ways:

A)
It is not consistent, as it does not process on the first save. So a question might appear as:
Do paragraph breaks <p>break?

in previewing a test after its initial creation, but will open as:
Do paragraph breaks

break?

when edited, and will be saved as such.

and B)

It processes anything that looks like a tag (continous string within angle brackets) as a tag.

Ponder the breakage of <fnord> anything that looks like html.

will turn into

Ponder the breakage of anything that looks like html.

after being opened and saved again. The WYSIWYG does preserve the information at some level – you'll get "Path: body»fnord" when clicking in the text at 'anything...' – but the <word> formation is not an unusual structure for placeholder words in questions, even in non-technical subjects. And woe to the professor who tries to ask a question about CGI programming!
column10: Processing of HTML and pseudo-HTML tags in WYSIWYG is inconsistent, causes errors
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: SAK-3109 Closed , SAK-3115 Closed , and SAK-3116 Closed address different aspects of the interaction of HTML with authoring, the WYGIWYS editor and export/import; a solution to one will probably need to keep the others in mind.
column48: SAK-3109 Closed , SAK-3115 Closed , and SAK-3116 Closed address different aspects of the interaction of HTML with authoring, the WYGIWYS editor and export/import; a solution to one will probably need to keep the others in mind.
column52:
This turns out to be more serious than I thought. Not only is anything in brackets affected, so is anything after a less than sign. And attempts to literally encode, such as < will be processed as well, resulting in opening and closing the question changing it through three successive saves.

Only letters seem to trigger this; numbers (x<1) or symbols (x <= 1) seem to be okay.

On the first save the text below saves correctly:

1. Is x<y?
2. Is x<y>z?
3. Is x<y?
4. Is x<y>?
5. Is x>y?
6. Is x<1?
7. Is x < y?

but becomes on second open and save of the question:

1. Is x
2. Is xz?
3. Is x<y?
4. Is x<y>?
5. Is x>y?
6. Is x<1?
7. Is x < y?

and becomes on third open and save of the question:

1. Is x
2. Is xz?
3. Is x
4. Is x?
5. Is x>y?
6. Is x<1?
7. Is x < y?

1 through 4 will all eventually break on export or import.
column56:
This is extremely hard to fix, as
1. the control uses a third party JavaScript library
2. once you have an HTML editor that doesn't show you HTML the semantics is not defined.

Before we even attempt to fix this, we need to understand what a fix is.

Should an attempt to enter html tags be construed to be that or a mathematical expression?

For example,

a<p>v could be a paragraph tag between "a" and "v" which is not well formed HTML, or it could be the expression p is greater than both a and v

a<p could be a is greater than p or it could mean that the author meant a<p/> but mistyped it.

How does the editor analyze/fix this, since we don't know what was meant?

Some of this could be documented as advanced usage of wysiwyg editor in help.

For example
math is usually typeset as
a < p with spaces to make it clearer
column60:
It seems to me, given that it is a WYSIWYG, that it shouldn't try to process hand-entered html tags at all; it should just treat them as text. If someone wants bold, italic, links et al they should be entered via the WYSIWYG features.

Is there anyway to sandbox the text so that it's never processed?

XML Parsing Error: mismatched tag. Expected: </p>.
Location: http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/samigo/jsf/qti/exportAssessment.xml
Line Number 1575, Column 3:</mattext>

7b. However, when you try to export this second exported file, IE errors with:

This does not happen with paired tags –
Do paragraph breaks <p>break?</p>
will not break.
column60:
The wysiwg editor (I don't see environment here, is this a supported browser ?--I am assuming Firefox) normally creates correct XHTML ("<p />" or "<p><p>" --not "<p>"). XHTML is HTML that is also good XML. The geeky reason is that XML and HTML are both SGML dialects, and SGML allows <p>, and other oddities that XML does not.

What I think is happening, is that the naive user (or in this case diabolically clever QA engineer) starts coding HTML. "<p>" gets transformed back to "<p>" unescaped.

The other way is to sneak in an unsupported browser and start coding HTML. (Since it is a textarea then).

We do document ways of fixing up bad XML in the import export notes.

Laura, I only wish we had had you at the start of 2.1!
column64:
It's in both Firefox and IE. I was not actually as fiendishly clever as that, but you did inspire me to try. It turns out that the question:

This is completely a <fnord> fake tag.

will turn on export and reimport to:

This is completely a <fnord> fake tag.

which will turn on another export and import to:

This is completely a fake tag.

...which will either break on export (Firefox) or successfully export but break on import (IE). On, yes, the THIRD cycle of this.

I believe the different between the two is not the file but that IE is more tolerant of exporting broken code than Firefox is; when you take a file that fails on export from Firefox, IE can export it but it fails on import, just like a native IE file.

I took a look at the code that is being exported:

First cycle export using IE:
<material>
<mattext charset="ascii-us" texttype="text/plain" xml:space="default"><p><Unable to render embedded object: File (--StartFragment -->Â This is completely a <fnord> fake tag. <) not found.--StartFragment --></p></mattext>

</material>

Second cycle export using IE:

<material>
<mattext charset="ascii-us" texttype="text/plain" xml:space="default"><p> This is completely a <fnord> fake tag. </p>

</mattext>

</material>

First cycle export using Firefox:

<material>
<mattext charset="ascii-us" texttype="text/plain" xml:space="default">
This is completely a <fnord> fake tag.

</mattext>

</material>

Export, second round, using a Firefox imported test but exporting in IE:

<material>
<mattext charset="ascii-us" texttype="text/plain" xml:space="default">
This is completely a <fnord> fake tag.
</mattext>

</material>

So you are right – it's processing < tags, but not ones the author is inserting. Instead it takes a <fnord> text and saves it as <fnord> tag in the export file, but when it imports it, instead of treating it just as the literal text <fnord>, it then thinks it is a tag, which is it not, so it breaks when you try to export and import it once again. Or so it looks to me. I'm going to test to see if, like the WYSIWYG, it breaks on standalone < as well as <word> tags.
column132:
Yup. It does break on stand alone <. In fact it breaks badly

Is x<y?
Is x < y?
Is x <= 1?
Is x<1?

are all text in an assessment will cause that assessment to fail in the export/import cycles. The error is different:

XML Parsing Error: not well-formed
Location: http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/samigo/jsf/qti/exportAssessment.xml
Line Number 1574, Column 85: <mattext charset="ascii-us" texttype="text/plain" xml:space="default">Is x<y?
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------^

Standalone > is fine.

Should this be bumped to critical? Any < anywhere in a test will cause that test to fail on export/import second cycle.

column1: [SAK-3114] In new assessments, attempting add questions throws an exception
column6:
In new assessments (but not old) trying to create a new question throws an exception. This holds true in both IE and Firefox and in all three instances.

To reproduce:
1. Create a new assessment.
2. in the Create New Question dropdown, select any type of question except Copy from Question Pool.
3. An exception will be thrown.

If you tremble a little scrolling up and down before you select, it will throw the exception.

This seems to be similar to a bug that Margaret looked at at one point.

I know what the problem is:
column52: The code assumes that three components are embedded in a String and it tries to take action on all three, when there is only one.
column56:
The trigger is a regression.

And this is caused by the fact that two drop down lists embed the part and question info into the list unlike anywhere else. This would mean that we would have to regress the code back to use the scriptlets, embed all the sakai code into the standalone version etc.

I will have to find a cleaner solution for this.

column1: [SAK-3113] IP address security setting no longer validates
column6:
The IP address "high security" setting doesn't seem to care what value you give it anymore. I was able to publish an assessment restricted to the IP address "abc.def" without getting any errors.

Checked on nightly mysql and oracle instances.
column10: IP address security setting no longer validates
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: added validation xxx.xxx.xxx which as xxxx within range 0 and 255
column48:
That doesn't work as a validation system, unfortunately. Users must be able to specify a partial address with a wildcard. All of these should be valid settings:

129.*

129.234.*

12*

129.234.782.*

Etc. If you specified a full IP address, then only the single computer that used that address could take the assessment - and that's not very useful.

Also, we need to work out a standardized warning. How about this:

Please specify a valid IP address or partial address under High Security. (Example: xxx.xx* )
column52: Fixed as suggested patterns. Please check!
column56:
This fix has not yet been added to 2.1.1.0004 on MIT stable.

I tested it on the local qa instances (coursework-s1) with the following different IP address settings:

17*
171.*
1*1.*
171.64.*
171.64.139.*
blank
abc.*
666.*

All the numbers were correctly interpreted as parts of IP addresses, and when the computer taking the test did not match the address I got the expected error message. So that's good.

When I left the IP address field blank or put in letters, I got a format error message. This is also good.

However, if I put more than one line of IP addresses in the field, it is rejected as invalid. The IP address setting was designed to accept multiple addresses, and it used to. Can you fix this, Huong?

Additional issue:

The address 666.* was accepted with no errors. Do we want to check that each octet < 256? Or do we leave it up to the user to know what a valid IP address looks like? (This is a Marc question.)
column60:
Huong,
Marc says that a wildcard character * should represent any number between 0 and 255. Is that how it currently works, and if not, can you change it? Thanks.
column64: Needs to accept multiple addresses, one per line, and to interpret * as specified by Marc.
column132: I was testing this out and it doesn't seem to accept multiple lines
column143: n/m
column150:
The problem is back, with a new wrinkle.

I can type anything into the IP address box of the High Security settings in an assessment, and Samigo will let me save it and treat it as a valid setting - as long as I don't click the checkbox. If I do click the checkbox, I get the validation error.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create or modify an assessment and look at the settings.
2. Type some gibberish in the IP box under "high security".
3. Publish the assessment.
4. Take the assessment as a student. You'll get the Access Denied message as though you were taking it from an invalid IP.
5. Go back to the authoring view and modify the assessment again. This time, click the checkbox.
6. Try to save or publish the assessment. This time, you'll get the IP validation error.

There is no checkbox to that is not an issue.
It does check for letters and does not accept it.
It check for numbers > 255 and does not accept it.
It checks for a range of more than 4 numbers eg 123.123.123.123.123 and does not accep it

But 2 other issues
It accepts a . at the end, eg, 123.123.123.123. - is that ok?
Also should it equates an empty line with *, I added 2 address masks and deleted the one so I ended up with 1 mask and 1 empty line. I was able to do the assessment from a machine whose IP address did not match the mask I put it, but because of the empty line it did. Can we remove this feature?
column167: The original bug has been fixed (no validation at all). We do need to add validation for the two cases Greg found; I'll open a new bug for that and link it to this one.

column1: [SAK-3112] WS: Security Backdoor in Authorizer's Username Field
column6: In Worksite Setup, the Authorizer's username field has a security 'backdoor' wherein a non-existent uid beginning with the word 'test' is allowed. Examples: test, tester, testertester. Other non-existent uids return this error: ! Alert: Please enter a valid username for the instructor of record.
column10: WS: Security Backdoor in Authorizer's Username Field
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: The "authorizer" in this context is just the user to whom a request is sent for information that would let the Sakai admin authorize the course roster (by manually setting the provider id in the site's realm), so while this is an issue, it has no security impact.
column48:
It is only a problem when SampleUserDirectoryProvider is used. In its userExists() function, true is returned when the user id starts with "test".

Is it used for bypassing those test users? Glenn, you might know this better than I do.

Thanks,

  • Zhen
column52: This is true just if you are using the sample / test user directory provider, and it is designed to support testing. These providers are not used in production, so I'm closing this non-issue.
column56: I think that we should change the configuration so that components.xml out of SVN and in production has no default providers configured.
column60: Should be in 2.1.1_004 but I could not find that version. L
column64: Verified in 2.1.1.004. Note that there are various error messages in the catalina.out as a result of these "missing" providers in a default OOTB setup.

column1: [SAK-3111] Inconsistent terminology
column6:
Inconsistent terminology, between course and class, can lead to confusion in Worksite Setup. Throught most of Sakai "course site" is used. There is probably some benefit in this particular part of Worksite Setup (and other related UI's) in using Class as a subset of Course, as one can envision the interface is asking for classes to be add to a course site. Some suggested changes are:

(1) After selecting "course" as the site type, the page says "Creating a New Class Site". Replace Class with Course.

(2) The text "Select course/sections that will be included in the class site", should be, "Select classes/sections that will be included in this course site.
column10: Inconsistent terminology
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column48:
The following text appears on the very first screen after clicking "new" in Worksite Setup:

"Creating a new site

Choose the type of site you want to create. Only instructors can create official class websites. Instructors and students can create project websites. NOTE: Students, if you do not see a tab for your class, contact your instructor for information about when your official class website will be available. "

Seeing that we changed "class" to "course" on the next screen, we should probably make those same changes in the above text.

column1: [SAK-3110] Case sensitivity when it comes to duplicate names in Tests and Quizzes
column6:
Duplicate file names are not allowed in Question Pools, Templates and Assessments but there is the issue of case sensitivity that is not consistent in all three sections on all three builds.

Say for example Pool1 as a Question Pool already exists, as do Template1 (as a template) and Assessment1 (as an assessment)

msql
Template and Assessment are not case sensitive (could not recreate Template1 or template1, same for Assessment1)
Questions Pool is case sensitive, i.e. cannot recreate Pool1 again, but can create pool1

hsql
Template is not case sensitive
Assessment and Question Pool are case sensitive i.e. could create pool1 and assessment1

oracle
Template is case sensitive i.e. could create template1
Assessment is case sensitive i.e. could create assessment1
Question Pool is case sensitive i.e. could create pool1

column1: [SAK-3109] Strip HTML from Pool Questions and reimplement as Link (Formerly 'It is possible to lock  yourself out from editing one of  your questions by linking the full text')
column6:
To reproduce:

1. Go to Qpool.
2. Add a question.
3. Select the complete text of the question and click on the link button in the editor. Link it somewhere.
4. Save.
5. You will be returned to the edit screen. The link will still be live on the full text of the question.

Since the method of selecting a question to edit it is to click on it, it is now permanently inaccessible, and can only be deleted and recreated.
column10: Strip HTML from Pool Questions and reimplement as Link (Formerly 'It is possible to lock  yourself out from editing one of  your questions by linking the full text')
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: SAK-3109 Closed , SAK-3115 Closed , and SAK-3116 Closed address different aspects of the interaction of HTML with authoring, the WYGIWYS editor and export/import; a solution to one will probably need to keep the others in mind.
column48: SAK-3109 Closed , SAK-3115 Closed , and SAK-3116 Closed address different aspects of the interaction of HTML with authoring, the WYGIWYS editor and export/import; a solution to one will probably need to keep the others in mind.
column52:
This is not so much an editor problem as how it interacts with the UI specification.

The link tool lets you specify a link target, if blank it means you want it to use the current window; it does what you want it to. There are a number of things unspecified here.
(Like do we want to always force external urls to pop up a new window, or give the option of reusing the new window. In the portal that means in the IFRAME, which is unreasonable, but in standalone that means navigate the the other window. If we pop a new window, do we want to generate a random window name so each link gets a new one, or reuse that window for all external links?)

This doesn't make any difference in assessment question authoring since you get a modification link, but it does in question pools, where modification is inconsistently using a link from the (HTML) question. Therefore it makes sense that we use exactly the same "Modify" link in question pools, and that is the fix I am going to do.

Fix details:
Added modify link so that question text that is a link will not lock out edit"
Files affected:
tool/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/QuestionPoolMessages.properties
tool/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/bundle/QuestionPoolMessages_nl.properties
tool/src/webapp/jsf/questionpool/questionTreeTable.jsp
Fix revision 4509.
column56:
I attach a snippet of the revised UI.

column1: [SAK-3103] Add Announcement hangs; creates duplicate entries
column6:
This bug has occured repeatedly on the collab site when adding to the SEPP and Integration worksites.

Reproducing:
1) Go to Announcement tool
2) Select Add
3) Fill in the title and body
4) select "Display to public"
5) select Email Notification "High - All Participants"

Behavior:
1) browser (tested with Mozilla 1.7.5 on RH Fedora 3) goes into busy awaiting response state for several minutes
2) eventually a "Document contains no data" dialog appears - page view never refreshes
3) multiple copies of announcement and email are generated
column10: Add Announcement hangs; creates duplicate entries
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column44:
It looks like there are 4 copies of the annc in the site, each made 3 min apart. We had something like this happen once here at UM. We couldn't track down what had happened, but think the user left the annc up on screen and some refresh kicked off every 3 min and caused the annc to get posted or something.

I just posted a high and public annc on stable oracle and it was only sent out once. With XP/N7, so perhaps it is browser/os related. Something to do w/ RH maybe?
column48: As for leaving the announcement on the screen, the "Add Announcement" operation never completed, so the view never did change. Does this action send all of the emails to the users before completing? If so, the number of emails being generated could be key to the bug. Perhaps something is timing out on the client and the "Add Announcement" action is being re-sent? All conjecture on my part, but the bug has replicated for me four times in the last week (2 announcements x-posted to SEPP and SEPP Integration).
column52:
The problem is that email notifications are sent out, one at a time, to all users before the posting request completes. The process will eventually complete successfully, but end-users or their browsers may not wait around for it to complete, as it may take a long time.

Then if the end-user tries again, another round of announcement notifications are sent out.

Add the problems caused by SAK-3219 Closed , and I think we have a complete picture of what's going on with announcement notification.

To solve this we need to speed up email notification sending and/or move it off the request thread so the user gets a quick response, even if the mailings lag after.
column56: I vote for moving it off the request thread - the user shouldn't have to wait around for a back-end process (sending email) to complete.
column60: I'm pretty sure this has been fixed... if we see it again we can re-open it.
column64: This will be hard to test on a qa server since we probably need hundreds of participants in a site to trigger the problem. Glenn believes it is fixed so am closing and we can reopen if we see it on collab when that goes to 2.2.

column171: MAINT TEAM REVIEW: This issue is reported agaisnt a version of Sakai that is no longer supported and comments indicate a difficulty in reproducing the error.
column181: We have been seeing this on 2-8. On user tried a couple of different browsers. Logs show that the browser is resending the request.
column185:
I have verified that something is doing retries, at least for GET. With a simple jsp

<%
Thread.sleep(10*60*1000);
%>

localhost_access shows several queries even though I only did one. This is with my desktop system as the server, so there's no load balancer. (I had wondered if it is doing the retry.) I haven't been able to see more than one query in a tcpdump, so it almost looks like something is happening within tomcat. But I'm not convinced that I know the whole story here yet.

I can see only two solutions (1) return immediately without waiting for the email to be sent. (2) add a hidden variable with a random number, and reject duplicates with the same number.

(1) is what I'd like to see. The code doesn't return any meaningful status from the email, so there's no real reason to wait. Unfortunately the actual process of saving and sending email is so convoluted that i have no idea how to do that. I'll probably do (2) locally.

While I can produce weird results with my test, I've been unable to replicate the problem with announcements, even after putting in a 5 min delay. However I have users who get the problem every time in production. As you may imagine, this is very irritating to them.
column189:
The simplest solution would be to do

EmailService.sendToUsers(immediate, headers, message);

in kernel util EmailNotification.java in a separate thread. Presumably announcements isn't the only application that could have this problem, whatever it is. And there's no status to wait for, since sendToUser returns no information.
column193: see diff for one approach. It forks off the actual email send process. This should avoid the long pause in returning to the user, and thus avoid the problem from happening. Since no usable status is returned to the user from send, there's no obvious advantage to waiting for it. I'm doing it in the kernel because the same sort of issue could occur anywhere that this code is used.

column1: [SAK-3099] Performance problem - database connection pooling failure
column6: Database connection pooling with Oracle configuration (and perhaps with others as well) is failing to keep connections in the pool and reused, resulting in extra time to create new connections and overall poor system performance.
column10: Performance problem - database connection pooling failure
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
While bringing up Sakai Collab with the 2.1.0 software, we discovered a performance problem with the Oracle configuration. Database connection pooling is not working properly.

for 2.1.0 users, If you are using Oracle you can avoid this problem by editing the kernel/db-components components.xml file, and remove the following configuration:

<!-- The default read-only state of connections created by this pool. -->
<property name="defaultReadOnly">
<value>false</value>
</property>

By leaving the "defaultReadOnly" setting unset, the database pooling will again work properly.

If you are working from source, you can edit it before you build and deploy:

sakai/kernel/db-components/src/webapp/WEB-INF/components.xml

If you are working with the binary, you can edit the deployed file from the components package (usually found in tomcat/components, but you may have placed them elsewhere). Do this while Sakai is not running:

tomcat/components/sakai-db-components/WEB-INF/components.xml

When you catch up with a Sakai version that has this fixed, your change to this file will no longer be necessary (but can be left in place).

column1: [SAK-3096] When you save a question into a question pool that already has a copy, an exception is thrown
column6:
While you can save a question from editing into only a single question pool (it will be deleted from the former one), it's possible to copy a question in qpool and then try to save the same question from the assessment edit screen. This throws an exception.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create two question pools.
2. Go into an assessment and save a question to Pool 1.
3. Go into Qpool and copy that question from Pool 1 to Pool 2.
4. Go back into the assessment and save the same question as in step 2 to Pool 2.
5. An exception is thrown.
column10: When you save a question into a question pool that already has a copy, an exception is thrown
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: Margaret got a slightly different error when testing this bug on the MIT MySQL instance; it's attached as 12.2.saving-questions.rtf.
column48: So Lydia and I talked about this today and agreed that the "copy" in step 3 will now be a literal copy and not a link to the same object as it was before. Whew!
column52:
I need to document all the scenarios a literal copy might have in questionpool and authoring before changing it since it affects a lot of files and use cases.

For now I've just fixed the exception. Please note that a question in an assessment can only be assigned to one part. So if it's first assigned to Pool1 and you modify the item to reassigned it to Pool2, then it's no longer in Pool1. If you want them to be in both pools you will have to then go to the question pool and copy the question from Pool2 to Pool1. At this point all 3 copies of the items (2 in qpool and one in the assessment) are all linked to each other and modification done in one place is reflected in all 3 places. Hmm, Maybe this is what we want?

I tested this on qa1-us (oracle), qa1-uk (mysql) and our local nightly instance coursework-s1:8080 (mysql), using Laura's steps above.

On the oracle instance everything worked fine. At the end of the steps I had two copies of the question in pool 2, and one copy in pool 1.

On both the mysql instances, I ended up with 1 copy of the question in pool 2, and nothing in pool 1.

Steps:

1. create pool A and pool B (both empty)

2. Edit a question in an assessment. (both still empty)

3. save the question to pool A. (now A has 1 copy, B has nothing.)

4. View pool A. Copy the question to pool B. (now A has one copy, B has one copy.)

5. Return to Assessmetns and edit the same question. This time, save it to pool B. (Now A should have 1 copy and B should have 2 copies.)

6. Return to question pools. A is now empty and B only has one copy. hey!

Are the questions still linked instead of being separate copies in mysql, maybe?

column6:
Creating a New Class Site
========================================

column10: Awkward UI in Worksite setup
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
(1) They are checkboxes, rather than radio buttons, becuase you can select more than one course/section to include in the course site.

(2) In addition to selecting from the automatically generated list, one might also need to manually enter additional courses, hence the "not listed above" or "manual" option.

So, while at least one choice is required, the need for multiple choices needs to be supported as well.
column48: Might consider using the "required field" marker with some text, such as "Please select at least one of the following", to communicate to the user that they must select something here.
column52: The UI for course site creation has changed quite a bit so this no longer applies. Please reopen if there is a related issue.

column1: [SAK-3093] Inability to take action on a missing item in file storage system
column6: Inability to take action on a missing item in file storage system. For instance, a file is quarentined due to infection. The entry is still in the database but the file is no longer there. If the user attempts to revise the properties of the file (to upload a clean version) or delete the item they are presented with this message: "Alert: Operation could not be completed at this time." I'm not sure how to replicate this on a generic instance since, to my knowledge, none of them are pointed to a separate file storage system. I've been able to consistantly replicate this here at IU where we have this type of set up.
column10: Inability to take action on a missing item in file storage system
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
This is an edge case that can be detected only by trying to edit the file or retrieve it. When the problem is detected, Sakai probably has no way of telling whether it is transient (temporary unavailability of the file system, for example) or permanent (a corrupted or quarrantined file that will never be restored). The current work-around is that the db admin can track down the record and remove it from the database.

If the decision is made that Sakai should attempt to deal with these problems, we need a UI design for this functionality, Should this be assigned to Kristol for a proposed design? If the decision is made that Sakai should attempt to deal with these problems, other questions to answered include what actions should be available to the user in this case, what users should have ability to do anything about this, whether a different error message would be more appropriate, etc.
column48: We will revise Resources so a site maintainer can delete entries when the resource content body cannot be accessed in the server's file system. When that happens, it should be logged.
column52: This fix should allow deletion of a resource to proceed even in case of an error trying to access a resource body in the filesystem. The error will be logged with a warning that there may be an orphaned resource body.
column56:
Seth Theriault <slt@columbia.edu> asked for an explanation of how this decision was reached.

Several people suggested that for the circumstances in which this kind of deletion occurs there is little or no harm if the database record is deleted even if a resource body is left orphaned in the process. I discussed this proposed approach with Glenn and he agreed. We were blocking a user action for no good reason. If the resource body was inaccessible to users anyway, there is no harm in removing references to it from the user interface.

There is the potential that over time we get some orphaned resource bodies.The resource body in this case was orphaned anyway. As a result of this fix, the logs contain two sets of entries, the first concerning the failed attempt to access the resource body and delete it, and the second concerning the deletion of the database record without deleting a resource body. The first log entry contains the exact path where the resource body should have been. The second draws attention to the fact that the database record was deleted and the resource body was not. This gives admins tools to track down orphaned resource bodies if there is a problem.

BTW, ContentHosting now creates records in a separate database table about deleted resources. That change was implemented for 2.1 by Himansu Tripathy at Indiana University. I'm not sure whether his code succeeds in making a record for a deleted resource where access to the resource body fails. But the purpose of the delete-table is to make it easier for admins to restore resources that are deleted accidentally. In the case of a resource with a quarantined or missing resource body, it would not be possible to restore anyway.
column60: Since the stable instances aren't hooked up to a file storage system, I had the nightly2 maint branch pointed at one, had the file on the storage system removed, and was able to confirm that I could delete the file

column1: [SAK-3086] IP address checkbox setting ignored?
column6: If an ip address is specified to restrict access to a quiz, the checkbox in the interface becomes useless. It the ip address is listed in the database for an assessment, that ip address is used to restrict that assessment, regardless of the checkbox setting. However, changing the ip address to an empty input field saves an empty input to the database, and no ip address is used to restrict the assessment. The assessment taking mechanism does not check the metadata table, where this checkbox value of true or false is stored, but basis ipaddress restriction on actual entries in the securedip table for that assessment.
column10: IP address checkbox setting ignored?
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44: I asked Margaret to verify this in 2.1 (Benjamin tested in 2.1) If it's a bug, we probably want to disable the text box until the checkbox is clicked. Check with Marc on the spec.
column48:
Yup, this is true in 2.1 too. The checkbox for the IP address setting doesn't make any difference. If there is a number in the text field, Samigo will use that as the restricted address; if there is no number, Samigo won't restrict the address at all.

Possibly we should take out the checkbox altogether, just like the ones for delivery dates.

column1: [SAK-3085] If a timelimit is imposed on an assessment and the user quits the assessment early, the interface allows the user to take the assessment again, and the timelimit begins where the student left off at on the previous attempt.
column6:
If a timelimit is imposed on an assessment and the user quits the assessment early, the interface allows the user to take the assessment again, and the timelimit begins where the student left off at on the previous attempt.

a. In this way, a student could look at the question, cancel the quiz, look up the answer in as much time as they wanted (assuming timelimit does not pass the submission deadline for the assessment, for Samigo does check how many submissions have been made and the submission dates, though late submissions may be allowed by the instructor), and then resume assessment later.

b. The interface contains no control for this, except a field in the database in assessaccesscontrol table, the retryallowed field, which defaults to null. Assuming this field is similar to submissionsallowed field, null represents infinitely many retries, whereas a value would indicate exactly how many retries were allowed.
column10: If a timelimit is imposed on an assessment and the user quits the assessment early, the interface allows the user to take the assessment again, and the timelimit begins where the student left off at on the previous attempt.

column1: [SAK-3070] IE includes extra space when apply formatting
column6:
In Firefox, if you double-click on a word to select it, it selects the word and the trailing space. When you click on a format link (bold, italics), it applies the markup to exclude the trailing space (correctly I think) like this:

in this wiki i am _bolding_ some words and ~italicizing~ some others

But if you do the same operation in IE, it selects in the same way but applies the markup differently to INCLUDE the trailing space, viz.:

in this wiki i am __bolding __ some words and ~~italicizing ~~ some others

I think the IE behaviour should be changed to act like FF.
column10: IE includes extra space when apply formatting
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
I assume that for the following example:

in this wiki i am bolding some words (note: two spaces between bolding and some)

if I double click on the word bolding and bold it, it should become:

in this wiki i am _bolding_ some words

and not:

in this wiki i am __bolding __ some words

also: Should this feature only trim from the end? Or should it trim from the start?
column48: Formatting applied to whitespace is meaningless, so I guess a reasonable approach would be that the formatting should start before the first non-whitespace character at the start of the the selection, and end before the first trailing whitespace character(s) at the end of the selection.
column52: verified

column1: [SAK-3067] Netscape 7.1 display of Chat inputs
column6:
Textarea and buttons to add to chat get displayed top right of the Chat tool viewport. See screenshot provided by Jan Kulmann (Universitaet Bremen)

At one point the chat tool used a presentation table to separate all the iframes - this was substituted for a box model. Netscape 7.1 floats an iframe unless the flow is cleared and the iframe is specifically told to act as a block element (or wrapped in a default block element). This is what happened to the chat control. Netscape 7.2 and 8 has no such problems. Netscape 7.1 is not a supported browser. Fix anyways.

The javascript Exception is apparently a result of a bug in Firefox's autocomplete (see http://www.thescripts.com/forum/thread145213.html).

The problem is resolved by including

autocomplete="off"

in the input field, but we have no way to do that at present, as the JSF inputText tag doesn't support that until JSF 1.2 (http://java.sun.com/javaee/javaserverfaces/1.2/docs/tlddocs/h/inputText.html).

column1: [SAK-36660] score entry for unsubmitted assessment
column6:
In T&Q, as admin, went to the "Scores" link of a Published Assessment
Only one student had taken and submitted the assessment. All other student had the "No Submission" status
Went to one of the those "No Submission" student and adjusted the score
The score was updated, but the status remained "No Submission"

Went to Gradebook, and the new grade for the student is listed.

ISSUE:
1. Should admn be allowed to adjust the score of a student who has not submitted anything.
2. Should a "no submission" grade show up in Gradebook

Just checking.
column10: score entry for unsubmitted assessment
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column44: I think this is the correct behavior, right, Marc?
column48:
1 - Yes, the instructor should be able to set a no submission to zero, but that should not be automatic.
2- A no submission is equivalent to a null and I believe should be sent to the Gradebook. I'm not sure how this would impact the calculations going on there.
column52: Can I assign it back to you? Let me know what you hear from Owen.
column56:
Following-up on my email to Marc & Lydia:

This will probably sound familiar: the Gradebook side is almost always considered from the angle of the overall cumulative grade, i.e., course grade. I think the decision – sounds like it was discussed by Berkeley and Stanford at some point – was that that non-submissions must get a default numerical value so that the cumulative score never had an undetermined state. And the choice of zero followed logically.

To answer the other part of Marc's question about administrative adjustment of these non-submissions after-the-fact: yes, we think it works pretty well, especially given the rigidity of the rule mentioned above. It allows some flexibility for the instructor .. while again preventing the cumulative grade from ever being indeterminate.

Finally, to address the "No Submission" status issue: it would seem to make sense for that to remain. Technically there was never a submission and leaving the status unchanged even after a manual adjustment of the score is a nice way to leave some record behind that this score was handled differently. The comments field could perhaps then be a place for whoever is making the adjustment to explain the circumstances and decision .
column60: Ok, now that I've read the 2.0 Functional Requirements more carefully and gone back to play with the non-submissions from Samigo to Gradebook, I'm seeing why Marc raised the issue of sending over a null. As it stands right now, for a student who made no submission for an assessment that is now finished the entry in the Gradebook is a blank/null. So this deserves another look. I'll investigate some more.
column64: It seems, however, like the responsibility for re-setting non-submissions from blank to zero would likely remain on the Samigo side. Could add something in perhaps for assessments as they become unavalable/retracted. Gradebook certainly has no way to know.
column132: Is this still an issue as of 2.2.0?
column143:
I'm rethinking this issue with more of an instructor perspective (see my rationale below) and believe that someone not submitting an assessment should, by default, get a zero not a null.

However, the instructor should also know the submission status as well, so I propose that a non-submission be listed like so:

"0 (No Submission)"

Obviously, if an assessment has been submitted and the score is still zero, then the score would be displayed "0".

Here's my rationale: What is the real-world numerical value of not "turning in" (submitting) an test/assignment/problem set (assessment)? I think unless you are an instructor really committed to the concept of an empty set, not turning in something is a zero.

Also, having it as a zero is less work for the instructor in terms of getting the most likely score sent to the gradebook, especially since the gradebook requires some non-null number in order to calculate a cumulative grade/score for the course.

Still the instructor should be able to change this zero by using the adjustment column. (+1 for having a pulse

Assigning to Owen for sign-off then back to Lydia if he agrees.
column150:
Thanks for the query, Marc. Actually, if I'm understanding this correctly, there's really no sign off from our side. As Ray reminds us, Gradebook will always continue to let Samigo decide what instructors see in the score column:

Unscored assignments are equivalent to an unsubmitted external assessment score. Both are stored as null values in the DB. When calculations of the course grade are done, null scores of counted assignments are treated as if they were "0".

If what you're proposing is that Samigo will now set the score to zero, that's fine with Gradebook. The outcome is the same.

I guess the one part I didn't quite understand was about the "0 (No Submission)" string. This string will replace the "No Submission" status display in the Assessment? That makes sense. Then the instructor sees a 0 in both Samigo and Gradebook. Should lessen confusion.
column154:
I forgot that we actually already have a Status column that says "No Submission" if the student hasn't submitted an assessment. So, really the only change that needs to happen is that students who have not submitted have a zero. I made this explicit in the mockup on page 6i:
http://issues.sakaiproject.org/confluence/download/attachments/22266/grading.pdf
column158:
Marc, maybe I'm misunderstanding what you said. Are you saying that for every student who hasn't submitted a test, we send a 0 to gradebook? Right now there are 2 ways to send it.
1. when a student clicks on 'submit for grading' , we calculate the student's score and send it to gradebook, if the 'send to gradebook' option is checked.
2. if 'send to gradebook' option is off, and the instructor turns it on, at that point, we send all the scores samigo has, whether it's from student's submission, or from instructors' adjustment. If a student hasn't submitted and the instructor hasn't adjusted the scores, there are no grading records in Samigo and we don't send gradebook anything. In gradebook, it has null and treats it as 0.

If you want to send 0 for no-submissions, when would you want to send it? When the assessment is published?
column167:
My understanding was that the GB asks SAMigo for scores rather than the other way around, so if GB queries SAM for scores and there is no submission for student X then a zero is sent. However, I think if I'm understanding Owen correctly, GB may give a no submission a zero anyway. In that case, then really the only change would be to put a zero for every student until an assessment is submitted.

One other thing, when calculating stats, it seems like they they should be against all students zeros included.
column171:
I'll throw in my two-cents here from when we built our own gradebook awhile back and struggled with the null versus zero issue; for us it turned out to be an important, useful distinction. Three relevant features of that gradebook were that it supported points-only grading, it used an instructor defined curve to provide letter grade equivelants, and instructors often downloaded the speardsheet version (or just cut-and-pasted from the table in the browser) to look at over the course of the semster. In determining the points to letter grade translation for a given item, the curve was pinned to the average score for an entry; however, the average score did not include students who had not submitted the assignment. (The class letter grade, as opposed to the item letter grade, however, effectilvey treated the non-submissions as 0's because it looked at the total points a student had at that point in the semester, and did its calculation using the average total points a student had, rather than summing the avareage scores on each entry.) Ignoring non-submissions was done by leaving cells blank (a "null" value), as opposed to entering a zero (which was a perfectly valid entry under some circumstances for when a student did complete an activity and managed to score a 0!) This avoided the problem where a few students who skipped early exams worth a lot of points (say 250) and would've massively skewed the application of the curve in determining an activity's letter grade equivalent. (Our letter grade equivalent for a blank cell was an "I' for incomplete.)

Even if Gradebook calculates averages and letter grades in a better or more customizable way, it is probably still very useful to distinguish between a non-submission and 0-points for folks working with the grade data on their own in Excel (or any other spreadsheet or statistical applicaiton). It gives them the opportunity to treat these circumstances differently; a number of functions in Excel (and many other applications) allow you to easily treat null (blank values) and true 0's differently. I'd also strongly advocate using the blank cell as the null value, rather than a text string like "0 (No Submission)", as the latter impairs one's ability to easily work with the data in these external applications.
column181:
Hi, Marc. Gradebook doesn't actively poll Samigo to see if it has any scores to deliver. Instead, Samigo uses Gradebook services to create and manage "external assessments" in Gradebook. These external assessments in the Gradebook have null values per student initially. Any score then sent over for a particular student via the updateExternal service replaces the null.

In addition, Gradebook has a concept of Course Grade. It gets generated in Gradebook when the instructor clicks on the Course Grade button. For the sake of calculating a course grade, a null value won't due. So any uncompleted external assessment gets a value of zero for the sake of calculation. Same thing for any other assignments (i.e., those not externally managed) in Gradebook at that moment. From the Gradebook Help:

  1. Click Course Grade below the listed assignments. You will see a list of all the students in the Gradebook. For each student, the points earned, the letter
    grade, and a percentage will be displayed. The letter grade and percentage are based on the total points available for the entire course. A zero is assigned
    automatically to all assignments that have not yet been completed.

Anyway, that's my understanding. I'll let the Gradebook Founding Fathers [Oliver, you there?] chime in with all the wherefore's and therefore's and address Peter's interesting observations.
column185:
An excerpt from Diana Perpich's comment on SAK-2077 Closed (Assignments Option for Automatically Accepting Resubmissions), which touches on the null versus zero distinction when a student fails to submit their work:

"...Will the instructor be mad at "the system" for making her page through blank submissions? We've got instructors who post optional assignments. Would the system auto-submit these as well? How does the Gradebook currently import null submissions? Zeros? Making the instructor go back and seek out auto-submitted work and treat it differently will create a whole new set of support issues."

column1: [SAK-3055] Add SpringBean job type to scheduler
column6:
This would allow someone to schedule a spring bean for execution. The spring bean would implement the Job interface and would register itself with the SchedulerManager. The actual job used would then be something like:
org.sakaiproject.component.app.scheduler.jobs.SpringBeanJob

and would allow the user to pick from a list of registered beans. This would have the advantage of allowing an application developer to register jobs without modification to the scheduler package. It would also allow more complicated configuration for the executed bean.

So, I would create my spring bean, "org.theospi.wearhouse.DataWarehouseJob" and register that with SchedulerManager in my init method. When the user goes to schedule, they would pick "SpringBeanJob" and then have another list in the UI that would have "DataWarehouseJob". The choice of bean name would be stored as a job parameter (supported by quartz). The SpringBeanJob's execute would look up the bean from the passed in param and then call it's execute method.

column1: [SAK-3054] When moving files within Resources using Webdav, all site members receive an email notification, none was requested!
column6:
Using WebDAV to transfer files from PC(or mac) to Sakai - no email notification.

When you use WebDAV to transfer files between folders that already exist in Resources everyone on the site receives an email. For example:

1) move a file into a folder
2) move a file out of a folder
3) move a file from one folder to another folder

We've discovered how to stop this behavior from happening -

Click Preferences
Under Resources
Select "Do not send me low priority resource notifications" then "update preferences"

Is this a feature or a bug?
