column1: [SAK-3052] When adding a file to resources, Title is taken from first file uploaded
column6: If you select a file to upload and specify it in Choose a file, the File name is posted to the Title field. However, if the user decides to change the file being uploaded (before posting anything - just changing the path in Choose a file, the Title Field is not updated to reflect the new file.
column10: When adding a file to resources, Title is taken from first file uploaded
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
This is an issue that you cannot solve for everyone, you're going to have to make someone un-happy. Some use cases would call for it to auto-update to the newly browsed value, some would not.

For instance, if you select a file to Upload, say lab3_v1.3.doc, then manually edit the auto-populated Title to read differently, say "River Succession", then you realize you've picked the wrong file, so you browse and select a new one, say lab4_v1.3.doc, but you're happy with the Title you've already typed in, so you don't want the Title being automatically updated. However, let's say you browse and select "Mesa Ecosystems.doc", and you would be happy with that as the Resource Title, except you've selected the wrong file, so now you browse and select "River Succession.doc", but the Title doesn't re-auto-populate when you've browsed to the new file, and if you don't notice you need to manually update the Title, then you end up with a Resource with the wrong name, so you would want the Title automatically updated.
column48: This is the correct behavior. We do not set the title. The user does that. We just seed a default value in the form if the user has not already assigned a value. If the user selects a file and the title is blank, the filename is placed in the title field. If the user then changes the file, the title is not blank. We have no way of telling whether the value in the title field is the one the user wants, so we leave it alone. We could attempt to deal with dozens of possible special cases in which someone believes that we should be able to intuit the user's intentions, but this is fragile code to begin with. Several of these special cases have been discussed and in each case (including the one proposed here) the decision has been made to keep any existing entry rather than risking erasing information supplied by the user.
column52: non-issue

column1: [SAK-3051] Duplicate Alert if invalid RSS field is entered
column6:
If you enter an invalid RSS field (options for news tool) and click Update Options the following error occurs:

Alert: http://newsss.bbc.co.uk/rss/newsonline_uk_edition/front_page/rss.xmlis an invalid RSS feed.

But if you click Update options again, you are out of options and the following messages are displayed:

tlang.getString("gen.alert") Unable to obtain news feed from http://newsss.bbc.co.uk/rss/newsonline_uk_edition/front_page/rss.xml

Unable to obtain news feed from http://newsss.bbc.co.uk/rss/newsonline_uk_edition/front_page/rss.xml
column10: Duplicate Alert if invalid RSS field is entered
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
SAK-3788 Closed is a duplicate of this issue.

This issue does exist in 2.1.2.

Enter an invalid RSS feed, click Update Options, receive a good error, then click Update Options again, receive the bad error.
column48: Peter, is there a subversion revision for this fix?
column52: This should have been resolved in the 2.1.2 release. Unfortunately, there were not sufficiant QA resources to test this in that cycle. If you find this is still a problem, please reopen the ticket.
column56: still exists in 2.2.0. - Sam Ottenhoff
column60: Selenium script to replicate in 2.2.0 is attached.
column64:
The root of this problem is that the state value for the URL is being saved before the feed is validated and the block to validate the feed isn't used at all if the url submitted is the same as the saved one... thus if you submit the same invalid feed twice in a row validation is skipped and it gets saved as if it were a valid feed and you are sent to the news view with errors due to an invalid feed.

I have 2 possible fixes working, tested and ready to commit on my local dev instance:

The behavior of the Page Title and Tool Title fields is that if a non valid value is entered, the last valid value is filled back into the form. We can have the URL do the same thing thus avoiding this issue.

OR

We can leave the last submitted invalid value in the URL field, which is better in the sense that if a user is only a few characters off they can more easily edit the URL and try again. This type of behavior might be better for all 3 fields?

Thoughts?

Both options are quick easy changes.
column132: My vote is for the 2nd - leave the invalid URL value in the field, so the user can fix the typo.
column143: I would also vote for the 2nd. Thanks for the fix.
column150: Option #2 is submitted, thanks for all the good input!

column1: [SAK-3041] Inconsistency with student and instructor view of grades
column6:
On the student's view of the tool:

1. the "Cumulative Score" includes the scores that are not going to be counted towards the final grade.

2. the possible points figure excludes points for an assignment that the student has not yet taken, but which will count towards the final grade.

My question is: Isn't this a little skewed? The student sees a 75% (in this case) score which, in my view, does not reflect the actual current status in the class.

Just to extend my point: If I look at the "Roster" page of the admin/Instructor view, the "Cumulative Score" does NOT include the points that are not counted towards the final grade, yet on the student view it does.
column10: Inconsistency with student and instructor view of grades
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
With 2.1, the Instructor has the ability to decide what is factored into a course grade. This new functionality should have prompted a careful review of the grade displays in all of the views. Pre-2.1, because all columns were automatically included in the grade calculations and blank entries had (and still have) to be treated as zeros, there was a perceived need to "protect" users from seemingly bad grade data. If it hasn't already, this need will almost certainly disappear once selected release of columns and a manual gradebook mode are introduced to the app. It will be up to Instructors to manage the display of scores and grade data as carefully as they see fit.

That's a long way of saying that, for simplicity's sake, I think we want to display only data from current grade calculations in all contexts.

column52: Modified the text to have more consistency and simplicity
column56: Assigned to Owen for review.

column6:
1.Schedule Item is made with repeating freqency.
2.Under "Ends", the specific date radio button is picked and the date is specified earlier than the event date

column10: Schedule repeating item has end date ending in past (for frequency) - no alert is given
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Just tested the tool at mit stable site, which is running 2.1.1.002-mysql.
I created a recurrent event, and set the start date to be 1 day earlier. The alert message shows up when I clicked "Save event". So this is not an issue any more.
column48: Joanne, the issues is that the alert should be shown to the user sooner in the process. The alert should appear in the Fequency view of the item when the user clicks on the "Save Frequency" button. The date can be validated at that point, as the start date is always set to something before this. If the user has picked a bad date, then they should be notified and given the opportunity to fix it while still in the Frequency view. Thanks.
column52:
This issue has been discussed before, and the tool team's decided not to show an alert in the frequency editing page – because the user may adjust the starting time in the event editing page, after saving the frequency setting.

If a user purposely set the "Ends" date to be earlier than the current date, I am sure the user will adjust the starting date for the same event, unless he forgot it, which will be a rare case. Adding the alert message in the frequency page for the rare condition, will give normal users extra steps, which I'd like to avoid.

If the user missed changing the starting date, there is an alert when saving the event: "The ending date is earlier than the starting date. Change it please."

So I won't do any change at this moment.
column56:
Personally, I would prefer if the user could get the alert in Frequency itself. However, if we are going to stick with the current system I suggest a more specific error message - specifying taht the error is within frequency. Example:

Alert: The End date in frequency is earlier than the start date of the event."

I feel users still need to be guided to the frequency part of the tool.
column60:
Nihar, good suggestion!

Joanne, I'll turn the change in interface behavior into a Feature Request, so it can be considered when the look-and-feel is next redesigned. In the meantime, could you please update the error message so that it is more informative and Resolve the issue? Thanks.

column1: [SAK-3031] Error when copying from sakai site to desktop: "requested header not found"
column6:
with some MS Windows clients webDAV gives the follwoing error when copying files from sakai to the Windows desktop,
although it works fine from the Windows desktop to sakai:

An error ocurred while copying the file. The requested header was not found"

it turns out that the Windows client (some clients as it seems) is expecting a "last-modifed" header which is not sent by
Sakai in the GET method. I added the following to "doGet" in legacy/dav/src/java/org/sakaiproject/dav/DavServlet.java

protected void doGet(HttpServletRequest request,
HttpServletResponse response)
throws IOException, ServletException {

+ // Retrieve the resources
+ DirContextSAKAI resources = getResourcesSAKAI();
+
+ ResourceInfoSAKAI resourceInfo = new ResourceInfoSAKAI(path, resources);
+ if (! resourceInfo.collection)

{ + response.setDateHeader("Last-Modified", resourceInfo.date); + }

and it worked fine in old 1.0, and 2.1.003 with Goliath and MS Windows (xp and w2k pro). This seems to be specific to
some Windows versions.

sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030 (sakai 2.1.006, 2.1.003, 1.0)

column1: [SAK-3029] helpEnabled setting not working correctly
column6:
If you set

helpEnabled=false

in sakai.properties, the portal no longer generates the "?" help icons in the tool title bars, but still erroneously includes Help on the worksite tool list.

This actually produces the opposite effect to what we want - help icons to remain in the tool title bars, but Help suppressed on the worksite tool list. In resolving this, perhaps 2 options could be used, e.g.: helpIconEnabled and helpToolEntryEnabled (or similar).

-------- Original Message --------
Subject: Re: How to disable help in worksite tool list?
Date: Tue, 29 Nov 2005 19:57:19 -0500 (EST)
From: Zhen Qian <zqian@umich.edu>
To: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>
CC: sakai-dev <sakai-dev@collab.sakaiproject.org>
References: <27010536.1133282846696.JavaMail.tomcat5@sharkfin.ds.itd.umich.edu> <4264952.1133297757443.JavaMail.tomcat5@mahimahi.ds.itd.umich.edu>

This might be a bug. The includePageNav() function in
CharonPortal.java is the place to look for. The function is not
getting "helpEnabled" value from configuration service and always
outputs "help" tool tab. "helpEnabled" value should be true if
missing in sakai.properties file.

In the same file, includeTitle() is doing the right thing. It shows
or hides the "help" icon inside tool title bar based on "helpEnabled"
setting.

Thanks,

Zhen Qian
Sakai Developer
University of Michigan

column1: [SAK-3025] Checkmark in Auto-Submit being unset when a test is published
column6: The checkmark in the Auto-submit box in Timed Assessment settings is being unchecked when a test is published. According to Lydia, the test is still effectively set to autosubmit; it appears to be a display problem. This occurs in all three instances.
column10: Checkmark in Auto-Submit being unset when a test is published
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column44:
Hi Laura,

I need more information about how this should be fixed.
1. so a timedAssessment is submitted automatically regardless about the settings? If that is the case, there is no point having the check box in the setting screen.

2. "For timed assessments, auto-submit should be selected unless you allow late student submissions after the time limit." - this line is not making sense to me. If you allow late submission to a timed assessment, wouldn't the assessment be submitted automatically like if you are doing it on time?

My opinion is get rid of the check box and the line and just auto-submit when the time is up whether u are on time or late.

Can you check the spec with Lydia & Marc and let me know how this should be fixed. Thanks.

Daisy
column48:
Right now, the autosubmit checkmark works like this:

1. Create a test. The test will have the autosubmit checkbox ticked and greyed out.
2. Turn on timed assessment and assign a time.
2. Publish the test.
3. The published test will have the timed assessment checkbox on and the time but the auto-submit checkbox will be empty.

However:

4. Take the test.
5. The test will still auto-submit.

If you instead
1. Create a test.
2. Turn on timed assessment.
3. The auto-submit box will now ungrey and can be unchecked.
4. Uncheck it and assign a time.
5. Publish the test.
6. The published test will look just like the above – with the timed assessment checkbox on, the time set, but the autosubmit checkbox empty.

But if you:

7. Take the test.
8. The test will not auto-submit.

This is not critical, since the assessment will behave as it was set up to do, but could be confusing to anyone looking at the published settings.

In regards to late submissions – in this case, late means having taken more than the assigned amount of tme for the test, not having taken the test at a later date than supposed to. Apparently some teachers wish to be able to do this, which is why the auto-submit checkbox exists and can be turned off.
column52: Affects 2.0.1 too, as reported in duplicate SAK-3088 Closed .
column56:
Laura,

this is also reported as SAK-3578 Closed which has been fixed.

From Lance:
No in fact we agree that if it is a timed assessment that auto-submit should be on. Thanks, L

----Original Message----
From: "Marc Brierley" <brierley@stanford.edu>
To: "daisyf@stanford.edu" <daisyf@stanford.edu>
Cc: "Speelmon, Lance D" <lance@indiana.edu>; "May, Megan M" <mmmay@indiana.edu>; "Margaret Petit" <marith@stanford.edu>; "Lydia L Li" <lydial@stanford.edu>
Sent: 1/23/06 5:34 PM
Subject: Re: SAK-3578 Closed - timed assessment realted

Oops, in the fury to get the whole time-on-the-server thing worked out, I forgot about this option in Settings. I'm inclined to remove the option since I'm not sure what benefit it gives the student or instructor. It seems that if you don't automatically "Submit for Grading" when time is up, then the student must do some manual action to make sure that this happens. Requiring that manual action seems fraught with mistakes ("My time was up, so I thought I couldn't do anything else").

The only rationale I can think of for keeping this option is when you want to allow students to not anything rather than submitting a bad assessment. Does IU have some use case that was covered by this option?

-mARC

column1: [SAK-3023] Forms Published to a site are erroneously published globally
column6: Creating a form in the Meta Object tool and publishing it to the site, essentially did the global publish rather than just publishing for the worksite. I did some testing, and if I create a form in a worksite but don't publish it, it appears across all of my sites, but only to me (no other users in my sites). If I create a form and publish it, it is available to everyone with a worksite. Based on the directions and the "suggest for global publish" button, all forms should be site specific until accepted for global publish.

column52: Tested this on stable mysql and oracles but I'm unsure of the desired behavior so I'm checking with the subject mattter experts. What I've found is that the form is available in any site resources as long as the user was in the site that the form was published to.
column56:
I've been told that the form should only appear in the resources of the site it was published in.

1) Create Form
2) publish it to site A.
3) Go to site B.
4) Form is available in site B (to the participants in site A only)
column60:
This is working as expected in head and at http://nightly2.sakaiproject.org:8081/portal

The problem is, the design is to have the form available to members of the site. In nightly2 above, i have two sites, "jde test" and "jde test2". If you join jde test, you will only see the form "jdetestform", if you join jde test 2, you will see both forms.

Since members are allowed to add items anywhere from the resources, we need to have all forms they have access to available to them.
column64: I talked with Jay Fern, and he agrees that it is supposed to work this way, but that he would like an enhancement to change the way it works. He should be adding an enhancement.
